story:
Introduction

Hello! 

I am Matthew Quek, a Singaporean singer-songwriter, executive movie producer, actor, Special Education Needs (SEN) Counsellor and Educator.

I have invisible Special Education Needs (SEN) which were only diagnosed during my National Service after going through much trauma, isolation and discrimination throughout much of my school life.

Short Film Project

We aim to produce a meaningful and impactful short film entitled "Essentially Yours", and we appeal for your support to realise this project.

  • This film will be based on a first-person portrayal of the life of an individual with autism/ASD/Asperger's and multiple special needs living during the COVID-19 lockdown phase, featuring especially, the struggles his caregivers face in the midst of unemployment, retrenchment, discrimination and mental health challenges.

 

  • Although largely fictitious in nature, it will be based on real-life accounts of such individuals

What We Need 

  • This film project has already been officially supported and granted partial funding by MCCY (Ministry of Culture, Community & Youth) via the OSF (Our Singapore Fund). We are immensely thankful for their support and endorsement.

  • However, in order to realise this vision, we need to raise an additional $30k for the project.

 

  • We hope to produce and release this movie during the first half of 2021 as we would like to bring greater awareness to the difficult reality of those living with such challenges daily.

Achieving the Vision with YOUR Help

  • We hope to inspire children and youths with SEN to invest their efforts and time to produce and showcase their artistic works and areas of talent.

 

  • Our desire is to see children and youths with SEN meaningfully integrated into Singaporean society, whether at school, work or play.

 

  • Through this project and your kind financial support, we hope to be ambassadors for those who need a voice and have flown under the radar in our society for a long time.

 

  • This project is intended to be a springboard from which others may step up as fellow ambassadors for those who may face similar challenges, and feel isolated and discouraged in our society.

 

  • Together, we aim to play our part in a collective effort of ensuring that future generations of Singaporeans would be able to truly enjoy being immersed in a genuinely-inclusive nation. 

 

Additional Information

  • “It takes a village to raise a child”, it is often said, but it takes a lot more for those with special needs.

 

  • Nonetheless, with the right hearts of love, empathy, kindness, compassion and perseverance, the most daunting of odds can be overcome together.

 

  • Life can be meaningful and purposeful because of the right hearts, right people and right platforms working towards the same goal of genuine inclusivity.

 

  • This film and corresponding theme song could be used by various Special Education Organisations as a tool to enable special needs individuals to healthily integrate into school life, work life and other aspects of social interaction without an unhealthy fear of bullying, rejection and discrimination. This will complement the country’s efforts to rise above this crisis and galvanise one another for collective recovery and hope for the future.

 

  • This work will subtly highlight the recent initiatives of Skills Future, re-skilling and employment, in tandem with community togetherness in forging a social glue that will ensure that we, as a nation and society, arise from this crisis stronger, empathetic and much more resilient.
  •  

Past Works Featuring Individuals with SEN (Special Education Needs) 

  • “We Belong” (https://youtu.be/fhwQ0dmBgOA): Music Video featuring SEN individuals and how they are integral to our collective social fabric and moral compass (Dec 2020) – sponsored by the National Arts Council via the Digital Grant, in conjunction with the Singapore Kindness Movement.

 

  • "Unbroken: 不倒翁”  Short film based on my life’s story coping with lifelong invisible learning disabilities (Jun 2017) – co-sponsored by Touch Community services.

a) Trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RQ5OgKYQ1iw
b) Music Video:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RQ5OgKYQ1iw

  • Recent song compositions on how we can emerge from the current crisis stronger and more united:
    a) True Love that binds(https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IDbJA86OS3E)

b) Keep us Strong (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GWypyHwmNuU)

Introduction
Hello!

I have invisible Special Education Needs (SEN) which were only diagnosed during my National Service after going through much trauma, isolation and discrimination throughout much of my school life.

Although largely fictitious in nature, it will be based on real-life accounts of such individuals

This film project has already been officially supported and granted partial funding by MCCY (Ministry of Culture, Community & Youth) via the OSF (Our Singapore Fund). We are immensely thankful for their support and endorsement.

“We Belong” (https://youtu.be/fhwQ0dmBgOA): Music Video featuring SEN individuals and how they are integral to our collective social fabric and moral compass (Dec 2020) – sponsored by the National Arts Council via the Digital Grant, in conjunction with the Singapore Kindness Movement.

 

"Unbroken: 不倒翁”  Short film based on my life’s story coping with lifelong invisible learning disabilities (Jun 2017) – co-sponsored by Touch Community services.

a) Trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RQ5OgKYQ1iwb) Music Video:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RQ5OgKYQ1iw

b) Keep us Strong (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GWypyHwmNuU)

story:
Short Summary

Film is a wonderful art that so many people enjoy, whether it be the filmmakers creating it or the ones excited to sit down with a bag of popcorn to enjoy it. My name is Noah Bessey and I'm an up and coming Maine filmmaker, born and raised. I feel that the film community in Maine is growing so much more now and us indie filmmakers are getting our shot to represent our state. However, it's a process we cannot do alone, and that's where you come in!

This is a project that not only myself, but those of us in the cast and crew are very passionate and excited about. Funds are now what we need to get this project to become a reality. We hope to bring you an incredible and suspenseful product that will have you gripping your seat beginning to end, and you will all help make that possible.

With this film, we hope to submit to film festivals and represent Maine as a viable place for us independent filmmakers to create wonderful stories and to help inspire others to create other works here in this state. Maine is full of amazing and talented people who want to create and bring entertainment to the big screen, but we can only do it with your help.  

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here is where your money will go and how you'll help bring the project to life:

  • Cast
  • Crew
  • Location
  • Insurance
  • Equipment
  • Post-Production Expenses
  • Props
  • Costuming
  • Behind the Scenes videographer/photographer
  • Film Poster

As an already experienced indie filmmaker for short films, this will be the biggest project I have worked on yet. We have already made shorts that have made it into multiple festivals as well as a short that is representing Maine in an anthology feature film [The United States of Horror] with other shorts from every state.

For everyone who donates, there are special perks and the more you donate the better the perk!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's everything! We hope that you'll donate to or share this fundraiser with others to help us get this project made!

story:
Z E M B L A N I T Y 

 

Who are we?

Hello! My name is Trevor March. I am the Co-Writer, Producer, Casting Director, and Lead Actor in Zemblanity. I have always loved movies and working with people who are as passionate about this art form as I am. I started studying film when I was put into film class by my amazing mother when I was in 5th grade. I graduated from the Pacific Conservatory of the Performing Arts in 2017 and have been studying acting in LA ever since. In the past, I have been a main stage performer for Disney Cruise Line, played Cornelius in Hello Dolly, Gabe in Next to Normal and Davey in Lieutenant of Inishmore. Most of the work that I usually do is in theatre, so in 2020 my main industry stopped. I decided to put matters into my own hands and get back to my film roots. I called one of my best friends, Spencer Mead, who is an incredible director and storyteller and said, “We have to make a film!” 

Spencer Mead is the Co-Writer, Director, and Editor of Zemblanity. He has written, directed, and produced many films, commercials, and music videos over the years. He graduated from London FIlm Academy as well as studied at Berkeley Digital Film Institute. Altogether, he has been making films for years the most recent of which, FLUX, received a Best Director and Best Editor award and can be viewed on YouTube. I have had the pleasure of getting to work with him on multiple occasions prior to this project. 

It is always a pleasure and he consistently puts out an incredible final product! I wanted us to make something that we could both put our creative energies into. Together we invested our own money to create a film we both could be proud of. This has cemented our collaborative partnership, and we already have plans for our next film, which you can learn more about below!

 

What is the campaign for? 

We are raising money for two main purposes:

1) To get this film out to festivals

2) Offer you an opportunity to support the making of this film by helping us fund it.

Festivals are a huge part of indie filmmaking. Your donation will help us get people to see our work and make a name for ourselves in this industry. Getting this funding is HUGE! 

Almost every film festival has a cost of entry to submit a film and some even have additional costs once you are in. So, we are setting the goal of $500 for festival submissions alone. These costs can range from $15 to $75 per submission, per festival. 

The production of this film cost us just under $6,000. Making films at this level takes creativity and not a dime goes to waste whether that’s the travel expenses, equipment, permits, or the hiring of any of the numerous artists that it takes to create a movie. 

In setting out to do this film it was important to us that everyone who worked on this project was an artist whose creative voices could contribute to our story and that we paid them fairly to do so. From our local steadicam operator to our international composer we’ve strove to find unique artists and are proud of the team we’ve put together.

If, at the end of the day, we don’t reach our full goal, whatever money we do raise will go toward getting this film out to festivals. Again, festivals are our chance to showcase the film, get exposure, make contacts, and sometimes find opportunities for larger fundraising to create feature films, tv pilots, and more.

 

What do I get for my donation?

Well, I am so glad you asked! 

For our generous donors and here is what you can expect:

$5 - A downloadable link to the film sent to you when it is released 

$10 - Early access to the film! Consider this your virtual ticket to a early screening of the film (up to 6 months to a year before its public release) 

$20 - Thank You Credit, Your name will be in the movie!

$30 - A downloadable mp3 of the score 

$50 - A downloadable link to the movie poster (with a personalized thank you email)

$100 - A special thank you video message from the creators!

$150 - A signed script from the writers 

$200 - A full-sized movie poster

$500 - Sponsor Credit, with a letter detailing the miracles from the day of our shoot.

Producers and Executive Producers get a “cocktail hour” with the creators of the film and will be provided themed drinks shipped to you directly for a Zoom Kiki! 

$1000 - Producer Credit, your name will appear with our Producers as one important cog in helping us get this movie made. This can also be a place for businesses, corporate sponsors, and persons to be recognized. 

$5000 - Executive Producer Credit (this includes the absolute top billing, set passes to our next film, and an opportunity for a Cameo!) 

To receive thank you gifts from our team, please make sure to leave your full name and email address so we can contact you and make sure you get the full credit you deserve! 

No matter what you give, your support is what makes these projects go and it allows us to continue making them!

 

What happens if we exceed our goal?

Spencer and I have created a production company and are continuing to make many more films into the future. We have already begun pre-production on our next  short film “Gambling Addicts” set to shoot in June, and we are writing a feature length script we hope to begin production on next year. So, any donations that go beyond this goal will go towards our continued mission of producing entertaining and original films while supporting the teams of creative voices that make them possible. Whether it’s hiring a crew, renting equipment, paying for locations, craft services, costuming/props, housing, travel expenses, music rights, editors, or visual effects;  Movies can cost a lot!!! (like 6,000 exclamation points a lot!) So no money will go to waste!

 

What difference does it make?

Getting public funding for this project makes a huge difference! This money affirms support for us as up-and-coming filmmakers. It eases the financial burden on us. It allows us to focus our energy more on our art form rather than our pocketbooks. We live in a day and age where art is vital to our society. Art has not only been for entertainment this last year, but it has been how the world has been able to cope. We need stories and storytellers now more than ever. Whether it be to let us escape into another world, make us nostalgic, bring us joy and laughter, let us cry, or make us reflect and start a conversation, we need art.

Stories whether it’s film or theater are what I think of as “empathy pills in a 2-hour capsule”. These mediums can be used as the best way to teach people to care for one another. Think of the stories and movies that shaped who you are. We all want a love that would rival The Notebook and a home that Dorothy’s ruby slippers would know in their soles.

At the end of the day, this is what I love to do. You are supporting me. You are supporting Spencer. You are supporting every artist that we have chosen and will choose to bring on our team to create with. I truly appreciate every donation that is made. There is no number that is too small or too big that will not be seen and felt. 

 

If you aren’t in a position to support us financially, you can still help us out by spreading the word! Tell your friends about us and our creative endeavors! Be LOUD and make some noise about supporting the arts. It’s super easy. Just use the Indiegogo share tool and let your voice be heard! Thank you!
story_txt: Z E M B L A N I T Y  Who are we?Hello! My name is Trevor March. I am the Co-Writer, Producer, Casting Director, and Lead Actor in Zemblanity. I have always loved movies and working with people who are as passionate about this art form as I am. I started studying film when I was put into film class by my amazing mother when I was in 5th grade. I graduated from the Pacific Conservatory of the Performing Arts in 2017 and have been studying acting in LA ever since. In the past, I have been a main stage performer for Disney Cruise Line, played Cornelius in Hello Dolly, Gabe in Next to Normal and Davey in Lieutenant of Inishmore. Most of the work that I usually do is in theatre, so in 2020 my main industry stopped. I decided to put matters into my own hands and get back to my film roots. I called one of my best friends, Spencer Mead, who is an incredible director and storyteller and said, “We have to make a film!” Spencer Mead is the Co-Writer, Director, and Editor of Zemblanity. He has written, directed, and produced many films, commercials, and music videos over the years. He graduated from London FIlm Academy as well as studied at Berkeley Digital Film Institute. Altogether, he has been making films for years the most recent of which, FLUX, received a Best Director and Best Editor award and can be viewed on YouTube. I have had the pleasure of getting to work with him on multiple occasions prior to this project. It is always a pleasure and he consistently puts out an incredible final product! I wanted us to make something that we could both put our creative energies into. Together we invested our own money to create a film we both could be proud of. This has cemented our collaborative partnership, and we already have plans for our next film, which you can learn more about below! What is the campaign for? We are raising money for two main purposes:1) To get this film out to festivals2) Offer you an opportunity to support the making of this film by helping us fund it.Festivals are a huge part of indie filmmaking. Your donation will help us get people to see our work and make a name for ourselves in this industry. Getting this funding is HUGE! Almost every film festival has a cost of entry to submit a film and some even have additional costs once you are in. So, we are setting the goal of $500 for festival submissions alone. These costs can range from $15 to $75 per submission, per festival. The production of this film cost us just under $6,000. Making films at this level takes creativity and not a dime goes to waste whether that’s the travel expenses, equipment, permits, or the hiring of any of the numerous artists that it takes to create a movie. In setting out to do this film it was important to us that everyone who worked on this project was an artist whose creative voices could contribute to our story and that we paid them fairly to do so. From our local steadicam operator to our international composer we’ve strove to find unique artists and are proud of the team we’ve put together.If, at the end of the day, we don’t reach our full goal, whatever money we do raise will go toward getting this film out to festivals. Again, festivals are our chance to showcase the film, get exposure, make contacts, and sometimes find opportunities for larger fundraising to create feature films, tv pilots, and more. What do I get for my donation?Well, I am so glad you asked! For our generous donors and here is what you can expect:$5 - A downloadable link to the film sent to you when it is released $10 - Early access to the film! Consider this your virtual ticket to a early screening of the film (up to 6 months to a year before its public release) $20 - Thank You Credit, Your name will be in the movie!$30 - A downloadable mp3 of the score $50 - A downloadable link to the movie poster (with a personalized thank you email)$100 - A special thank you video message from the creators!$150 - A signed script from the writers $200 - A full-sized movie poster$500 - Sponsor Credit, with a letter detailing the miracles from the day of our shoot.Producers and Executive Producers get a “cocktail hour” with the creators of the film and will be provided themed drinks shipped to you directly for a Zoom Kiki! $1000 - Producer Credit, your name will appear with our Producers as one important cog in helping us get this movie made. This can also be a place for businesses, corporate sponsors, and persons to be recognized. $5000 - Executive Producer Credit (this includes the absolute top billing, set passes to our next film, and an opportunity for a Cameo!) To receive thank you gifts from our team, please make sure to leave your full name and email address so we can contact you and make sure you get the full credit you deserve! No matter what you give, your support is what makes these projects go and it allows us to continue making them! What happens if we exceed our goal?Spencer and I have created a production company and are continuing to make many more films into the future. We have already begun pre-production on our next  short film “Gambling Addicts” set to shoot in June, and we are writing a feature length script we hope to begin production on next year. So, any donations that go beyond this goal will go towards our continued mission of producing entertaining and original films while supporting the teams of creative voices that make them possible. Whether it’s hiring a crew, renting equipment, paying for locations, craft services, costuming/props, housing, travel expenses, music rights, editors, or visual effects;  Movies can cost a lot!!! (like 6,000 exclamation points a lot!) So no money will go to waste! What difference does it make?Getting public funding for this project makes a huge difference! This money affirms support for us as up-and-coming filmmakers. It eases the financial burden on us. It allows us to focus our energy more on our art form rather than our pocketbooks. We live in a day and age where art is vital to our society. Art has not only been for entertainment this last year, but it has been how the world has been able to cope. We need stories and storytellers now more than ever. Whether it be to let us escape into another world, make us nostalgic, bring us joy and laughter, let us cry, or make us reflect and start a conversation, we need art.Stories whether it’s film or theater are what I think of as “empathy pills in a 2-hour capsule”. These mediums can be used as the best way to teach people to care for one another. Think of the stories and movies that shaped who you are. We all want a love that would rival The Notebook and a home that Dorothy’s ruby slippers would know in their soles.At the end of the day, this is what I love to do. You are supporting me. You are supporting Spencer. You are supporting every artist that we have chosen and will choose to bring on our team to create with. I truly appreciate every donation that is made. There is no number that is too small or too big that will not be seen and felt.  If you aren’t in a position to support us financially, you can still help us out by spreading the word! Tell your friends about us and our creative endeavors! Be LOUD and make some noise about supporting the arts. It’s super easy. Just use the Indiegogo share tool and let your voice be heard! Thank you!

story:
Hello! I am a film student at the University of North Alabama. I am working on my senior thesis project. This film is the culmination of everything I have learned. We are responsible for providing everything on set, including food, props, sanitation, and anything else that we might need on set. With the times we live in now, it has become more difficult to create a film. We require more people, equipment and food on set at all times.

The Story

"Gerald's Game" is a psychological thriller. Gerald, our main character, is manipulated by his best friend to kill someone, but that is not the whole story. After Gerald murders someone, he must face his inner self and come to terms with what he has done. He must come to terms face to face with the one that he killed. Gerald must go through this alone and see the consequences of his actions. By the end of the film, betrayal becomes the most dreadful sin committed.  

Where is the money is going?

It takes a lot of people and resources to make a film. Food will need to be provided daily for cast and crew, in coordination with COVID-19 regulations. Personal protection equipment will also need to be provided for everyone on set. Items such as masks, face shields, gloves, and sanitization supplies for equipment and all crew members must be on hand. Props are also necessary for film and will be purchased in bulk when applicable.  The film industry is very unpredictable, especially in today's climate.  As a result, the more people that are behind this project, the more successful it will be.

I completely understand if you are unable to financially help, but everything counts. Even sharing this campaign can go a long way!

 

$300 for food.

$100 for props and other practical effects.

$100 for equipment (Gaffers tape...)

$100 for festivals.

$200 for sanitation equipment due to COVID-19

$200 for location expenses

story:
BOUND

BRIEF SYNOPSIS: 

"Still struggling 3 years after the murder of her sister, Homicide Detective Ana Branagh and her partner hunt down a methodical serial killer. When the murders escalate, a disconnected Ana is forced to work with the uncooperative FBI, only to find out the killer may be targeting her." 

**** The videos above are NOT going to be part of the feature, they are simply an example of the over all gritty, dark nature and story that the feature will have. Everything for the feature film will be filmed anew in 4k, etc. after its funded.****

 

I am Australia Kincannon, the Director, Producer and award-winning Writer of the feature film “BOUND,” a crime and horror thriller currently in pre-production. This film genre is my “go-to” when it comes to movie night. There is just something about it that draws me in more than any other genre.

https://pro.imdb.com/name/nm8117647?ref_=hm_pro...

Over the years I’ve had many jobs—Costume Designer and Creator (still active), Fire Fighter, Alaskan Fisher, Retail, Car Salesperson, and so on—but working in film has been by far the wildest ride I’ve ever experienced.

I have been working on this feature film since 2019, with several awards already for the screenplay, and now it is time this piece of cinema actually gets made. Though the story is not a "feel good" or inspirational story, it doesn’t make it any less worthy of being created. It tackles loss, grief, rage, depression, substance abuse, isolation, mental illness, morality, and more—issues that mean so much to me and have come to the forefront in recent years.

What do I see for this film, why it should be created, and why should YOU care?  I will work my ass off to make this the best film it could possibly be with the ultra-low budget I am asking for. I will have real representation on screen, not glamorized Hollywood standards. In addition, with it being filmed here in the Pacific Northwest, it will offer the opportunity for local talent—including your family and friends, maybe even you—to be on screen and behind the cameras to experience working on something you love without having to uproot to Los Angeles or work for free on projects that never hit their full potential due to lack of funding. We all want the chance at our dream jobs; it shouldn't always get to be just a lucky few.

What We Need & What You Get

This project is currently in pre-production, but to reach production (actually filming the movie) and achieve the quality it needs to be to make it worth everyone’s while, there needs to be funding. 
The goal for this production is at least $100,000. If you’re thinking that is low for a feature film, you're absolutely right. Most films are in the millions, even Indie films are mostly around $500 thousand to several million dollars. With $100,000 that gives the local people enough interest to be passionate enough to make this the best it can be.

Together with crowdfunding, we are also approaching investors non-stop and working other avenues of funding. There can be no limit when it comes to something this big and important. 

The graph below shows approximately how funds will be disbursed throughout the project.

In exchange for donations outside of standard donating and investors, there will be many perks to choose from: film posters, digital copies of the film (once completed), physical DVD copies, and additional BOUND-related merch.

There will also be RARE opportunities for (certified) autographed items by major film celebrities and a chance to grab a SPEAKING ROLE in the movie! I encourage you to follow the BOUND Facebook page for latest updates and reminders.  

www.facebook.com/BoundaWashingtonStateFilm 

Awards, limited unforeseen events, and other items have been budgeted into the overall funding.

If we don’t meet the $100,000 goal by the time filming begins in 2022, the feature will be pushed out until funds are reached, or—depending on how short we come up—we would still film the feature on time and make an additional drive for funds once we reach post-production.

Either way, I am confident this film will be completed. 

Production is set to start in February 2022 and post-production is slated to be finished by the fall of 2022 to hit the festival circuit and, eventually, distribution.

The Impact

I am not exaggerating when I say I will exhaust every avenue to make sure this film goes as far as it can and be the best it can be! It’s only fair to the people involved and to me. 

In donating and helping us reach the goal, you are ensuring paid jobs! If we can show the world that here in little Washington, we can make movies that people want to watch and be a part of, that’s huge! I think people would like to see someone like themselves in the movies, a little more real life; relatable faces, bodies (and I don't just mean the dead ones), breaking gender roles and racial and sexual stereotypes.

In donating and helping us reach our goal, you are ensuring paid local jobs! By showing the world that here in our little corner of the Pacific Northwest, we can make exciting movies that people want to watch and be a part of, it will continue to help boost the local film industry and put huge smiles on the faces of our local talent. People love to see someone like themselves in movies with a little more real life relatable faces and body types (and I don't just mean the dead ones) that break gender roles as well as racial and sexual stereotypes. This film will do just that! We will be bringing on talent, both in front of and behind the camera, with proper representation and inclusion.

The proof of concept video you see at the top of the page was filmed in four days on a budget of $2,600. The talent was amazing, and I could not have been happier with their performances. Unfortunately, not everyone will be able to return for the feature, and many characters and story plots were not included.

A huge reason funding needs to happen is so that this project is the best quality it can be by hiring talented individuals both on screen and off. The cast and crew are more dedicated and reliable when they are paid, and this also means better equipment at our disposal. I am confident that with the proper funding, this feature will be wonderfully done, and we will be proud to say "this is ours."

A few of those Local people involved (more to be announced as the project continues):

Award Winning Patti Carns Kalles C.S.A (Casting Director) is Seattle's original Casting Director. She's responsible for finding talent for amazing films like Harry and the Hendersons, Bad News Bears, Superman (2006) and so on! She's also an acting coach in Seattle when not on search for talent. https://pro.imdb.com/name/nm0138725/?ref_=insta...

Award winning Abie Ekenezar (Actress/Associate Producer) is an Actress, Producer, Singer and “Cosplayer” living in Seattle, WA with an extensive background resume and has been in the entertainment industry professionally with IMDB credits since September 2013. She’s been involved with such projects as Grimm, Man In The High Castle, Librarians, Portlandia, JourneyQuest and even Z-Nation, filmed in Spokane, Wa https://www.imdb.com/name/nm6650943/?ref_=tt_cl_t3

Zachary Jablonski (Associate Producer) is a Puget Sound-based multi-media editor, writer, musician, cinematographer and volunteer Cosplayer. While involved in the local music scene since 2014, he's currently a multi-media journalist sharing the stories of local residents of the Olympic Peninsula.

Award winning Jessica Cruz (Actor) is a Seattle-based South Asian actress and filmmaker. At the age of 9, she dreamed of becoming an actor and little did she know this would encompass her life. After completing her BA in Film Production at California State University Northridge. Whatever project she works on she hopes to entertain the audience, educate them about issues in society, and break stereotypes. https://www.imdb.com/name/nm9192992/?ref_=tt_cl_t1

Christina Williams (Actor) has loved performing her entire life. Rather than just watch films and tv shows for entertainment, she was constantly studying and devouring them. This is still true today. With a strong background in theatre, Christina decided to pursue film in 2017. With a handful of short films under her belt (including the proof of concept for Bound), she cannot wait to dive back in as Dr. Lawrence in the feature film! In addition to acting, Christina loves ziplining and will talk with you for hours about classic movies.  https://www.imdb.com/name/nm5453986/?ref_=fn_al...

Rachel Taggart (Actress) After a 12-year hiatus from acting, Rachel returned to the stage and screen in 2019. Interesting credits include: Jenna TUNDRA (best Actor – Comedy) 48 HR Film Project, Sgt Wright BOUND, Janelle THE 31ST AMENDMENT (actor/producer), Irene ARMED BETTIES. Rachel is delighted to return to the cast of BOUND and to work with Australia Kincannon and the gang again. Website: www.rachel-taggart.com

Risks & Challenges

Because there is no way to know what will happen at any time during the production, it is possible that an actor may need to be re-cast, someone on the crew may be unable to complete their behind-the-scenes duties, or a location may suddenly become unavailable. These are all things that can happen on a production. A scene may not go according to plan or work may need to be done in post because of something that wasn’t caught during filming. When things like this happen, we must work quickly to find a solution in that moment. We will have a team of creative minds at our disposal to troubleshoot these issues as they arise.

With your support, this would be a mostly, if not completely, paid gig and would make it easier to hire someone last minute if needed, secure a premium location, and handle other unforeseen circumstances. If we should have any problems, delays, or things beyond our control, we promise to always be open and direct with our contributors. I have high standards for what we are doing, and I am making the best preparations possible.

With the Indiegogo fully funded, it gives us less time to worry about money and more time working to make this movie the best that it can be, giving us options in case something does happen.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand if you don't have the money to help out at this time, but you can still make a huge difference by sharing the campaign, EXPLAINING to your family and friends why they should help in this adventure, and pitch in where possible. That costs nothing and means everything. No donation is too little, and every bit helps in the long run. So please, when you share this campaign, write something about it, and maybe pledge a donation in your post to generate interest. Perhaps you have a super cool item such as an celebrity autograph (with certificate of authenticity) you can donate as a perk to help us reach our goal, or volunteer to be on set! There are so many ways you can donate and help us reach our goal.
Your support has been overwhelming to say the least. Thank you so much and see you at the movies, my friends!

www.Facebook.com/BoundaWashingtonStateFilm

These are all things that can happen on a production. A scene may not go according to plan or work may need to be done in post because of something that wasn’t caught during filming. When things like this happen, we must work quickly to find a solution in that moment. We will have a team of creative minds at our disposal to troubleshoot these issues as they arise.
With your support, this would be a mostly, if not completely, paid gig and would make it easier to hire someone last minute if needed, secure a premium location, and handle other unforeseen circumstances. If we should have any problems, delays, or things beyond our control, we promise to always be open and direct with our contributors. I have high standards for what we are doing, and I am making the best preparations possible.
With the Indiegogo fully funded, it gives us less time to worry about money and more time working to make this movie the best that it can be, giving us options in case something does happen.  


 
Other Ways You Can Help
I understand if you don't have the money to help out at this time, but you can still make a huge difference by sharing the campaign, EXPLAINING to your family and friends why they should help in this adventure, and pitch in where possible. That costs nothing and means everything. No donation is too little, and every bit helps in the long run. So please, when you share this campaign, write something about it, and maybe pledge a donation in your post to generate interest. Perhaps you have a super cool item such as an celebrity autograph (with certificate of authenticity) you can donate as a perk to help us reach our goal, or volunteer to be on set! There are so many ways you can donate and help us reach our goal.Your support has been overwhelming to say the least. Thank you so much and see you at the movies, my friends!
www.Facebook.com/BoundaWashingtonStateFilm

story:
When a family of Martians crash-land on a 1950’s American farm, a pregnant housewife must protect the defenceless visitors from her bigoted husband’s murderous intent. 

The Last Time Martians Came Home is a homage to the 1950s sci-fi B-movie that sets to play on the clichés of the classic coverage and the story structure of most films that were released in that period, in an attempt to be as authentic to the era and genre. The story begins with a UFO crashing on a newly-wed couple’s farmstead, a small family of Martians from (you guessed it) out of space are stuck there, attempting to seek refuge.  The bigoted, abusive, territorial owner of this farm ‘George’ aims to eradicate the peaceful family of Martians, however his wife, Donna, doesn’t share his disdain. Will the Family escape George's grasp? Will Donna stand up to her abusive husband? And will this family ever make it home alive?

  

Alien Movies made during the 1950’s frequent the use of military propaganda and ideals of ‘The American Dream’.  They also evidently reflect and play on America's xenophobic fears of immigration. The Last Time Martians Came Home, aims to flip this idea on its head. Instead of portraying a negative perception of immigrants through a generic ‘Alien Invasion’ movie, we are attempting to convey the struggles of refugees and how these westernised views have changed and progressed in time. 

We believe this is an important message for all generations, and given that Sci-fi was the genre that initially portrayed these negative views and fears, it is only fitting that it be the genre to reflect the changes in the perception of refugees.

With your help we could bring this amazing idea to life in the most unique and creative way possible. Your financial support would go towards all the necessities to make this as authentic as we can. This would include alien costumes, make-up, set design/production design, props and practical effects. 

The more financial support we can garner for this film, the more gore, practical effects and detailed the production value will be. Fortunately for us, the location we have scouted isn’t costly and looks stunning.

100% of your contribution goes into making this amazing short story an equally amazing cinematic experience. 

This will be our second film as writer & directors. The biggest struggle would be the time that we will have to come to terms with. Regardless how prepared will be for the production, if the location is secured or the time it takes to set-up for lights, scenes and rehearse the actors for the best performance. The characters would be wearing a heavy amount of gear and prosthetics that would shorten the time we would have between shots before it causes discomfort for the talent. Continuity will be the utmost importance to retain as the film will be shot in black and white which would make things like blood and objects in a scene more apparent. 

By choosing to support this project you can receive a number of perks as an expression of our gratitude for believing in us and this story. Each perk as listed on this page comes with a series of rewards. As you progress through the perks you gain additional rewards meaning if you were to select the $75 package you would receive both the $50 and $25 packages in addition to the one you have selected.  Without your help this movie wouldn't get made, as a token of our appreciation some perks include an ‘Associate Producer’ credit and the highest being an ‘Executive Producer’. This means that when this film begins its film festival run, you would be accredited as a key contributor to the project because we recognise the value your contribution has on this film.  

Head of departments

Director/s & Writer/s: 

Jason Da Silva

George Tsounis 

1st AD 

Alan Trad

PD (Production Designer)

Alyssa Cook 

Producer: 

Fiona Jordan 

DOP:

Tom Dube

Sound recordist 

Joe Devjak

Minor Roles

Make-up artist 

Ruby Swibel 

Boom Pole Operator

Ben Levi

Executive Producer

Investor’s / You

1st AC

Joshua Kind

Camera Operator

Jake Sydney

Catering

Ben Levi

Don't feel bad if you can't support this project by donating, there are other ways you can help contribute to ‘The Last Time Martians Came Home’. By sharing this page and our socials you would be doing this film huge favour. Spreading this film helps get as many eyes on this story which will inevitably mean more and more support! 

So please share this page and follow our socials: @thelastmartians on Instagram and Facebook, and and help spread this film, so we can make the best movie possible!

Once again we can’t convey our appreciation enough. Thank you so much for choosing to help our film ‘The Last Time Martians Came Home’. We couldn’t be making this short film without you and we can’t wait to show you guys what we have in store. To keep up to date with all the latest news regarding the film, follow our Instagram and Facebook! And Welcome to The Last Time Martians Came Home.

story:
Hello, my name is Randy E. Kelly Jr. I  am the Writer Director Producer of The Survivors: A Rider's Legacy.  My production entity is REK Films Montana. In fact, as the name suggests, we are based in Montana. I have been producing short films for over a decade up here in Big sky country. You can find our work on Youtube (https://www.youtube.com/c/REKFilmsMontana) and Vimeo (https://vimeo.com/rekfilmsmt)

We are excited to break into this new adventure in a short film set in a world we have been developing slowly over the last 4 years.

So let's get into this film......

Tagline

 

The World

America has changed. The old government was replaced by the World Alliance Council, a unified world order that oversees all governments across all countries on the planet.  In America the big cities have been walled off as to keep the populations of those cities contained and in tight nit control. Inside the cities people are subject to the class system dictated by the Council. People are not able to move up in society as they are all placed in their preassigned roles. Outside the cities are where the undesirables of this new regime are either banished to, or in many cases, escaped. In these lands beyond the walls lay all manner of people just trying to survive on the limited resources they have. Some small towns from the life before do still function as small villages and some semblance of civil pockets of humanity. But there are many people in the Outlands that spend much of their time fighting for resources. Leaving only the strong to survive.

 

Previous Survivors Films

The first film, The Survivors Sins of the Father found a healthy audience on Youtube at nearly 1 million views and pulled in a Best Cinematography award from the Show Low Film Festival 2018. In it we told a story of a young Boy (John) indoctrinated by an over bearing Father (Luther) who was teaching him how to terrorize anyone who dared enter their lands. Luther does so by embracing a symbol feared in the lands known as The Black Rider. Our follow up film , The Survivors:The Rise of Calestra, explored different characters in the same world told from a Female perspective trying to survive in the Outlands. The third film, The Bull a Survivor’s Story, outlined more of the fall of society into the totalitarian world.

These films are very much influenced by the great Mad Max films of the 80's. But we also make sure to stay true to the world we created in The Survivors. Please take the time as well to check out the other films here; https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLxXM849kfTf3...

This Film

A Rider’s Legacy will pick up with an older John reflecting back on the Legend of the Rider and the stories he was told as a Young Boy. The film has the book ends of John telling of this story about Peter, Barrett and the Rider.  It’s a fun exploration of one character, Peter, who comes from the big city and the ideology of his world, and how it clashes with a desert hermit, Barrett, and his ideas of how life should be lived. All while being taunted by the mysterious Black Rider.

The Cast

Scott McCauley as Barrett, the reclusive desert hermit. 

Scott is a Montanan who spends much of his on screen time in small parts in Montana based films. He has had the good fortune of working with people like Bill Pullman, Jim Caviezel, Gabriel Byrne and Thomas Jane. We are looking forward to giving him the chance to really sink his teeth into very intriguing character like Barrett.

 

Cruz Martinez as Peter, the lost City delegate for the World Alliance Council.

Cruz is a young and very talented actor who comes from the theater scene. He is full of energy and good will. His portrayal of Peter will be spot on.

 

Cole Newcomb as John, the desert wanderer whom the meat of the story is told by.

Cole is another Montana native that spent some time in California working on custom cars and trucks. While acting is not his main gig, he has all the charisma and charm needed to embody the stoic role of John with a sense of strength and confidence.

 

Production

Filming begins June 12th 2021 so we are coming up on go time really soon. We are fortunate to have a location we used once before on The Rise of Calestra, which is an off road desert race track in Wyoming. And a special cabin set has been built (pictured below) with the plans of moving it out to location for the production. Yes this cabin actually is built to come apart and be reassembled.

 

Why we need the help

This is mostly a no budget/shoestring budget kind of film with an all volunteer cast and crew. But we need help covering;

  1. Gas
  2. Food
  3. Portable Outhouse Rentals on set
  4. Various film related supplies

Once we are done

This film will eventually live online to be viewable by the world at large.  But before that release we will be doing a local theater event with all the films with the cast and crew attending.

In Conclusion

We feel that after a long stint of not being able to go out and do films, this film will not only be a special film to add to our series, but it will also represent getting back at it making things happen. We hope you will be on board to help however you can through the tiers we have set up. And even if you can't do much that way, it would be super cool if you can share this campaign to let all your friends know about this fun project. 

God Bless

Randy Kelly Jr (REK Films Montana)

story:
So, Who Exactly Are You?

Dead Klown Productions first and foremost is a passionate group of professionals with a great love for horror! It all started as a ragtag group of friends who came together with their unique talents and a desire to tell a great story. Each of us had been unhappy working under other directors and groups, not truly having the power to tell the tale WE envisioned and could be proud of, so we thought, why not just get together and make our own? This little group has become a family of our own making, and we want nothing more than to bring an AMAZING story to you!

What is "Giggles"?

"Giggles" is the tale of an unspeakable tragedy that befell a sleepy island town. Four years ago a man working as a clown went mad and brutally murdered the town folk. He somehow escaped the police and vanished without a trace. Recently, a new video has gone viral. People are saying it's cursed. Watching it supposedly alerts this same clown to your presence. Sounds standard enough as far as urban legends go, but the problem is; bodies have started piling up. Is this some sick joke by a copycat killer, or could the original murderer be back in town? Worse yet, something dark and unnatural seems to be at play... Could the curse actually be real?

Meet the Team!

We are still casting some of the roles! If you are from Washington state and near enough to commute to Whidbey Island, you can keep an eye on our Facebook for casting call information!

https://www.facebook.com/deadklownproductions

Here at Dead Klown Productions we have an incredible group of talented individuals working with us to make this film a reality! Along with our founders and crew, we have some awesome talent such as appearances by Mr. Creepypasta, Madame Macabre, Jason Brooks, Autumn Ivy and featuring music by composer Myuu from Youtube! There's even more announcements to come later as well!

What Sets You Apart?

Here at DKP the grassroots online horror community is an important part of our roots. Many of us grew up immersed in the culture of the online horror community, and realize what an amazing untapped potential it has. Though there have been a handful who have tried some exclusivity with the online horror world, all in all it is sadly lacking in representation. That's why we've made a point to not only work with, but bring aboard many members of the online horror community into our production! The online horror community has so much to offer, so we want to give it a fair chance to shine!

 

What We Need!

Simply put- making movies isn't cheap! This is a small startup group and we cannot do this alone! The vast majority of the money we raise will be going directly to paying the wages of our amazing cast and team. We have a remarkable group of people working with us and their outstanding talents are a valuable resource. We want to make sure everyone on board this project is fairly compensated for their hard work. We value people here, and want to make sure everyone is well taken care of and that this project has been worth their time and that their faith in giving us little guys a shot was not misplaced! With your help, we can make that a reality!

Aside from general wages, the remainder of the funds will be spread out among a variety of other departments:

Hair & Makeup, Wardrobe, Camera, Sound, Production Design, Locations, Electric/Grip, Visual Effects, Production, Editing, Production Insurance and more. 

In order to make a quality horror film, each of these departments are crucial. This is what makes the difference in a visually appealing, believable story. 

What's In It For You?

Aside from being a part of making an awesome horror movie a reality, those that contribute will get access to some pretty awesome perks*!

Some Perk Highlights

  • Embroidered Patch
  • Enamel Pin
  • Original Art Print by renowned artist Steve Bennett
  • Autographed Screenplay
  • Premium T-Shirt

Disclaimer: Dead Klown Productions fosters a safe and inclusive environment that thrives on creativity and trust for all. This extends to all crew members, cast, and even contributors. We will not tolerate ANY form of harassment. We have a zero tolerance policy, so if someone engages in a harassing behavior of any type or takes any inappropriate actions, we reserve the right to take action. This includes warning the offender, and even revoking perks and priveledges without refund. Please be respectful.

*There will be a shipping charge added during checkout

The Impact

We are setting out to break into the film industry as an entirely new breed of company. With our philosophy of seeking quality over a quick buck and our desire to work closely with the online community, we hope to make positive changes in the industry as a whole. If "Giggles" is a success, we know we can do this.

Risks & Challenges

Given the current pandemic situation, it's possible that our timeline could end up getting adjusted or pushed back slightly. For the time being this doesn't look to be a major cause for concern, but all things considered, it is a possibility to be aware of.

That being said, we are dedicated to completing this project! Virus or not, we will make this happen!

What If I Can't Contribute Financially?

We get it. Times are crazy right now and not everyone has as much spare cash as they used to. But if you'd still like to help us out, the next best thing you can do is spread the word! The more eyes we can get on this, the better! Share the news with anyone you know who loves horror or even just can appreciate indie film in general!

Aside from this campaign, you can also follow us on our Facebook page!

https://www.facebook.com/deadklownproductions

Thank you sincerely for your love and support.

story:
DUCK STORY

Hi, We're Matt & Alison, the creators of an exciting new children's illustrated book that we're offering YOU the opportunity of featuring in, and we're trying to raise aware and funds to turn it into an animated feature film!!

In an inner-city park, Goldie, a grumpy duck detective, who works for the Pond Police, is on the hunt for a thief who’s been stealing ducklings. Goldie and his new, boisterous partner, young Manny the Mandarin duck, must work together to unravel the mystery with the help of the elite birds of prey team; the MI-DIVE…

The book is about a Harpy eagle who comes to England and finds a beautiful park filled with an abundance of food and juicy ducklings, and the duck detectives who are searching for a missing duckling and swan prince. 

The idea came from the hundreds of trips we've taken to Kelsey Park, a beautiful park in South-East London, but our story represents so many local parks all over the world.

About the project:

  • The park in the book is very diverse and features an abundance of wildlife including; Egyptian and Canadian Geese, Mandarin ducks, South Carolina Wood ducks, mallards, drakes, wood pigeons, tufted ducks, cats, rats, squirrels, etc. 
  • Our campaign is important to us because we want to make people aware of the opportunities on their doorstep to connect with nature and to encourage them to seek out local wildlife spots.
  • Your contributions will help us to achieve our goal of bringing this story to life and sharing it with the world, including with various charities. 
  • This is the first in a series of books and ultimately our biggest goal (and dream) is to turn it into an animated feature film for everyone!!

 

What We Need & What You Get

The finer detail:

  • We need funding to pay for an editor for the book, a fantastic illustrator, and a team of social media and marketing experts to help us build awareness.
  • For every 5 E-books we sell we'll donate 1 free E-book to a children's charity or other charity.
  • We have some wonderfully unique perks such as the e-book itself, signed postcards & posters, as well as the exciting opportunity to feature in the book yourself:
    • Have you ever wanted to be a character in a book?
    • Or perhaps you'd like to name a duckling named after one of your kids?
    • Or surprise your significant other by having a small or main character named after them!!

These are just some of the perks that we're so excited to share with you! And remember you have the opportunity to feature in a book and become a part of history. 

Although we would love to reach our target, if we don't reach our entire goal, the funds we receive will still help us on our journey!

 

The Impact

The difference your contribution will make is huge, whether you donate £1 or £1,000 every penny raised will help us share our book with the world. One of the most important parts of our project is that we want to share the E-book with various children's charities and other charities who we can donate the book to, we think this will also be a way for you to contribute! The money we raise will also go towards printing these out as hardback books.

Risks & Challenges

Of course, like with every project, there are always risks, but we believe that with our drive and determination we can overcome any obstacles we may face on the way to achieving our goal.

Both Matt and Alison have over a decade of combined experience working in the film industry where we have learnt how to assist in bringing stories to life and value storytelling has to everybody. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people might not be able to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean that you can't help out in some way:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Remember, you can make a difference too just by spreading the word!!

story:
Dead By The Sea

When two, young adults discover the fateful passing of their close companion, their dreams are hurt as they come to terms with the idea of moving on without them. George and Erik face their fears and emotions as teenagers in a bitter coming of age film, triggered by their classmate’s dead body found by the sea.

George and Erik huddle together for warmth, as the sirens of the police deafen them both. The blinding lights accentuate the harsh waves. The hostile weather accentuates the vulnerability of the young men as their thoughts begin to cloud them and they become more opinionated. Huddled on the beach, they both reflect on how they could disappear, in what felt like a blink of an eye. They come to terms with growing up and eventually moving away. As the body is dragged from the water. The paramedics swarm the limp body.

The young men sit on the sand, but as the continue to watch the uncomfortable scene in front of them. They argue about responsibility, but it feels as though the shared responsibility is something they never expected from their newly changed status from teenagers to young adults.

Who Am I?

A Finnish/British filmmaker who is currently studying at the University for the Creative Arts. I am currently studying for a complete certification in AVID Media Composer Training, as well as broadening my on-set capabilities to be harnessed in the professional work-space. This includes the under-taking of multiple ideas and project development. I am currently the Assisstant Director to our latest project, 'Dead By The Sea' as well as the editor.

What We Need & What You Get

Our biggest risks include budgeting, especially as we initially hope to be able to travel to these locations with the majority of our crew. 

Given the current coronavirus situation, unfortunately we will not be able to stay in local residence, and community to the filming locations is far more expensive. 

Our expectation is to make a beautiful film in which we can use our filmmaking knowledge to create something which we want you all to be proud of.

We will need a minimum of £500 to help keep this project afloat, to make sure that we are able to keep the props available as well as additional travel expenses-especially as we are transporting a crew of 10 on most days for 4 days.

The Impact

This project is extremely treasured by our group, as it expresses many of the coming of age films in which friendship helps establish bonds outside of understanding.

The best way you can help us is to share our project so it can help reach everyone.
