story:
Truman: The Face Eraser is a psychological adventure game where you'll play as Truman, a beloved father and husband who has to become a serial killer to save his family. Discover, along with Truman, the true human nature. Delve into a story that lays bare the complexity of human life.

Kill evil creatures that threaten your family and the world, avoid leaving clues at the crime scenes, survive interrogations, find a job, and nourish the love of your family. Live a double life. One as a hero who must venture into the abyss to save his city, and the other, as an ordinary man with a job, friends and family.

Platforms: Windows/MAC/Linux

Truman lives with his family in a fictional city called Falldale. In the last few months, Falldale has experienced an outbreak of violence, crime, murders, corruption and drug traffic.

One day, a deity appears before Truman. This deity tells Truman that the high rates of crime and corruption are not a coincidence. Evil creatures have invaded the city and now Truman's family, and the whole world, are in true danger.

This deity entrusts Truman with an enormous mission: kill every evil creature in the city. These creatures disguise themselves as regular people, and only Truman can see marks on their faces that reveal their true nature.

Truman is not a hero, nor a soldier, he's a regular guy with an enormous mission.

Because of his limitations, Truman must kill the evil creatures one by one, like a serial killer. He's on a solo mission and has to be very smart in order to avoid being stopped by either the evil creatures or the police. He has to be very clever and avoid leaving clues behind in crime scenes or raising suspicion from his friends and family. The police will do anything to stop him, especially since it's election time in Falldale and they can't afford a “serial killer” to roam free in the streets.

This mission also starts in the middle of a marriage crisis between Truman and his wife, Dana. Truman is fighting not just for the safety of his family but also their love.

Truman: The Face Eraser has a non-linear story and every decision, every action in the game will matter.

Truman: The Face Eraser is a non-linear adventure game where your main mission is to kill the evil creatures who have invaded Falldale. Since you are the only one capable of differentiating these creatures from common people, you must plan each hit carefully, avoid leaving clues for the police, avoid getting caught, and prevent your family from getting suspicious.

Falldale is an open map, and Truman can move around as he wishes, searching for the evil creatures, completing jobs, spending time with his family, hiding bodies and cleaning up crime scenes.

Each hit is different. There will be times when you can plan the murder with time, clean crime scenes, or even deceive your target to get it in your car and take it to the basement of your old house. There may be times you have to be faster, and even reckless, killing one target in an alley, or in the bathroom of a restaurant.

Once you have killed an evil creature you have to hide the body as soon as possible to avoid being discovered by the police. If the police find the body, they will surely find some clue that leads them directly to you.

The game features a number of interconnected systems - suspicion, love, ego, humanity and money.

Suspicion Bar

The Suspicion Bar is a crucial part of Truman: The Face Eraser. All your actions and decisions matter. If the police find a body and they find some clues, your Suspicion Bar will go up. If your wife, a Falldale citizen or a friend get suspicious, the bar will go up. If the bar reaches the top... Game Over! You will get arrested.

You can reduce the Suspicion Bar with different activities in the game. Knowing how to lie to your family or to the police is critical to survival in Truman: The Face Eraser.

Love

Don't forget the reason why you have taken on your mission: to protect your family. So you can't forget them while looking in the dark streets of Falldale for your next target! You must care for the love of your family with the same importance as your mission.

The Love of your family is a fundamental part of the game and will have a direct impact on the development of the story, and of course, the ending of the game. Depending on your actions, the love of your wife and daughter will increase or decrease, so don't forget to spend time with them.

Tip: Being extremely loving with your family is not necessarily a good thing.

Ego

Truman is a regular guy. Killing evil creatures in Falldale will affect him terribly. Not only that, your Ego will be affected if you have a bad day, or if you fight with your wife or your daughter.

If Truman has a low Ego, he can't be loving with his family. So you must take care of how Truman is feeling! It's not the same playing with an upset Truman, than playing with a calm Truman. A Truman with a low Ego will be more careless when he has to clean crime scenes, or will have less time to answer a question in an interrogation, etc.

Since your Ego affects how you relate with your family, managing it plays a crucial role in the game.

Tip: Did you have a bad day? Have a drink at your favorite bar.

Humanity

If Ego represents how Truman feels in the moment, Humanity represent's Truman's sanity and the long term impact of killing the evil creatures. Each time you kill a target, your Humanity will descend, and because of that, you will lose the ability to get closer to your family, to loving them, be a good husband and father for them.

Tip: Increase your Humanity by doing good actions in Falldale. Get closer to the people in need and help them.

Money

You, Truman, have a family and you need to provide for them in addition to carrying out your mission. You'll need to find a job, live two lives, be a hero for Falldale, but also, for your own family.

Your family will need money every day in order to survive. And you, you'll need money to buy stuff like weapons to subdue the evil creatures, or bags and ropes to hide bodies.

Tip: Find a job that makes Truman happy, that could make your mission easier.

Memories

There will be times in Truman: The Face Eraser where you'll relive Truman's memories. These memories will be fully playable. Even in these memories, the actions and decisions that you make in the past will resound in the present. Take this into account!

  • Open World: Falldale is an open world city where you can discover quests, characters and many things to do.

  • Become an outlaw hero: kill evil creatures that threaten your family. Become a "serial killer" and protect the city.
  • Avoid to leave clues behind: the police will try to stop you. You have to be very clever to clean up and avoid leaving clues in crime scenes.
  • Survive interrogations: the police may ask where you've been, so will your family. Sometimes you have to lie, and at other times, combine truth with falsehood.

  • Hide bodies in Falldale: if the police find a body, surely they'll find clues that will lead them to you!

  • Suspicion Bar: depending on your decisions and actions, this bar will go up or down. If the bar reaches the top... Game Over! You'll get arrested.
  • Love: you have to take care of your family and spend time with them. The Love of your family will increase or decrease depending on your actions.
  • Humanity: Truman will be affected each time he kills an evil creature. A Truman with low Humanity can't be loving with his family, or be happy.
  • Ego: you can monitor how Truman is feeling all the time. A Truman with a low Ego can't be loving with his family or careful with his mission.
  • Money: you have to provide your family and have money to accomplish your mission. You need a job!
  • Memories: you'll also play Truman's past through his memories. The decisions and actions you make in the past, will resound in the present.
  • Decisions Matter: Truman: The Face Eraser is all about your decisions. Even small decisions such as where you bought at item or whether you called your wife or daughter can alter the course of the game.

  • Different Endings: every action and decision in the game will affect the ending. How much does your family love you? Is your Humanity intact? We will have many different endings. Can you unlock them all?

This are the main characters of Truman: The Face Eraser.

Truman Prichard is a beloved father and husband. Since he was very young, he was capable to detect the true human nature of people. He lives with his family in Falldale, a city that suffers the ravages of crime. He's on a solo mission: stop the evil creatures that are taking over the city and threaten his family. He has to kill every evil creature one by one, like a serial killer. It is his sacrifice for the welfare of his family.

The deity has known Truman since he was a little boy. The deity recognized the talent of Truman since the very beginning, so he entrusted him with his great mission to stop the evil creatures in Falldale. The deity is Truman's adviser throughout his adventure.

Dana Prichard is Truman's wife. She has been his girlfriend since they was young. Now they have a beautiful daughter that they love very much. They are currently going through the worst crisis in their marriage, but Dana is a strong woman and will do anything to keep her family together. She knows Truman very well, his past and his dreams.

Sonia Prichard is a daughter beloved by her parents, Truman and Dana. She is the strongest motivation for Truman's mission. She means everything to Truman and he would do anything in order to protect her. Sonia means love and happiness for the troubled couple.

If you govern a city with crime problems and need a quick, if not entirely legal, solution, you call Detective Bowen. "The end justifies the means" is his philosophy. He will use all available resources to stop the "serial killer" of Falldale.

Our team is working very hard to create an original soundtrack for Truman: The Face Eraser. Here are some original tracks.

Rewards chart

We're an independent game studio and we've been working on Truman: The Face Eraser for a year now and there is no way back. This game is going to be released, the true question is "when?". This is where we need your support.

In order to release the game in Fall 2017, we need funding to accelerate our development progress. We're a very passionated team and we really want to reach our dream. Truman: The Face Eraser has a lot of potential, is a challenging and unique game experience waiting for you to play. Support us today with a pledge, or sharing our campaign with your friends!

You can also follow us on Facebook, Twitter, YouTube and on the Official Website.

Q. What platforms will Truman: The Face Eraser be available on?

A. For now only on PC, MAC and Linux. Also the game will be released on Steam, so a key will be given to all our backers of USD$12 and above.

Q. In what languages will the game be available?

A. We want the game to be available in all possible languages, but right now the game will be available in English and Spanish.

Q. How big are the dolls and keychains?

A. Check out the following image.

Delve into a story that lays bare the complexity of human life.Kill evil creatures that threaten your family and the world, avoid leaving clues at the crime scenes, survive interrogations, find a job, and nourish the love of your family. Live a double life. One as a hero who must venture into the abyss to save his city, and the other, as an ordinary man with a job, friends and family.Platforms: Windows/MAC/LinuxTruman lives with his family in a fictional city called Falldale. In the last few months, Falldale has experienced an outbreak of violence, crime, murders, corruption and drug traffic.One day, a deity appears before Truman. This deity tells Truman that the high rates of crime and corruption are not a coincidence. Evil creatures have invaded the city and now Truman's family, and the whole world, are in true danger.This deity entrusts Truman with an enormous mission: kill every evil creature in the city. These creatures disguise themselves as regular people, and only Truman can see marks on their faces that reveal their true nature.Truman is not a hero, nor a soldier, he's a regular guy with an enormous mission.Because of his limitations, Truman must kill the evil creatures one by one, like a serial killer. He's on a solo mission and has to be very smart in order to avoid being stopped by either the evil creatures or the police. He has to be very clever and avoid leaving clues behind in crime scenes or raising suspicion from his friends and family. The police will do anything to stop him, especially since it's election time in Falldale and they can't afford a “serial killer” to roam free in the streets.This mission also starts in the middle of a marriage crisis between Truman and his wife, Dana. Truman is fighting not just for the safety of his family but also their love.Truman: The Face Eraser has a non-linear story and every decision, every action in the game will matter.Truman: The Face Eraser is a non-linear adventure game where your main mission is to kill the evil creatures who have invaded Falldale. Since you are the only one capable of differentiating these creatures from common people, you must plan each hit carefully, avoid leaving clues for the police, avoid getting caught, and prevent your family from getting suspicious.Falldale is an open map, and Truman can move around as he wishes, searching for the evil creatures, completing jobs, spending time with his family, hiding bodies and cleaning up crime scenes.Each hit is different. There will be times when you can plan the murder with time, clean crime scenes, or even deceive your target to get it in your car and take it to the basement of your old house. There may be times you have to be faster, and even reckless, killing one target in an alley, or in the bathroom of a restaurant.Once you have killed an evil creature you have to hide the body as soon as possible to avoid being discovered by the police. If the police find the body, they will surely find some clue that leads them directly to you.The game features a number of interconnected systems - suspicion, love, ego, humanity and money.Suspicion BarThe Suspicion Bar is a crucial part of Truman: The Face Eraser. All your actions and decisions matter. If the police find a body and they find some clues, your Suspicion Bar will go up. If your wife, a Falldale citizen or a friend get suspicious, the bar will go up. If the bar reaches the top... Game Over! You will get arrested.You can reduce the Suspicion Bar with different activities in the game. Knowing how to lie to your family or to the police is critical to survival in Truman: The Face Eraser.LoveDon't forget the reason why you have taken on your mission: to protect your family. So you can't forget them while looking in the dark streets of Falldale for your next target! You must care for the love of your family with the same importance as your mission. The Love of your family is a fundamental part of the game and will have a direct impact on the development of the story, and of course, the ending of the game. Depending on your actions, the love of your wife and daughter will increase or decrease, so don't forget to spend time with them.Tip: Being extremely loving with your family is not necessarily a good thing.EgoTruman is a regular guy. Killing evil creatures in Falldale will affect him terribly. Not only that, your Ego will be affected if you have a bad day, or if you fight with your wife or your daughter.If Truman has a low Ego, he can't be loving with his family. So you must take care of how Truman is feeling! It's not the same playing with an upset Truman, than playing with a calm Truman. A Truman with a low Ego will be more careless when he has to clean crime scenes, or will have less time to answer a question in an interrogation, etc.Since your Ego affects how you relate with your family, managing it plays a crucial role in the game.Tip: Did you have a bad day? Have a drink at your favorite bar.HumanityIf Ego represents how Truman feels in the moment, Humanity represent's Truman's sanity and the long term impact of killing the evil creatures. Each time you kill a target, your Humanity will descend, and because of that, you will lose the ability to get closer to your family, to loving them, be a good husband and father for them. Tip: Increase your Humanity by doing good actions in Falldale. Get closer to the people in need and help them.MoneyYou, Truman, have a family and you need to provide for them in addition to carrying out your mission. You'll need to find a job, live two lives, be a hero for Falldale, but also, for your own family.Your family will need money every day in order to survive. And you, you'll need money to buy stuff like weapons to subdue the evil creatures, or bags and ropes to hide bodies.Tip: Find a job that makes Truman happy, that could make your mission easier.MemoriesThere will be times in Truman: The Face Eraser where you'll relive Truman's memories. These memories will be fully playable. Even in these memories, the actions and decisions that you make in the past will resound in the present. Take this into account!
Open World: Falldale is an open world city where you can discover quests, characters and many things to do.

Become an outlaw hero: kill evil creatures that threaten your family. Become a "serial killer" and protect the city.

Avoid to leave clues behind: the police will try to stop you. You have to be very clever to clean up and avoid leaving clues in crime scenes.

Survive interrogations: the police may ask where you've been, so will your family. Sometimes you have to lie, and at other times, combine truth with falsehood.

Hide bodies in Falldale: if the police find a body, surely they'll find clues that will lead them to you!

Suspicion Bar: depending on your decisions and actions, this bar will go up or down. If the bar reaches the top... Game Over! You'll get arrested.

Love: you have to take care of your family and spend time with them. The Love of your family will increase or decrease depending on your actions.

Humanity: Truman will be affected each time he kills an evil creature. A Truman with low Humanity can't be loving with his family, or be happy.

Ego: you can monitor how Truman is feeling all the time. A Truman with a low Ego can't be loving with his family or careful with his mission.

Money: you have to provide your family and have money to accomplish your mission. You need a job!

Memories: you'll also play Truman's past through his memories. The decisions and actions you make in the past, will resound in the present.

Decisions Matter: Truman: The Face Eraser is all about your decisions. Even small decisions such as where you bought at item or whether you called your wife or daughter can alter the course of the game.

Different Endings: every action and decision in the game will affect the ending. How much does your family love you? Is your Humanity intact? We will have many different endings. Can you unlock them all?This are the main characters of Truman: The Face Eraser.Truman Prichard is a beloved father and husband. Since he was very young, he was capable to detect the true human nature of people. He lives with his family in Falldale, a city that suffers the ravages of crime. He's on a solo mission: stop the evil creatures that are taking over the city and threaten his family. He has to kill every evil creature one by one, like a serial killer. It is his sacrifice for the welfare of his family.The deity has known Truman since he was a little boy. The deity recognized the talent of Truman since the very beginning, so he entrusted him with his great mission to stop the evil creatures in Falldale. The deity is Truman's adviser throughout his adventure.Dana Prichard is Truman's wife. She has been his girlfriend since they was young. Now they have a beautiful daughter that they love very much. They are currently going through the worst crisis in their marriage, but Dana is a strong woman and will do anything to keep her family together. She knows Truman very well, his past and his dreams.Sonia Prichard is a daughter beloved by her parents, Truman and Dana. She is the strongest motivation for Truman's mission. She means everything to Truman and he would do anything in order to protect her. Sonia means love and happiness for the troubled couple.If you govern a city with crime problems and need a quick, if not entirely legal, solution, you call Detective Bowen. "The end justifies the means" is his philosophy. He will use all available resources to stop the "serial killer" of Falldale.Our team is working very hard to create an original soundtrack for Truman: The Face Eraser. Here are some original tracks.Rewards chartWe're an independent game studio and we've been working on Truman: The Face Eraser for a year now and there is no way back. This game is going to be released, the true question is "when?". This is where we need your support.In order to release the game in Fall 2017, we need funding to accelerate our development progress. We're a very passionated team and we really want to reach our dream. Truman: The Face Eraser has a lot of potential, is a challenging and unique game experience waiting for you to play. Support us today with a pledge, or sharing our campaign with your friends!You can also follow us on Facebook, Twitter, YouTube and on the Official Website.Q. What platforms will Truman: The Face Eraser be available on?A. For now only on PC, MAC and Linux. Also the game will be released on Steam, so a key will be given to all our backers of USD$12 and above.Q. In what languages will the game be available?A. We want the game to be available in all possible languages, but right now the game will be available in English and Spanish.Q. How big are the dolls and keychains?A. Check out the following image.

story:
UPDATE: With our Indiegogo campaign & private investors, we have raised over $15,000—which means we're at 75%!

 

We'd love your help to raise the remaining $5,000 by tomorrow afternoon! 

 

And as a celebratory treat, see our teaser trailer here:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xHVK-LQz3CQ

 

SUMMARY

A young man sees a girl on the subway and in a moment of madness, follows her. Thus begins a night of wandering through New York City as he attempts to understand—what he’s unfortunate enough to think might be—the girl of his dreams. 

A black-and-white love letter to a certain kind of woman and the unseen backstreets of New York City, THE LAST SUMMER is the directorial debut of writer and actress Francesca Root-Dodson.

This film is a labour of love, supported by a wonderfully dedicated cast & crew. Shot in ten days on a shoestring budget, run and gun as it gets, with a small but tireless crew, we came out the other end with beautiful footage and a big dream.

Our campaign is to raise finishing funds for the film, including the costs of an editor, sound mix, hiring a composer, and applying to the festivals that are the lifeblood of small movies like this, among many other things. Your contribution will enable us to take the footage we shot and craft it into a final, finished movie.

Making art—and especially movies—is hard. And getting a first feature film off the ground is the most difficult part of being a filmmaker. This project couldn’t have come to fruition without the help and faith of dozens of people who have contributed their time, talent and services to this project.

And now we need you—members of our families, friends, and community—to give whatever you’re able to so that we can take our dream and make it into a reality. 

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

Below is a breakdown of what the costs of post-production will be, to show you exactly how your contribution will put to use:

 

                             

We believe in filmmaking as a function of community; what makes this art form so joyous is that it demands collaboration. In exchange for your contribution, we are happy to offer our skills—in writing, photography and sales—to help you develop your own projects. See the perks to the right to learn more, and if a homemade meal or an Executive Producer credit are more your speed, well we’ve got those too!

 

THE IMPACT

Your contribution is an investment not only in the members of this cast and crew—all of whom are early career, this being their first or second feature—but in the next generation of film itself. In contributing to our film you are supporting new voices entering the film industry and standing for artistic freedom. Especially as a nascent female director—with a woman-run production team—contributing to this project is an investment in women being a vital part of the film industry. By supporting an ultra-indie such as THE LAST SUMMER, you are ensuring that independent cinema continues to get made—making us really grateful and you our art hero!

 

OTHER WAYS TO CONTRIBUTE

We understand that not everyone is able to contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help! Telling people about our film, posting this page, sharing our story and what we’re creating is a vital part of our campaign. Word of mouth is and has always been the most valuable tool—so please share our campaign with the easy Indiegogo share tools, and talk about it with your friends and family. The more people know about the project, the more likely we are to achieve our goal & walk away with a beautiful finished film! 

 

OUR TEAM 

FRANCESCA ROOT-DODSON (writer/director, plays “Girl”)

Francesca attended Columbia University, graduating summa cum laude and Phi Beta Kappa with a degree in Creative Writing. In the world of literary prose, she’s worked for Houghton Mifflin, McSweeney’s and The Believer; in 2013, her short story “Strayers” was a finalist for the Nelson Algren Award and published in the Chicago Tribune. This past year Francesca shot footage for an episodic series she wrote, directed and starred in entitled Roseland, a dark comedy about a delusional drug addict who thinks the apocalypse is coming. As an actor, she's appeared on CBS's Blue Bloods and in the Oscar-winning short "God of Love," and will be in the upcoming films Rebel in the Rye and The Undiscovered Country and season two of The Jim Gaffigan Show.

MAX ROSENAK (“Young Man”)

Max Rosenak is an actor, writer, director and educator based in New York City. Regional acting credits: Swimmers (Marin Theatre Company), Bad Jews (Magic Theatre), Orpheus Descending (Intiman Theatre). New York: 6969 (59E59 Theatre), Help Me to Make It (New Ohio Theatre). Film/TV: La Mission (2009 Sundance Film Selection), Laurence, Seducing Charlie Barker, Tosh.0. This winter Max received a residency to develop his solo show Before You Go at the IRT/New Ohio Theatre, and he is currently directing a feature documentary about his brother: We Found David Rosenak. He teaches with the Shakespeare Society and the 52nd Street Project. Education: BFA, Boston University. MFA, The American Conservatory Theater.

YONI SHRIRA (Cinematographer)

After receiving a BA in Film Studies from Hunter College, Yoni began working as a Camera Assistant on independent features, music videos, and commercials and also spent time interning at Arri CSC in New York. In the last year Yoni shot his first feature, Strawberry Flavored Plastic, a psychological “docu­style” thriller; The Last Summer is his second feature. Yoni currently attends AFI in their cinematography fellowship.

CHRISTINA CAMPAGNOLA (Producing Consultant)

Christina Campagnola oversees film finance, filmmaker development, and sales in the Independent Film Group at APA (Agency for the Performing Arts). During her time at APA she has sold award winning films in the festival circuit, including No Men Beyond This Point (TIFF 2015), Band of Robbers (LAFF 2015), Hunky Dory (Slamdance 2016, IFP Lab Participant), Goodnight Brooklyn (SXSW 2016), Free in Deed (Venice 2015, AFI 2015, SXSW 2016), and most recently, Let Me Make You a Martyr (Fantasia 2016). She started her career in distribution at Screen Media where she managed their SVOD platform. Christina is on the advisory board for the IFP and serves on the Dean’s Council of the Florida State University Film School. She is also a mentor at the Ghetto Film School in the Bronx. 

MEGAN KAPLER (Producer)

Megan Kapler joined two-time Academy Award winning filmmaker Barbara Kopple's production company Cabin Creek Films as a full-time associate producer in 2014. Her projects with Cabin Creek include, Hot Type: 150 Years of The Nation (2015),  Miss Sharon Jones! (2015), which premiered at TIFF and recently received a Critics Choice Award nomination, Shelter (2015), and Killing The Colorado (2016) for Discovery Impact. Megan is in pre-production on a comedy series entitled Great Times and is shifting from documentary to producing and directing narrative features. 

ALVARO CONGOSTO (Editor)

Álvaro Congosto is a Spanish editor, filmmaker and film professor at Boston University and Wheaton College. He holds an MFA in Film Production from Boston University where he studied as a Fulbright Grantee. As an editor, he works mainly for narrative fiction short and feature filmmakers such as Steven Tanenbaum, recently listed number 12 in the “The Top 100 Indie Filmmakers” book compiled by Del Weston. Alvaro’s latest short film, "The Suitor," has recently won the New Filmmakers from Spain contest and has screened at Worldwide prestigious festivals such as Montreal World Film Festival, Fort Lauderdale or New Jersey International Film Festival, where it also received the Best Short Film Award. You can find more about him and his latest film at www.alvarocongosto.com and thesuitorfilm.com.

LAWRENCE DREYFUSS (Assistant Director)

Lawrence Dreyfuss wants to chance the world through art. Lawrence was a Teach For America corps member in Hawaii where he taught high school English, ran the school's drama program and spearheaded a joint venture between the school and local public media. After teaching, Lawrence attended the graduate film production program at the University of Southern California. While there, he had the opportunity to work on SONY Pictures' The Shallows, Netflix original series Narcos, and as a liaison at the Academy of Motion Pictures. Today, he lives in New York City where he working to use media to spark social change. 

MICHAEL MOOTE (Sound Mixer)

Michael Moote is a production sound mixer living in Brooklyn, NY. He was born in Canada and immigrated to the United States in 2000, moving to Hartford, CT.  After graduating Boston University in 2011, he moved to New York where he has been recording sound for picture ever since. You can find Michael wandering New York on his folding bike or on his website,  michaelmoote.com. 

MIA TARLEY (Wardrobe)

Mia Darrow Tarley is an actress, writer, sometimes singer and songwriter who passionately collaborates with her filmmaking friends. She was honored to bring her fashion and costume know-how to this beautiful film.  

AURELIA COTTON (Production Design)

Aurelia Cotton is an artist, production designer, and prop stylist living in Brooklyn, New York. She was also a jewelry designer for Peppercotton, which she co-founded with a friend after graduating from RISD in 2009.  She can often be found wandering in Chelsea through the galleries or at her in-home studio in Brooklyn working on new projects.

story:
(tr)Ashley

Hey Guys and Gals,

Dennis here. I am the director of the short film (tr)Ashley. I am currently a film student in Full Sail University's online Digital Cinematography program. I have learned a lot, and have been afforded many opportunities to work on short films, and I am now working on my first feature film, Mack. You can see all of this on my IMDb Page. 

I am now approaching the end of my curriculum at Full Sail, and my final project is to make a short narrative film, about 4-8 minutes in length, which will showcase all of my talents and knowledge gained at FSU. Michael, the writer of (tr)Ashley, first introduced the idea of a lonely man that builds a woman out of trash, while we were participating in the Houston 48 Hour Film Project. We went with another story idea, but (tr)Ashley stayed on my mind, and a couple months later, I introduced the idea of using it for my thesis film, and Michael agreed, and wrote the script. 

Most of the cast and crew are assembled, and all we need now is funding. This is where you come in. Read below to find out more information about where your money will go, what perks you can gain, and what else you can do to help.

What We Need & What You Get

Your funding will help provide:

  • Equipment for the film (lenses, lights, etc.)
  • Food for the cast and crew
  • Payment for location use, and insurance (if necessary)
  • Props 
  • Funding to provide the perks listed

In return, you will get access some or all of the following perks:

  • Behind the scenes footage and photos
  • Blooper, as well as cast and crew interviews
  • Film commentary
  • A limited edition signed script
  • A digital copy of the short film
  • A limited edition signed poster by the cast and crew
  • Producer credit

The Impact

I am going to be honest, this film is not life changing, nor is it world changing. It will not save the whales, stop global warming, or end terrorism. However, that should not discourage one from telling a story. The impact this film will have is that a group of friend will be able to come together, and tell a fun and absurd story about a man that builds a woman out of trash. Then those friend can take that story and share it with the world. There are of course morals and lessons, but they take backseat to the idea that with the technology we have today, anyone can tell a story that can forever be immortalized into the medium of film.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenges for this short film is time and money. It is difficult to synchronize the schedules of 8-10 people over the course of a month, especially for little to no pay.  The challenges are great, but they do not make this project impossible. This short film has been in the works for several months now. The cast and crew are aware of the demands of the project and have worked to help schedule scenes efficiently.

The money problem is where you come in. By donating to this Indiegogo campaign, you are helping (tr)Ashley progress from an idea, to a reality.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you cannot donate at this time, no worries. We won't hold it against you.
  • If you could share using the Indiegogo social media tools, that would be appreciated.
  • It is just as important to share as it is to donate.

Cheers,

Dennis Tague
story_txt:
(tr)Ashley
Hey Guys and Gals,
Dennis here. I am the director of the short film (tr)Ashley. I am currently a film student in Full Sail University's online Digital Cinematography program. I have learned a lot, and have been afforded many opportunities to work on short films, and I am now working on my first feature film, Mack. You can see all of this on my IMDb Page. 
I am now approaching the end of my curriculum at Full Sail, and my final project is to make a short narrative film, about 4-8 minutes in length, which will showcase all of my talents and knowledge gained at FSU. Michael, the writer of (tr)Ashley, first introduced the idea of a lonely man that builds a woman out of trash, while we were participating in the Houston 48 Hour Film Project. We went with another story idea, but (tr)Ashley stayed on my mind, and a couple months later, I introduced the idea of using it for my thesis film, and Michael agreed, and wrote the script. 
Most of the cast and crew are assembled, and all we need now is funding. This is where you come in. Read below to find out more information about where your money will go, what perks you can gain, and what else you can do to help.

What We Need & What You Get
Your funding will help provide:

Equipment for the film (lenses, lights, etc.)
Food for the cast and crew
Payment for location use, and insurance (if necessary)
Props 
Funding to provide the perks listed

In return, you will get access some or all of the following perks:

Behind the scenes footage and photos
Blooper, as well as cast and crew interviews
Film commentary
A limited edition signed script
A digital copy of the short film
A limited edition signed poster by the cast and crew
Producer credit


The Impact
I am going to be honest, this film is not life changing, nor is it world changing. It will not save the whales, stop global warming, or end terrorism. However, that should not discourage one from telling a story. The impact this film will have is that a group of friend will be able to come together, and tell a fun and absurd story about a man that builds a woman out of trash. Then those friend can take that story and share it with the world. There are of course morals and lessons, but they take backseat to the idea that with the technology we have today, anyone can tell a story that can forever be immortalized into the medium of film.

Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenges for this short film is time and money. It is difficult to synchronize the schedules of 8-10 people over the course of a month, especially for little to no pay.  The challenges are great, but they do not make this project impossible. This short film has been in the works for several months now. The cast and crew are aware of the demands of the project and have worked to help schedule scenes efficiently.
The money problem is where you come in. By donating to this Indiegogo campaign, you are helping (tr)Ashley progress from an idea, to a reality.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate at this time, no worries. We won't hold it against you.
If you could share using the Indiegogo social media tools, that would be appreciated.
It is just as important to share as it is to donate.

Cheers,
Dennis Tague

story:
The story of Martha Curnutt 

Martha is a short-film centered around actual events that occurred in Missouri in 1843. In a crime that shocked her small town a woman by the name of Martha Curnutt was found guilty of the brutal murder of her husband. At the time of her conviction, Martha was one of two women  who had ever served in the state penitentiary and was forced to live among the male inmates.

In the 1800’s under the laws of coverture, a woman’s rights and privileges were given up to her husband and he was allowed to make any and all decisions in her regard. Under this system women were allowed to be beaten by their husband and be fully protected under the law of the United States. Martha was a product of that law and it is only when she took matters into her own hands did she start to have some control over her life, and the safety of her children. That freedom however, was short lived. She was quickly charged and forced to pay the price of her crime. Originally charged with murder, she was able to procure a lesser charge of first degree manslaughter and evaded the electric chair. 

While in prison she was harassed, threatened and tormented. The horrors on the inside of the penitentiary forced Martha to fight for her life and face her biggest challenges yet. The story of Martha is one of survival against all odds and perseverance against immense injustice. 

Now, to make this film we are looking for a little help in securing a budget, in order to fund locations, costumes, equipment and so much more. We  believe this project can be something special and we are depending on the generosity of friends, family and even strangers to bring her story back to life.  So if you at all feel moved to help with the project, any contribution would be appreciated. No donation is too small and we appreciate anything that you can give.  If not a donation, we would be equally as grateful for a share on Facebook! 

DIRECTOR:

ASHER MARKWORTH 

Asher is a second year student at the Colorado Film School currently pursuing a degree in Writing and Directing. He spent two years studying English and Communications at the University of Wyoming before moving to Colorado to pursue a career in the film industry.  

PRODUCERS:

DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY:

MORGAN ELLER
Morgan Eller is a graduate of the Colorado Film School with a degree in Cinematography. Her contagious energy and undeniable work ethic make her a true asset to any set that she steps onto, just ask anyone who has had the pleasure of working with her. She is a true blue Colorado native and is proud to live and work in the city of Denver. She is the owner of Mile High Moyg photography, a company that provides both still photography and videography for clients all around the state. Her other passions include the Denver Broncos, her family, her friends and of course her ability to bring joy to those around her through the art of the visual medium.

SOUND & EDITING:

JESSICA CARTER

Jessica Carter is an award winning sound designer and editor located in Denver. Owner of Edits by Jess post production company, she works with clients all across the Denver area and nationally. Jessica holds two bachelor’s degree in Mass Communications and Kinesiology from Kansas State University, as well as a Post Production degree from the Colorado Film School.

ASSISTANT DIRECTOR/PRODUCER:

BETSEY VANHULLE

Starting out her journey in the back of a pickup truck, watching a cowboy rescue an astronaut, Betsey has been in entranced by the cinema ever since. While other kids used their summers to party, Betsey used hers to explore further into the world she adored. By day her and her family would plan out the short and by night they would each take turns directing and starring in their own shorts.

Coming a long way from such small beginnings, Betsey has now spent numerous hours cultivating her skills in movie making by spending her adult life studying even father into the world of cinema. She has been anywhere from Production Designer and AD to Writer and Director. She loves every second of it and plans to continue to help on every movie she can.

CAST 

Lynne Jordan as Martha

Gary Neuger as the Warden

Jennifer Scott as Lenora, The Warden's Wife

*cast and crew will be added as they join our team!

What a Team!

I am so lucky to have a great team and  we hope you will join us in support as we make this film.

story:
The Story

The dead have risen to warn the living of the oncoming apocalypse, but no one cares.

ZOMB'D is a socio political satire based around the coming of the four horsemen of the apocalypse. Humanity has been invaded by the dead and has no clue how to deal with their new supernatural immigrants from the afterlife.

The World Foundation for Peace and Divinity (secretly the four horsemen War, Famine, Pestilence and Death) enlist an army of civilian recruits and mercenaries known as the "Z-Squad" to clean up the wandering undead nuisances that the Zomb's have become.

Ferris (played by Harley Neville), with the help of his recently deceased best friend Ed, the Society for Prevention of Cruelty for Zombies and a Nun assassin lead a zombie horde against the horsemen in an all-out quest to save humanity from self-destruction.

Short Summary

  • I am an independent film maker. Originally I started in the industry as an animator on Walt Disney Television contracts. These days I prefer to deal with subjects that are not so Disney friendly. 
  • We are all angry with the horror's of our modern world. To be able to laugh at them is an important part of dealing and diffusing the problems. After all, the greatest weapon against Terrorism is laughter!
  • We are trying to move our careers on to the next level. This project is my vessel to allow us to help raise us all up together. We can learn together in a fun environment, elevate our craft and hopefully win some festival prizes along the way.

What We Need & What You Get

  • While we need more than our campaign goal of $500 we wanted to keep things small to begin with. Ideally we would need a minimum of $1400 to shoot this pilot and $10000 to film the entire series at an extremely low budget and reduced rates. With this campaign even after the three weeks is up you can continue to support us on this campaign and maintain a presence in our community.
  • Our campaign is unique in that there is transparency in regards to where your contribution will be used.
  • If we do not reach our entire goal the campaign funds will be used to cover the basics, such as zombie contact lenses, some items of costume (Z-Squad Tactical Vests), catering and petrol.

The Impact

  • Right now the world needs to regain it's sense of humor. The dead are vilified into wandering cannibals devoid of empathy, as the living worry about how many likes their posts get on Facebook. I want to reclaim the dead from George Romero's "Night of the living dead" and ABC's "The Walking Dead". I want to give them their soul's back, because dead people need love too! Otherwise what are all those flowers on the graves all about? 
  • This is not the first time I have made a production with limited resources. Valley of the Succubus proved at least that I have a unique voice and some one at the Court Metrage selection committee at 67th Festival de Cannes  heard it. 
  • We want to keep making projects and we need your help. There is no doubt that these are not the projects that we can make a living off but at least with your help we don't need to take such a big loss as we work toward that goal of sustainability. The magic of crowdfunding is that a trickle from many streams becomes a powerful resource for both raising funds and proving we have an audience for our production.This is where you can get involved, as family, friends, partners or just interested members of the public who just want to help.

Risks & Challenges

  • This is not my first production. I have 25+ years experience on Film Making at a low budget level and for the bigger studio's such as Walt Disney Television. I live, eat and breath film making and script writing. All we want is a chance to really show what we are capable of doing, without the usual struggle that comes with having no budget. It's a struggle enough to create a film without working with one hand tied behind your back or working on an empty stomach.
  • I have made a career out of problem solving. Finding solutions at cost and cheaper than my predecessors. Even now as I prepare to shoot I'm running through multiple scenario's to roll with the punches should something go wrong. I mean, something can ALWAYS go wrong! But I'm a problem solver and I'm prepared. Help me to be in an even better position to deal with any issues as they occur! Give us your support and donate to one or more of these wonderful perks we have created for you, so that you can secure your position in the community around our film and cinematographic family!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you just can't contribute, We understand that! but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • You can help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about our project!

I live, eat and breath film making and script writing. All we want is a chance to really show what we are capable of doing, without the usual struggle that comes with having no budget. It's a struggle enough to create a film without working with one hand tied behind your back or working on an empty stomach.
I have made a career out of problem solving. Finding solutions at cost and cheaper than my predecessors. Even now as I prepare to shoot I'm running through multiple scenario's to roll with the punches should something go wrong. I mean, something can ALWAYS go wrong! But I'm a problem solver and I'm prepared. Help me to be in an even better position to deal with any issues as they occur! Give us your support and donate to one or more of these wonderful perks we have created for you, so that you can secure your position in the community around our film and cinematographic family!


Other Ways You Can Help
Some of you just can't contribute, We understand that! but that doesn't mean you can't help:

You can help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
You can use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about our project!

story:
Producer's statement:

Thanks to the digital revolution, we are more vividly exposed to images of violent conflict in remote corners of the world than ever before. Yet, even though 2016 is the 70th anniversary of the creation of the United Nations , few people in the world are aware that that there are currently 16 active United Nations Peacekeeping Missions and 126,247 U.N. Peacekeepers on the ground, with a total budget of $8.47 billion,  trying to resolve these conflicts and protect civilian lives,

This is a serious deficiency, because UN Peacekeeping is acting in the name of the international community, and the international community should know what it being done in their name. There is no question that UN Peacekeeping is becoming of increased importance in countries of the world in need of rule of law and stability to recover from the ravages of armed conflict, Indeed, it is safe to say that the international community has learned from past mistakes that unilateral interventions are neither viable nor sustainable, as we can now see in Iraq.

For political and structural reasons, the UN lacks the capacity to produce documentaries which can explain the nuances and complexities of each UN Peacekeeping mission. Fortunately, there are some decision makers in the UN who recognize the deficiencies of the organization, and they usually support documentarians who try to provide this service.

The same cannot be said for the corporate media entities who ; instead of producing quality documentaries themselves on UN peacekeeping efforts around the world, they prefer to deride UN efforts as simplistic propaganda.

As a result, to the best of our knowledge, there is currently no feature documentary on the market  which shows any U.N. Peacekeeping mission in action.

The goal of this documentary feature is therefore to tell the untold story of the largest and oldest of these missions, MONUSCO, the United Nations Stabilization Mission to the Congo. A MISSION IMPOSSIBLE: THE UNITED NATIONS IN THE CONGO is a featuredocumentary  (c. 90 min ) about the Sisyphean struggle of MONUSCO to bring peace and stability to the Congo. This will not be an official UN History, but a personal narrative about individual UN Peacekeepers and Congolese working on the ground, based on our many years in the Congo as members of the MONUSCO Video Unit, and will be told in a personal, reflexive style. The documentary will be in 5 parts, and narrator Clarke Peters will introduce the themes of each part. (Please see  https://vimeo.com/97417755 for teaser)

We believe that a documentary revealing the complexities and challenges confronting the world’s largest and oldest UN Peacekeeping mission would be an ideal program to help commemorate the 70 th Anniversary of the United Nations anywhere in the world.

Production Strategy

Producer Ted Folke worked in the Congo as Chief of the MONUSCO Video Unit from 2007-2012, and has thus had the benefit of an extensive period of research on the ground, as well as an opportunity to produce a great deal of original material for this documentary. All of this material can be used in the final documentary free of charge, thanks to the MONUSCO Department of Public Information, which has a mandate to support all independent documentaries on the mission and its activities. A written release from MONUSCO PID has already been granted.

This original material will serve as the basis for this documentary, along with a series of interviews with UN and MONUSCO officials, past and present. Those interviewed  include former U.N. and DPKO administrators such as Kofi Annan, Jean Marie Guehenno, William Lacey Swing, and Abdallah Wafy, along with current administrators such as U.N. Secretary General Ban Ki Moon,  DPKO ASG  Herve Ladsous, MONUSCO SRSG Martin Kobler, MONUSCO Force Commander General Santos Cruz, ASG Leila Zerrougui, and Chair of the U.N. Panel on Peacekeeping, Nobel Laureate Jose Ramos Horta, and Kambale Musavuli of Friends of the Congo.

 UNTV has generously donated the use of their state of the art new television studios for this production, thus saving us the expense of a trip to the DRC, and post-production with editor Meriton Ahmeti in London is scheduled for September, 2016.

Ted currently is looking through 100 hours of original MONUSCO material for the film on hard drives and DVDS, and is preparing to start a paper cut.  

We are seeking to raise $20,000 through Indie GoGo to make it possible to have this film ready for international distribution by the end of 2016.

The timing is critical because the Congolese Presidential elections scheduled for November of 2016 are looming ahead as a moment of truth both for the UN and the DRC. The Congolese Constitution strictly limits the president to two terms in office, and current President Joseph Kabila is scheduled to turn over power to a new president after November's election. Unfortunately, in spite of pressure from the international community, President Kabila,like some African colleagues,  appears intent upon remaining in power as long as possible. The crisis caused by his apparent decision has already begun, and will only escalate in the coming months. 

If you look at the Perks section, you will see links to a number of rare videos about the DRC and UN-related subjects available for $10 each. Everyone who contributes $10 or more can chose a link, and we will send you the password. All video files can then be shared, embedded or downloaded at your discretion.

We recommend you start with our Featured Perk, HUMAN RIGHTS, which is a  complete 33 minute sample chapter from A MISSION IMPOSSIBLE: THE U.N. AND THE CONGO, and is a powerful profile of the work of the MONUC Human Rights Division. On May 24th of this year, the Rosendale Theatre in upstate New York showed HUMAN RIGHTS to launch their New Artists' Series, and audience response was positive and passionate.

We have set $20,000 as the goal for this crowdsourcing campaign, because that is the minimum we need to complete post-production and still feed our families. However, where there is a will, there is a way, and we are resolved to find the backing we need and finish this important film on schedule.

Whatever you can contribute will be gratefully appreciated, and , if you can contribute nothing, please just share and spread the word.  Thanks to organizations like #FriendsoftheCongo and #StandwithCongo, the country is beginning to get the buzz it deserves.

Many thanks - and , as they say in Timor Leste," A LUTA CONTINUA!"
Please see our Facebook Home Page for more. including free videos!:)https://www.facebook.com/amissionimpossible/

If you look at the Perks section, you will see links to a number of rare videos about the DRC and UN-related subjects available for $10 each. Everyone who contributes $10 or more can chose a link, and we will send you the password. All video files can then be shared, embedded or downloaded at your discretion.
We recommend you start with our Featured Perk, HUMAN RIGHTS, which is a  complete 33 minute sample chapter from A MISSION IMPOSSIBLE: THE U.N. AND THE CONGO, and is a powerful profile of the work of the MONUC Human Rights Division. On May 24th of this year, the Rosendale Theatre in upstate New York showed HUMAN RIGHTS to launch their New Artists' Series, and audience response was positive and passionate.
We have set $20,000 as the goal for this crowdsourcing campaign, because that is the minimum we need to complete post-production and still feed our families. However, where there is a will, there is a way, and we are resolved to find the backing we need and finish this important film on schedule.
Whatever you can contribute will be gratefully appreciated, and , if you can contribute nothing, please just share and spread the word.  Thanks to organizations like #FriendsoftheCongo and #StandwithCongo, the country is beginning to get the buzz it deserves.


Many thanks - and , as they say in Timor Leste," A LUTA CONTINUA!"
Please see our Facebook Home Page for more. including free videos!:)https://www.facebook.com/amissionimpossible/

story:
Closer Than We Think is a film about the future. 


From 1958 to 1963, a Sunday comic strip predicted the future. Arthur Radebaugh's Closer Than We Think represents mid-century futurism at its most daring and optimistic. From Robot Driving to Space Monkey Colonies, Radebaugh's visions of the future heavily influenced The Jetsons and many of his predictions have come true in the decades since the strip first ran in newspapers. 



Our film explores the panels of Closer Than We Think, examines what it is to be a futurist, and serves as a biography of Arthur and the arc of his life and work. We've interviewed designers Syd Mead (Tron, Blade Runner), and Rick Guidice (NASA), Futurists including Kirk Citron (Editor of The Long News), scientist Aubrey de Grey (SENS Research Foundation), historians of mid-century futurism Hampton C. Wayt (Curator of Driving Through Futures Past) Todd Kimmell and the other curators of the exhibit Radebaugh: The Future We Were Promised and Matt Novak of the Paleofuture blog. 

Arthur Radebaugh remains incredibly elusive---and that's one of the reasons we wanted to start this campaign while the film is still in production. 

No audio or video of Radebaugh has yet been uncovered. 



Additionally, there are key strips of Closer Than We Think that we still haven't found. We hope someone who sees this campaign might have a few pieces squirreled away somewhere. We're also hoping to make contact with more people who actually knew Radebaugh, or who remember seeing Closer Than We Think in their local paper. 

We want this campaign to be seen widely so that we might have the chance to find and include those works, and have a chance to speak with those people before the film is complete. 

The money we're raising will cover travel for our remaining interviews, an original score, licensing of historical footage, and sound mix for the film. 

This is an amazing opportunity to fill in a missing piece of history---and to honor Arthur Radebaugh (1906-1974), from those of us living in his future.

story:
Post Production Begins:

A year ago, we began what was a journey to bring a story about todays culture.  What todays technology filled life is like and what communication and social media has bridged together.  Start Broadcast would not have happened if the donations of the amazing people on social media did not believe in what we were trying to put forth for the world to see.  This is why now we are looking to close the doors on filming and push towards putting a beautiful story together to show the world who these individuals, pioneers, influencers are.  What they mean to the future of social media and how an application in live streaming put together faces and stories from across the globe together. We want to tell the stories that are making the world a more interesting and better place for all of us.

Every little last bit helps and thats what we want right now! To make this happen for you and us at Start Broadcast! 



About Our Documentary:

Our lives are relying more and more on technology.  As a result, it has often been said there is a continuing decline in human interaction and connection. The live streaming app Periscope, which combines live, in-the-moment video and text on mobile and tablet, has become a way to establish that human contact--something we as human beings need and crave.

Film director and daily live streamer Alexis Cardoza found solace in Periscope after losing his brother suddenly. The app allowed him to find comfort by connecting with others during his time of need.  Since the release of the live streaming app in March 2015, Alexis has met hundreds of people around the world who hit the “start broadcast” button, allowing a peek into their lives through Periscope: some have risen to the ranks of Periscope celebrities, some are actual Hollywood stars, and others have overcome fears and obstacles in their personal lives, all due to a piece of technology. START BROADCAST is a documentary about their journey--what brought them to Periscope and what has transpired since hitting “start broadcast”.

Risks & Challenges

In supporting the Indiegogo of START BROADCAST, you will be funding the documentation of the latest social media platform. Imagine if there was footage of the early days of Apple with Steve Jobs & Steve Wozniak or Facebook with Mark Zuckerberg--how priceless those moments would be today in light of what these technological, life changing advances have become!  This documentary film will capture the early days of Periscope and live streaming which have already evolved in a quick span of time.  It is our hope that you will join us on our journey and become part of the START BROADCAST team by donating here on Indiegogo.

Why Should I Back This Indiegogo? (Or, Why Should I Give You My Hard-Earned Cash?)

Good question. We think there are a few good answers:

  • First, as long as you give $25, you’ve pre-bought the movie. It’s a fair deal. You support a movie and some filmmakers you care about, and then you get to own the movie forever. We think it's better to sell you something than to just ask for a handout.
  • Third, and most importantly, is you will bring a movie about a dynamic community to life--by the community and for the community. Maybe you love Periscope and live streaming, or you love movies like START BROADCAST, or you’re friends with one of us.

Regardless of the reason, just like Periscope, START BROADCAST wouldn’t exist without you.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can donate funds and that's okay, here's how else you can help:

  • Help us get the word out about our documentary! Tweet, Facebook, Periscope, Snapchat, Facebook live all about us! Use the #StartBroadcast when you do
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word!

Who We Are:

Alexis Cardoza/Director

Alex's Website

Alexis IMDB

Born in Puerto Rico, raised in New Jersey he enlisted in the U.S. Marines right out of high school and served his country proudly.  He now spends his days creating content for YouTube® and is also a daily broadcaster on Persicope®.  Most of his videos on YouTube® consist of vlogs in which he either gives advice on certain mainstream guy related material or puts in his 2 cents on organic material in the tech world. 

He has worked with several high end production companies, owns a iRadio station (ClubZone.FM), and freelances in graphic and web design.

Recently he finished and earned his degree in DIGITAL MEDIA TECHNOLOGY and is working on several documentaries.  The most recent a student film entitled PRESS RECORD.  

Gretchen Pitluk/Producer/Director of Photography

Gretchen IMDB

After graduating from Columbia College, Bend, Oregon called Gretchen Pitluk’s name, where she created local commercials at KTVZ NewsChannel 21.  Doing everything from pre to postproduction, she even revamped the local Blockbuster spots, which won her a few Addy and Drake Awards.  Pitluk also learned the ropes of live news directing and took over as the Senior Technical Director of the main evening newscasts on NBC and FOX.  With only two people running the shows, she was responsible for TDing, robotic cameras, video playback, and directing on each show–making her quite the capable multi-tasker.

Missing Chi-Town, she brought her knowledge of video production back to the University of Illinois (UIC), where she was responsible for content creation and running the university’s television channel, HTV33. She has now taken up the task of post sound supervision at NoiseFloor, applying her skill set to The Golf Channel’s Our Longest Drive and spots for clients such as Clariol, Yoplait, and General Mills. Gretchen also has an ear for casting just the right voice or finding the perfect music for projects. She also freelances for Big Ten Network as a TD, an editor for HGTV, and currently edits/color corrects for indie films and webisodes.

A.J Olstad/Sound Recorder

A.J's IMDB

A.J. Olstad developed his passion for sound from his love for watching films and wondering how the sounds were made and wanting to recreate them. This curiosity jump started his lifelong career in sound. 

A.J. Olstad graduated from Columbia College Chicago in Spring 2015 with a Bachelor of Arts in Audio for Visual Media. During his college career he was the sound designer for films that won in the Chicago International Film Festival as well as numerous other independent festivals. He also expanded his sound career being a location sound recorder. He went to places such as Sri Lanka, Wyoming, and Miami collaborating with many talented people and learning a different side of sound. 

After graduating, A.J. landed an internship with NoiseFloor Ltd. located in the heart of Chicago and quickly became acclimated to the professional clientele and workflow. He also freelances as a location sound recorder through NoiseFloor Ltd. but also from jobs that he obtains through his professional contacts. He takes each day as a learning opportunity and will for the rest of his career.

Devin Delaney/Music 

Devin's IMDB

One score and seven years ago, in the Bay area of our beautiful nation’s 31st state, a child was born to a family of Chicago transplants. This child was named Devin, and little did the world know that henceforth Midwestern advertising music would be moderately impacted.

Devin Delaney is NoiseFloor’s composer, music supervisor and all around music nerd. Since joining the NoiseFloor crew in 2010, Devin has composed music for clients such as Kohler, Cricket Wireless, Coors Light, Cadence Health, Brother P-Touch, McDonald’s, UPS, American Federation of Labor, Hefty, and many others. Devin created original scores for the iOS games Avengers Initiative: Hulk and Captain America, the indie feature The Moleman of Belmont Avenue as well as variety of short films. His favorite part of composition is that he gets to create and produce music within a wide variety of genres and styles.

Dev grew up playing guitar, bass, and writing songs for  pop-rock bands in the ‘burbs of Chicago. His love of music production and modern composition led him to Berklee College of Music in Boston. He graduated magna cum laude with a dual major in Music Production & Engineering and Songwriting. In addition to playing a slew of stringed instruments, Devin is borderline obsessed with music technology. He is constantly seeking new sounds, samples, and software to enhance his creativity, sonic palette and efficiency.  Outside of NoiseFloor, Devin is an avid fan of the Chicago Bulls, video games, pretentious beer, cheese omelets, and soy lattes.

story:
KILL PILL 

STARRING BRITAIN'S HOTTEST RISING STARS

Check out our IMDB





TWITTER - @KILLPILLMOVIE
LEMFILM PRODUCTIONS LTD


                       Example of our directing work and previous films




SUMMARY


LEM Films Productions Ltd are seeking an additional investment of £10,000 to produce a taster short film showcasing Britain's hottest new actors. This short 20 minutes film will be used to show to investors and gain a following at festivals worldwide. With plans for a feature film to be filmed next year.

Currently we have secured £15,000 worth of postproduction costs from Pinewood Studios working with the team behind Star Wars. Also we are also aiming to raise up to £5,500 from this IndieGoGo crowdfunding.

With the continued popularity of the horror film genre targeted at the youth market, we are looking to create an exciting new franchise Kill Pill featuring the cream of young British talent.

Casting agent Lee Mountjoy (Vendetta, Age of Kill) has assembled a stunning cast of great British talent. Signed on in lead roles are world parkour champion Pip Andersen who JJ Abrams cast as the lead Stormtrooper in Star Wars Episode VII: The Force Awakens. Also appearing is Liam Boyle star of Skins and Awaydays  and BBC Landgirls star Jo Woodcock (All of whom will take part in the feature film). Youtube star Danny Robinson will also make his screen debut. This talented cast are all on the verge of becoming household names and it is expected Kill Pill will benefit from their exposure and contribute towards their future success. On board with horror special effects is the award-winning artist Ryan Bowless. Andy McKee is on board as editor, following editing Universal Feature films Age of Kill and Bonded by Blood 2.

INVESTOR OFFER

Kill Pill is looking for individual investors or Production Company to invest £10,000 to be a part of an exciting new British horror film franchise. Kill Pill is to be made on £30,500 budget, produced to be cinema standard quality and will tour horror film festivals worldwide. The film is already slotted to have its World Premier screening as part of this year’s Iris Prize Festival taking place in Cardiff this October. This is a chance be part of an exciting potentially lucrative franchise from day one. While it is naturally hoped we can return a profit to investors, we urge investors to only invest funds if they wish to support this vision.

Production Funding £30,500

Private Equity - £10,000

Indiegogo - £5,500

Pinewood Studios Award - £15,000

Production Timeline

June ‘16 – Financing/Pre-Production

20 - 23rd July ‘16 - 3-day shoot

August ‘16 – Post production at Pinewood Studios

September ‘16 – Final Cut

October ‘16 – World Premiere at Iris Prize Film Festival

December ‘16 - Submission to Berlin, Sundance, Tribeca

2017 - International Film Festival run

Summer 2017 - Shoot the feature length film


Indiegogo PERKS! What We Need & What You Get

In order to ensure a high quality film we need your help to raise £15,000 to fund the making of this short film KILL PILL to cover our costs e.g. props, costumes, location, special effects makeup, catering, insurance, equipment and other expenses including securing a high caliber cast and crew.
This short film  KILL PILL will be 20 minutes long (approx) and be used to tour around Film Festivals worldwide, (with the future plan being for this film to eventually be made into a  KILL PILL feature film in 2017/18).  The short film KILL PILL will also become available for the public via streaming services online.

We have some FANTASTIC perks for your support including:

- BE KILLED IN THE FILM!! - That's right - you get your own 'on screen death'!
Ever wanted to be torn apart by a zombie? - While now's your chance!

-BE IN THE FILM - You can be an extra in the film  - we have a party scene where you can be part of the Apocalypse on screen!

-BE AN ASSOCIATE PRODUCER-  Want a producer credit on a film that's going to tour the world? Well now is your chance! You can also come on set and see the magic happen and meet the cast and crew!


PLANS

Your contribution will mean we can expand on Kill Pill and it's universe

This isn't just a short horror film , this is the start of what we hope to be a franchise of future feature films expanding on this apocalyptic universe.  The short will be used as phase 1 of the feature film and also works as a standalone short - setting up this universe we hope to expand.

The film also has social commentary on the dangers of illegal drug use we've mixed this very real life danger with fictional horror to create a universe in which the audience can relate to.

WHAT THE MONEY WILL BE SPENT ON

Pre Production

£2000  - Script development, Location payment, Casting Director , Post Production Producer costs, Production Manager costs.

Production

£11,000 - Crew and Cast  , equipment hire, costume, accommodation and travel for cast and crew, props, gore, prosthetic,  catering, insurance, hard drives,

Post Production

(' £14000 pinewood prize in kind' - IRIS PRIZE)

Needed- £2000 - festival entries, marketing, editor,


“WE NEED YOUR HELP!

If you want to help us finish our film, “KILL PILL: PHASE 1”, please donate to this campaign.

HELP US SPREAD THE WORD!

After you complete your transaction, Indiegogo will give you the option to send a message to your friends and followers on Facebook and Twitter.

This message will inform your friends that you just backed us and will include a link to our campaign page (you'll be able to edit the text). Please send these messages! It only takes a second and it'll be a huge help!

option to send a message to your friends and followers on
Facebook and Twitter.

This message will inform your friends that you just backed us and
will include a link to our campaign page (you'll be able to edit the
text). Please send these messages! It only takes a second and it'll
be a huge help!

story:
Short Summary

Jim Fidler left his home and family in Conception Bay South, Newfoundland at the age of 9 to attend the Halifax School for the blind where he would spend the next 9 years. This and inspirational story that shows how someone blind can overcome the obstacles he is faced with and not only thrive, but encourage others. 

We will tell the story of how Jim met his Father for the first time in his early 20's and discovered that he has a rich musical heritage and 2 musician brothers and cousin, Christina Aguilera. 

The film will paint a picture of the thriving St. John's music scene in the 80's and 90's in which Jim played a huge role. We have a multitude of musical guests including: Alan Doyle, The Navigators, The Secrets, Darrell Power, Colleen Power and many more. It will show how Newfoundland music has evolved and the rich culture and musical heritage. We also have international guests from Ireland, Scotland, France, The US, Canada and the Carribbean. 

This film is in the final production stages with a launch planned on October 7th at the Geo Centre in St. John's. The screening will coincide with the launch of Jim's new album 'Signals from an Ancient Future.

The above video is a short promo, since then we've done a lot of work and you can see some of the interviews in the gallery.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The film is nearly completed. We have a date for the official screening of October 7th at the Geo Centre in St. John's.  

However, we still have some remaining production expenses. One of which is the purchase of some very very important footage from CTV. Just before Jim went completely blind at the age of 9, CTV came to Newfoundland with Uncle Bobby to do an interview with him. It's an amazing piece of footage and we really need it to complete the story. However the footage is going to cost about $4000.00, something that we just don't have in our budget :.) 

We also need to purchase another piece of footage from CBC in Toronto - this is also a very important piece from a show called 'Ear to the Ground'. Not to give too much away but Jim and his reggae group Pressure Drop went to to Toronto to shoot for this very popular music show. The night before the shooting, Jim had an accident on the street in downtown Toronto. To make a long story short, he came home in a wheel chair, had two operations and was unable to walk for 6 months. After he recovered, Ear to the Ground came to St. John's to do the show on the group. It's very well done and we really need it.  The cost of this footage will be about $2000.00

The rest of the funds will go towards the manufacturing of a DVD of the film. 

Please have a look at the perks. Anyone signing up will also have their name in the thank you section at the end of the film.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute financially, I completely understand, but you can share this campaign and tell others about it. Everything helps. You can also send me a message and I'll keep you posted on the screening of the film in October.
