story:
WHAT’S THE STORY?

My fictional short film ‘LETTERS’ is an exceptional story of a Indian man serving the British army who was in charge of censoring letters during the World War 2. 

The uniqueness of the subject is that though it's fiction but it's set in 1944 ITALY during the Battle of MONTE CASSINO which was actually fought. The film draws lot of inspiration from the real letters written by soldiers to their families.  This film will take us back in time which was one of the darkest periods of human history. 

Our story is emotional and yet engaging and will touch you deeply.


WHAT IS 'LETTER CENSORSHIP'? Letter censorship started during World War 1 and even continued in World War 2. It was basically to advise servicemen and other citizens to avoid careless talks concerning secure information that might be of use to the enemy. 

And one way of doing so was by CENSORING LETTERS.


WHERE CAN THE FILM GO?

Such a subject dealing with Nazis and World Wars have always been a favourite at prestigious film festivals and for international awards whether it’s the Oscars, BAFTA or the Cannes. My effort is to make the film of that standard and quality so it can compete at that level.

 And you valuable contribution to meeting the target money required will make it possible for me and my team to deliver standards of infinite excellence.


IT’S ME! WRITER-DIRECTOR

Hi! My name is Nitin Shingal and I am the writer-director of the film ‘LETTERS’. My journey as a filmmaker began in 2001 when after completing MBA from a top business school in India and giving a lucrative corporate job, I came to Bombay and worked in the film industry. During my formative years as a filmmaker I worked as an assistant on some landmark films and with the biggest production houses- Vinod Chopra Films and Yash Raj Films. I took a plunge to direct my own films and in 2007 I made ‘KINDLE’ a psychological thriller, which was selected and nominated at International festivals in Rome, Stuttgart, Karachi and Florence. I also worked on Advertising films and worked on writing screenplays for features. In 2016 I made another short film ‘RICE BOWL’ which was at the Short Film Corner, Cannes and has been selected for film festivals in Karakoy (Turkey) and Hague (Netherlands). It is still expecting results from a lot of festivals. Apart from this I am producing an English language feature film set in Malaysia in collaboration with a production house based in Singapore and Malaysia and working on my feature films script to direct next year. 


MY TEAM:  I will make sure that there are top of the line DoP, Art Director, Costume Stylist, Sound Engineer, Post Production specialist, etc who have worked in big budgeted films and are well know for their work in India and Abroad. 


WHAT WE NEED:

Friends, the budget of the film is targeted USD 32,500. It will be top of the line filmmaking and quality when it comes to camera, sound, lights and post- production etc. The budget of the film is divided into Pre-production (16%), Production (47%), Post -production (15%), Marketing/Advertising (17%) with some part kept buffer for contingency (5%). 


However, If I reach a mammoth figure of 2.1 million USD will make this idea into a full -length feature film. 

THAT WILL BE JUST AWESOME!


WHAT WE CAN GIVE YOU:

We've got some fantastic rewards for our backers including:

·  A heartfelt thank you via our Facebook and Twitter channels.

·  An exclusive preview link to the film before it hits the festivals.

·  DVD/ posters/ scripts

·  Your name up on the big screen in the credits of the film.

·  Passes to our premiere


IF YOU ARE NOT ABLE TO CONTRIBUTE. DON’T WORRY! BE A PART STILL OF OUR CAMPAIGN

You can also support us by sharing our page with your family and friends with the Indiegogo share tools!


Thanks... 


Email: lettersthefilm2016@gmail.com

Twitter: @lettersthefilm

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/lettersthefilm/?ref=ay...

story:
This campaign is closed.

Check it out and then go to

PIIGS new campaign here:

PIIGS - Debunking Euro austerity PART 2

 

 Questa campagna è chiusa.

Per donare vai alla nuova

campagna 

di PIIGS qui:

PIIGS - Debunking Euro austerity PART 2

 

 

trailer in italiano

 

 

At last a Southern European country

stands up tall against

mainstream austerity dogmas!

Finalmente un Paese del sud Europa alza la testa contro i dogmi dell'austerity!

 

 

 

Join us on Facebook and Twitter

 Seguici su Facebook e Twitter

 

WE ARE JUST ONE STEP LEFT!

WE NEED FUNDING FOR POST-PRODUCTION FINALIZATION!

 CI MANCA SOLO L'ULTIMO PASSO:

LA FINALIZZAZIONE DELLA POST PRODUZIONE!

 

Per supportarci con un'offerta non devi far altro che

scegliere uno dei "perks" qui a destra

da 10€ a 5.000€,

oppure fare un'offerta libera cliccando

sul bottone "BACK IT"  sopra i "perks".

 

      

     

 

 

 ____________________________________________

 

"PIIGS" - Feature lenght documentary

   "PIIGS" - Documentario lungometraggio

PIIGS is a movie halfway between Inside Job (2010 documentary about USA 2008 financial crisis) and the “proletarian tales” by Ken Loach.

      PIIGS è un film a metà strada tra Inside Job (documentario del 2010 sulla crisi finanziaria  USA) e le storie proletarie di Ken Loach.

PIIGS is an exciting and revolutionary journey into the very heart of the tragic European economic crisis. This extraordinary documentary - made by the three filmmakers after five years of research and two years of shooting - is a Southern European take into austerity dogma and states with the voice of prestigious international economists, intellectuals and experts, that the origin of the European debt crisis is not the inadequacy of people in crisis countries but the very foundation of euro itself.

       È un viaggio affascinante e rivoluzionario nel cuore della tragica crisi economica europea. Realizzato da tre filmmaker dopo cinque anni di ricerche e due di riprese, PIIGS è un'immersione senza precedenti  e senza censure nei dogmi dell'austerity e afferma con la voce di prestigiosi economisti, intellettuali ed esperti internazionali che l'origine della crisi dei debiti europei non risiede nell'inadeguatezza delle popolazioni dei Paesi in crisi ma nelle fondamenta stesse dell'euro.

 

 

Unfortunately people are not immune to bad decision making, and the documentary shows how austerity turns into practice in Rome, focusing on a survival story of a cooperative assisting disabled people.

      Il documentario racconta anche le dirette conseguenze dell'austerity a Roma, concentrandosi sulla storia della sopravvivenza di una Cooperativa sociale che assiste disabili e persone svantaggiate.

Outskirts of Rome, today. Claudia is trying to save the Cooperative company “Il Pungiglione” (“The Sting”) from bankrupt. “Il Pungiglione" is owed an amount of 1 million euros from municipality and Region and risks of closing down forever: 100 workers will remain unemployed and 150 disabled/autistic people won’t have any further assistance. It’s a ticking time social bomb.

      Dintorni di Roma, oggi. Claudia sta provando a salvare la Cooperativa "Il Pungiglione" dal fallimento. "Il Pungiglione" ha un credito di un milione di euro dal comune e dalla regione e rischia di chiudere per sempre: 100 dipendenti perderanno il lavoro e 150 disabili rimarranno senza assistenza. È una bomba sociale a orologeria. 

Is it true that in the Euro zone there is no alternative to Austerity, to Fiscal Compact, to budget balance, to welfare spendig cuts? To the bankrupt of "Il Pungiglione"? 

      È vero che nell'Eurozona non c'è alternativa all'austerity, al Fiscal Compact, al pareggio di bilancio, ai tagli alla spesa sociale? Al fallimento del "Pungiglione"?

       

 

What they say about "PIIGS"

     Cosa dicono di "PIIGS"

 

             ["Wonderful editing, great rhythm, engaging story, a perfect framework".        Marcello Paolillo, Nexo Digital]

              ["Montato egregiamente, incalzante, avvincente, con una struttura perfetta". M. Paolillo, Nexo Digital]

 

             ["Technically excellent. The story of the Cooperative is really touching!" Thomas Fazi, journalist]

               ["Tecnicamente eccellente, autorevole e avvincente. La storia della Cooperativa è molto emozionante." Thomas Fazi, journalist]

      

                 ["Three Italian directors challenge capitalism."  Diego Fusaro, Il Fatto Quotidiano]

                 ["Tre registi italiani sfidano il capitalismo". Diego Fusaro , Il Fatto Quotidiano] 

 

                        ["La crisi economica diventa un soggetto da cinema di qualità." Federico Rampini, Affari e Finanza La Repubblica]

 

               ["An unprecedent and uncensored immersion in the origins of the economic crisis." Camillo De Marco, Cineuropa]

                  ["Un'immersione senza precedenti e senza censure nelle origini della crisi economica". Camillo De Marco su Cineuropa.org]

 

               ["PIIGS teaser trailer looks pretty good! It looks to be strong on MMT". Stephanie Kelton]

                 ["Il teaser di PIIGS è molto bello! Inoltre è molto attinente alla MMT" . Stephanie Kelton]

 

 

PIIGS could be one of the most important documentary of these last 8 years, since the economic crisis started: it debunks those austerity dogmas which are  dramatically impoverishing Europe. 

     PIIGS potrebbe essere uno dei più importanti documentari degli ultimi 8 anni, da quando cioè la crisi economica è iniziata: smaschera quei dogmi dell'austerità che stanno drammaticamente impoverendo l'Europa. 

 


Who are we

   Chi siamo

We are three Italian award-winning independent filmmakers. Our works always focused on delicate matters like immigration, poverty, politics, economics, terrorism, as well as cinema, visual art, literature. We made feature films, documentaries, short movies, webseries.

      Siamo tre filmmaker indipendenti italiani. Con i nostri lavori ci siamo occupati di argomenti delicati come immigrazione, povertà, politica, economia, terrorismo, ma anche di cinema, arti visive, letteratura. Abbiamo realizzato lungometraggi, documentari, cortometraggi e webserie.

Stanley and Us - All'ombra del gigante - Voci migranti - Spread Zero

 

 

 

(from left)

Adriano Cutraro,

Mirko Melchiorre,

Federico Greco

 

 

 

 

This time we decided to investigate prevalent European budgetary policies and the austerity dogma. Because we believe that precisely those dogmas produce poverty, unemployment, social conflicts.

     Stavolta abbiamo deciso di indagare i dogmi dell'austerità e le politiche monetarie dominanti in Europa. Perché crediamo che esattamente quei dogmi stiano producendo povertà, disoccupazione e conflitti sociali.

As Italians piigs we want to understand how and why we became "pigs". Is it because we're lazy? Or maybe because we are tax evaders?    

We also feel that we MUST do something to understand what's happening to that "Europe of the people" its foundig fathers dreamed.

      In quanto "maiiali" italiani, vogliamo capire come e perché siamo diventati maiali. È perché siamo pigri? O perché siamo evasori?

      Inoltre sentiamo di DOVER fare qualcosa per capire cosa sta succedendo a quell' "Europa dei popoli" che i padri fondatori sognavano.

And what's happening to Italy...

      E cosa sta succedendo all'Italia...

 

  • Istat, negative record in Italy: 4,6 millions live in absolute poverty!
  • Censis, 11 millions people gave up receiving health care in 2016.

 

  •   Istat, record negativo in Italia: 4,6 milioni di persone vivono in povertà assoluta
  •   Censis, 11 milioni di italiani hanno rinunciato a curarsi nel 2016
  •   Reuters: in Italia il tasso di disoccupazione giovanile supera il 44 %

 

 

What's the documentary about?

      Di cosa parla il documentario?

Did you know that the famous god-like Stability and Growth Pact with its 3% deficit limit and theories about critical government debt levels are based on purely invented figures and typing errors in Excel spreadsheet?

      Sapevi che il famoso Patto di stabilità e crescita col suo limite del 3% del deficit e le teorie sul livello critico del debito del 60% sono basate su calcoli inventati ed errori di Excel?

            

            

However, austerity policies keep on dividing the continent into winners and loosers, creating great amount of suffering, particularly in so-called crisis countries (PIIGS). Consequently, the whole European project has become in doubt.

      Nonostante ciò, le politiche di austerity continuano a dividere il continente in vincitori e vinti, creando grande sofferenza in particolare nei Paesi in crisi detti PIIGS. Ecco perché l'intero progetto dell'Unione europea inizia a scricchiolare.

 

 

The documentary features Noam Chomsky (linguist, philisopher), Stephanie Kelton (Chief Economist for US Senate Budget Committee), Warren Mosler (financial insider, monetary expert), Paul De Grauwe (Professor London School of Economics), Yanis Varoufakis (ex Greek Minister of Finance), Marshall Auerback (Research associate, Levy Economics Institute), Erri De Luca (Italian novelist), Vladimiro Giacchè (economist) Federico Rampini (Italian journalist), Paolo Barnard (independent investigative journalist), among others.

      Nel documentario intervengono, tra gli altri, Noam Chomsky (linguista, filosofo), Stephanie Kelton (economista capo presso la minoranza Democratica della commissione bilancio del Senato USA), Warren Mosler (insider finanziario, esperto di sistemi monetari), Paul De Grauwe (professore alla London School of Economics), Yanis Varoufakis (ex ministro greco delle finanze), Marshall Auerback (Levy Economics Institute), Erri De Luca (poeta, scrittore, giornalista), Vladimiro Giacchè (economista), Federico Rampini (giornalista La Repubblica), Paolo Barnard (giornalista investigativo indipendente).

 

        ​        

        

    

 

 

What We Need

       Di cosa abbiamo bisogno

The film is in post-production now and we’ve already found  70% of the budget. We’re looking for 30.000€ to complete post-production. We need to raise the funds to be able to make "PIIGS" as powerful as we know it can be.

      Il film è in post-produzione (montaggio) e abbiamo quindi già trovato e speso il 70% del budget. Abbiamo bisogno di 30.000€ per completare la post produzione secondo gli alti standard tecnici internazionali. I fondi ci servono quindi per rendere "PIIGS" potente come sappiamo che potrà essere.

Italian theatrical distributors expressed a firm interest in PIIGS (offering a theatrical release on January 2017), as well as an international film distribution company (Berta Film).

      Distributori  cinematografici italiani hanno espresso un forte interesse per PIIGS, offrendo un'uscita cinematografica per gennaio 2017; così come una distribuzione televisiva internazionale (Berta Film)

 

What your funding supports

  • Post-production including sound and color
  • Footage licensing fees
  • Mastering Digital Cinema Package (DCP) and Bluray (for theater screenings) 
  • Legal counsel
  • Graphics/artwork
  • Advertising

Of course, we are also planning on submitting “PIIGS” to a lot of international festivals in 2016 and 2017.

     A cosa serve il vostro aiuto

  • Post produzione (compreso color grading e mix)
  • Acquisto diritti clip di repertorio
  • Masterizzazione del DCP e del Bluray (per la proiezione in sala)
  • Consulenza legale
  • Grafica
  • Promozione

     Ovviamente, stiamo presentando PIIGS ai più importanti festival internazionali del 2016 e 2017.

 

What we already have

      Cosa abbiamo già

  • 72' and 55' excellent drafts of the documentary (English and Italian versions)
  • A combative International Sales Agent (Berta Film) who believes in the project, Stefano Mutolo.
  • ​Il premontato definitivo della versione da 72' e di quella da 55' (sia in inglese che in italiano)
  • Un combattivo agente di vendita internazionale (Berta Film) che crede nel progetto, Stefano Mutolo.

 

 

 

Why don't you get it done by yourself?

      Perché non fate tutto da soli?

Because we should wait for a producer and his money, and it could take years. 

      Perché l'attesa di un produttore potrebbe durare anni.

 

 

You can help us also by spreading the word and this page.

It would have the same substance that supporting us with your money.

If the infos above are not enough, ask one of the directors HERE.

 

Puoi lo stesso aiutarci diffondendo questa pagina e facendo parlare di noi e del film.

E' altrettanto importante che sostenerci economicamente.

Se desiderate altre informazioni, chiedete direttamente a uno dei registi QUI

 ____________________________________________ "PIIGS" - Feature lenght documentary   "PIIGS" - Documentario lungometraggioPIIGS is a movie halfway between Inside Job (2010 documentary about USA 2008 financial crisis) and the “proletarian tales” by Ken Loach.      PIIGS è un film a metà strada tra Inside Job (documentario del 2010 sulla crisi finanziaria  USA) e le storie proletarie di Ken Loach.PIIGS is an exciting and revolutionary journey into the very heart of the tragic European economic crisis. This extraordinary documentary - made by the three filmmakers after five years of research and two years of shooting - is a Southern European take into austerity dogma and states with the voice of prestigious international economists, intellectuals and experts, that the origin of the European debt crisis is not the inadequacy of people in crisis countries but the very foundation of euro itself.       È un viaggio affascinante e rivoluzionario nel cuore della tragica crisi economica europea. Realizzato da tre filmmaker dopo cinque anni di ricerche e due di riprese, PIIGS è un'immersione senza precedenti  e senza censure nei dogmi dell'austerity e afferma con la voce di prestigiosi economisti, intellettuali ed esperti internazionali che l'origine della crisi dei debiti europei non risiede nell'inadeguatezza delle popolazioni dei Paesi in crisi ma nelle fondamenta stesse dell'euro.  Unfortunately people are not immune to bad decision making, and the documentary shows how austerity turns into practice in Rome, focusing on a survival story of a cooperative assisting disabled people.      Il documentario racconta anche le dirette conseguenze dell'austerity a Roma, concentrandosi sulla storia della sopravvivenza di una Cooperativa sociale che assiste disabili e persone svantaggiate.Outskirts of Rome, today. Claudia is trying to save the Cooperative company “Il Pungiglione” (“The Sting”) from bankrupt. “Il Pungiglione" is owed an amount of 1 million euros from municipality and Region and risks of closing down forever: 100 workers will remain unemployed and 150 disabled/autistic people won’t have any further assistance. It’s a ticking time social bomb.      Dintorni di Roma, oggi. Claudia sta provando a salvare la Cooperativa "Il Pungiglione" dal fallimento. "Il Pungiglione" ha un credito di un milione di euro dal comune e dalla regione e rischia di chiudere per sempre: 100 dipendenti perderanno il lavoro e 150 disabili rimarranno senza assistenza. È una bomba sociale a orologeria. Is it true that in the Euro zone there is no alternative to Austerity, to Fiscal Compact, to budget balance, to welfare spendig cuts? To the bankrupt of "Il Pungiglione"?       È vero che nell'Eurozona non c'è alternativa all'austerity, al Fiscal Compact, al pareggio di bilancio, ai tagli alla spesa sociale? Al fallimento del "Pungiglione"?         What they say about "PIIGS"     Cosa dicono di "PIIGS"              ["Wonderful editing, great rhythm, engaging story, a perfect framework".        Marcello Paolillo, Nexo Digital]              ["Montato egregiamente, incalzante, avvincente, con una struttura perfetta". M. Paolillo, Nexo Digital]              ["Technically excellent. The story of the Cooperative is really touching!" Thomas Fazi, journalist]               ["Tecnicamente eccellente, autorevole e avvincente. La storia della Cooperativa è molto emozionante." Thomas Fazi, journalist]                       ["Three Italian directors challenge capitalism."  Diego Fusaro, Il Fatto Quotidiano]                 ["Tre registi italiani sfidano il capitalismo". Diego Fusaro , Il Fatto Quotidiano]                          ["La crisi economica diventa un soggetto da cinema di qualità." Federico Rampini, Affari e Finanza La Repubblica]                ["An unprecedent and uncensored immersion in the origins of the economic crisis." Camillo De Marco, Cineuropa]                  ["Un'immersione senza precedenti e senza censure nelle origini della crisi economica". Camillo De Marco su Cineuropa.org]                ["PIIGS teaser trailer looks pretty good! It looks to be strong on MMT". Stephanie Kelton]                 ["Il teaser di PIIGS è molto bello! Inoltre è molto attinente alla MMT" . Stephanie Kelton]  PIIGS could be one of the most important documentary of these last 8 years, since the economic crisis started: it debunks those austerity dogmas which are  dramatically impoverishing Europe.      PIIGS potrebbe essere uno dei più importanti documentari degli ultimi 8 anni, da quando cioè la crisi economica è iniziata: smaschera quei dogmi dell'austerità che stanno drammaticamente impoverendo l'Europa.  
Who are we
   Chi siamoWe are three Italian award-winning independent filmmakers. Our works always focused on delicate matters like immigration, poverty, politics, economics, terrorism, as well as cinema, visual art, literature. We made feature films, documentaries, short movies, webseries.      Siamo tre filmmaker indipendenti italiani. Con i nostri lavori ci siamo occupati di argomenti delicati come immigrazione, povertà, politica, economia, terrorismo, ma anche di cinema, arti visive, letteratura. Abbiamo realizzato lungometraggi, documentari, cortometraggi e webserie.Stanley and Us - All'ombra del gigante - Voci migranti - Spread Zero   (from left)Adriano Cutraro,Mirko Melchiorre,Federico Greco    This time we decided to investigate prevalent European budgetary policies and the austerity dogma. Because we believe that precisely those dogmas produce poverty, unemployment, social conflicts.     Stavolta abbiamo deciso di indagare i dogmi dell'austerità e le politiche monetarie dominanti in Europa. Perché crediamo che esattamente quei dogmi stiano producendo povertà, disoccupazione e conflitti sociali.As Italians piigs we want to understand how and why we became "pigs". Is it because we're lazy? Or maybe because we are tax evaders?    We also feel that we MUST do something to understand what's happening to that "Europe of the people" its foundig fathers dreamed.      In quanto "maiiali" italiani, vogliamo capire come e perché siamo diventati maiali. È perché siamo pigri? O perché siamo evasori?      Inoltre sentiamo di DOVER fare qualcosa per capire cosa sta succedendo a quell' "Europa dei popoli" che i padri fondatori sognavano.And what's happening to Italy...      E cosa sta succedendo all'Italia... 
Istat, negative record in Italy: 4,6 millions live in absolute poverty!
Censis, 11 millions people gave up receiving health care in 2016.
 
  Istat, record negativo in Italia: 4,6 milioni di persone vivono in povertà assoluta

  Censis, 11 milioni di italiani hanno rinunciato a curarsi nel 2016
  Reuters: in Italia il tasso di disoccupazione giovanile supera il 44 %
  What's the documentary about?      Di cosa parla il documentario?Did you know that the famous god-like Stability and Growth Pact with its 3% deficit limit and theories about critical government debt levels are based on purely invented figures and typing errors in Excel spreadsheet?      Sapevi che il famoso Patto di stabilità e crescita col suo limite del 3% del deficit e le teorie sul livello critico del debito del 60% sono basate su calcoli inventati ed errori di Excel?                          However, austerity policies keep on dividing the continent into winners and loosers, creating great amount of suffering, particularly in so-called crisis countries (PIIGS). Consequently, the whole European project has become in doubt.      Nonostante ciò, le politiche di austerity continuano a dividere il continente in vincitori e vinti, creando grande sofferenza in particolare nei Paesi in crisi detti PIIGS. Ecco perché l'intero progetto dell'Unione europea inizia a scricchiolare.  The documentary features Noam Chomsky (linguist, philisopher), Stephanie Kelton (Chief Economist for US Senate Budget Committee), Warren Mosler (financial insider, monetary expert), Paul De Grauwe (Professor London School of Economics), Yanis Varoufakis (ex Greek Minister of Finance), Marshall Auerback (Research associate, Levy Economics Institute), Erri De Luca (Italian novelist), Vladimiro Giacchè (economist) Federico Rampini (Italian journalist), Paolo Barnard (independent investigative journalist), among others.      Nel documentario intervengono, tra gli altri, Noam Chomsky (linguista, filosofo), Stephanie Kelton (economista capo presso la minoranza Democratica della commissione bilancio del Senato USA), Warren Mosler (insider finanziario, esperto di sistemi monetari), Paul De Grauwe (professore alla London School of Economics), Yanis Varoufakis (ex ministro greco delle finanze), Marshall Auerback (Levy Economics Institute), Erri De Luca (poeta, scrittore, giornalista), Vladimiro Giacchè (economista), Federico Rampini (giornalista La Repubblica), Paolo Barnard (giornalista investigativo indipendente).         ​                      What We Need       Di cosa abbiamo bisognoThe film is in post-production now and we’ve already found  70% of the budget. We’re looking for 30.000€ to complete post-production. We need to raise the funds to be able to make "PIIGS" as powerful as we know it can be.      Il film è in post-produzione (montaggio) e abbiamo quindi già trovato e speso il 70% del budget. Abbiamo bisogno di 30.000€ per completare la post produzione secondo gli alti standard tecnici internazionali. I fondi ci servono quindi per rendere "PIIGS" potente come sappiamo che potrà essere.Italian theatrical distributors expressed a firm interest in PIIGS (offering a theatrical release on January 2017), as well as an international film distribution company (Berta Film).      Distributori  cinematografici italiani hanno espresso un forte interesse per PIIGS, offrendo un'uscita cinematografica per gennaio 2017; così come una distribuzione televisiva internazionale (Berta Film) What your funding supports
Post-production including sound and color
Footage licensing fees
Mastering Digital Cinema Package (DCP) and Bluray (for theater screenings) 
Legal counsel
Graphics/artwork
Advertising
Of course, we are also planning on submitting “PIIGS” to a lot of international festivals in 2016 and 2017.     A cosa serve il vostro aiuto
Post produzione (compreso color grading e mix)
Acquisto diritti clip di repertorio
Masterizzazione del DCP e del Bluray (per la proiezione in sala)
Consulenza legale
Grafica
Promozione
     Ovviamente, stiamo presentando PIIGS ai più importanti festival internazionali del 2016 e 2017. What we already have      Cosa abbiamo già
72' and 55' excellent drafts of the documentary (English and Italian versions)
A combative International Sales Agent (Berta Film) who believes in the project, Stefano Mutolo.

​Il premontato definitivo della versione da 72' e di quella da 55' (sia in inglese che in italiano)
Un combattivo agente di vendita internazionale (Berta Film) che crede nel progetto, Stefano Mutolo.
   Why don't you get it done by yourself?      Perché non fate tutto da soli?Because we should wait for a producer and his money, and it could take years.       Perché l'attesa di un produttore potrebbe durare anni.  You can help us also by spreading the word and this page.It would have the same substance that supporting us with your money.If the infos above are not enough, ask one of the directors HERE. Puoi lo stesso aiutarci diffondendo questa pagina e facendo parlare di noi e del film. E' altrettanto importante che sostenerci economicamente.Se desiderate altre informazioni, chiedete direttamente a uno dei registi QUI

story:
Hannah and Ryan and in their final semester of GVSU's Film and Video Production program. They are currently working together on creating their thesis film project- what four and a half years of film school has been leading up to. With backgrounds in Production Design and the Art Department, Hannah and Ryan are both very passionate about all of the art that goes into the film; this includes set dressings, costume design, makeup and special effects makeup, and all props. While the art department is often overlooked in student films, they have created a story that lives through the art that appears on screen. The opportunity to create and produce this project allows students to not only continue their practice and training to enter the work force, but to create a product with their personal touch while fully utilizing all of the resources that the university has provided them.

The funding needed is to obtain our coffee shop location. It is in the heart of downtown in the beautiful city of Grand Rapids. The other portion of the funding would be going towards feeding the crew who are graciously giving their time for free. In return for your donation you will be receiving a copy of the film on DVD! No matter if our goal is reached or not, your donations will be a great contribution towards our personal funding. 

If you aren't able to donate, you can still help us out by sharing this campaign on Facebook. We appreciate your interest, every click helps! 

Thanks for donating and sharing!

story:
The Quest for the Real Jesus

  • I'm a Bible Translator and Filmmaker with decades of experience.
  • To reveal the real Jesus based on His own words recorded by His Disciples and Apostles.
  • Your contributions will make it possible for a real portrayal of who Eashoa Msheekha is.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $200,000 to make the movie.
  • There are different perks. You can switch them if you like.
  • If we don't reach our funding goal, we will do a shorter version of the movie.

The Impact

  • Many people think they know Jesus, but until someone experiences the miraculous power of Eashoa Msheekha, they won't be able to fully appreciate His magnificence.
  • I have an impressive track record as an independent filmmaker, but this movie will be the best one.
  • You have seen many portrayals of Jesus in movies, but this one will be the most authentic, because it's based on the very Scriptures that He read from when He walked the earth.

Risks & Challenges

There are many risks in filmmaking. Sometimes the entire budget is lost due to the failure of a movie to reach its audience. The obstacles are many. There are many expenses and problems in marketing of a movie.

  • I have been an independent filmmaker for 40 years and I've attended many film markets.
  • I will be taking the movie to the American Film Market next year and find territorial buyers for the movie or perhaps distribute the movie through a major or mini major.

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be able to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • You can get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

That's all there is to it.

story:
"Lacuna" (Blank Space or Missing Part) - A Grant Parker Thesis Film 

Hello!  

My name is Grant Parker and I am currently in the pre-production phase of my short film "Lacuna". This film is very dear to my heart because it gives me a chance to utilize my love of the thriller genre, while simultaniously developing my own personal film athestic. I will begin filming in September, 2017 during the first semester of my senior year at Liberty University. In order for me to craft my film in the best way possible I will need your help, because lets face it, without you this film would be impossible to make! 

What your donation will be going toward:

Select Cast and Crew - 

There will be multiple crew positions on my film that I would love to bring outside filmmakers into. This ranges from camera operators, post sound designers, and even a professional editor to help me along the way. There might even be an opportunity to recruit professional level actors onto my project that require some sort of compensation, and I would not want to miss out on an opportunity like that! 

Craft Services - 

Craft services is just a fancy phrase we film snobs like to use for food on set, and without support from you guys we might very well starve. I hope not, but you never know. Filmmakers can be a hungry bunch, and you would be surprised how much of a budget will vanish when lunchtime comes around. 

Locations -

In my film "Lacuna" there aren't a massive amount of locations involved. However, the few that there are will required renting. Renting locations can quickly rack up the costs, so in order to achieve the best production value a student film has ever had I will need to invest heavily into my locations. All with your help of course. 

What do you get out of it? 

Making a film is a lot more than pointing a camera at everyday objects. Filmmaking is a life consuming endeavor, with much planning and money riding on the project. I am personally writing, producing, and directing "Lacuna", so I have been a part of every aspect of its genesis. My control over this project guarantees that every dollar you donate to my project will be spent wisely. Helping fund my thesis film will not only increase my educational experience dramatically, but it will help launch my career in the film industry. When you donate to my project you will be receiving a credit on the film during the end credits scroll, and a signed thank you letter from yours truly (see perks list for more details). Any amount given is a great gift, and I cannot thank you enough for your contribution. Thank you so much for your time!

Grant Parker 

Writer-Producer-Director "Lacuna"

story:
ABOUT HANNAH YUMI

I am currently a senior at Liberty University and have been preparing for this film since the beginning of this year. Because this is my senior thesis, I am directing and producing it; however, my real passion lies in film makeup and thus have centered the entire story around symbolism that will be reflected through the makeup.

This film is incredibly important to me because the inspiration for this film came from seeing the trend in media (and our culture as a whole) that beats into young minds that in order to be considered beautiful or successful, you need to fit into a certain box. Anyone who doesn't fit into that box is deemed ugly or just not good enough.

There are already many figures and films promoting body positivity out there, but mine is from a little bit of a different perspective. The point I am trying to get across to anyone who watches this is that there will always be critics and people who hate on you throughout your entire life. But despite what others think of you or how they treat you, you as a person need to be confident in yourself and love yourself for who you are and not because of what others say. You are beautiful because you are you. Not because of others opinions.

What We Need & What You Get

My team and I will be shooting at the end of this October and will greatly appreciate it if you were a part of it!

Things that your contribution will go to include:

  • Feeding the crew!

Most people think that working on a film is one of the most glamorous jobs you can have. I   know I thought that before. That could not be any further from the truth! Making a film (even a short film) requires hours of heavy duty work at all hours of the day or night. Hence, feeding the crew well is extremely important so that no one is working without proper nourishment!

  • Transportation

Some members of my crew will be coming from out of state, and we will need to take care of gas money for them. Also moving equipment from location to location and transporting cast and crew adds up as well.

  • Makeup

As you know, my film is very makeup oriented, and makeup is not cheap. Especially good brands that won't make the cast break out.

  • Props and Costumes

These are essential parts of a film and each item will add up.

There are just a few of the many things that your contribution will go to, and this is only naming a few of the pre-production/production costs. There is also post production to think about such as licensing music, editing and coloring the footage, etc.

In return for your generous contributions, you will be receiving certain items or credit in the film depending on the amount that you contribute.

The Impact

Your contribution will help me and my team pull together a film that will reach out to people struggling with problems in their lives.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help contribute financially, that's ok! We would still appreciate you just as much if you could share my page on social media and help get the word out!

Thank you so much for your time and keep your eye out for updates!

story:
Summary of the Justice League FAN FILM Series!

SHIELDS Productions has created THREE Justice League Fan Fiction Films with little to no Budget and released the films some going on to win Awards all over the United States, every contribution will go in to making a superior and more intense Fan Fiction Film!

  • My name is Nathaniel Shields, I am a national award winning writer/director/VFX artist and cinematographer, I created SHIELDS Productions that went on to release 16 Original Short Films and Fan Fiction Films, which are all very heavy with green screen and CGI elements.
  • SHIELDS Productions has created 7 Fan Fiction Films all with little to no budget, This time around we are asking for help! We can't make the film without your Support!

The Awards that SHIELDS PRODUCTIONS have won in the past are as followed.

  1. Featured Filmmaker at Best of Blissfest 2015 for Justice League: Trinity Force.
  2. Best Fan Fiction Film at Super Geek Festival in Miami, FL. • SuperCon 2016.
  3. Best Feature Film for Justice League: The Shattered Paragon at Blissfest 2016.
  4. Best Supporting Actor for Justice League: The Shattered Paragon at Blissfest 2016. • Alex Niforatos as The Flash *Returning*
  5. Best Original Score for Justice League: The Shattered Paragon at Blissfest 2016. • Ashton Gleckman *Returning*
  6. The Outstanding Filmmaker award to Nathaniel Shields at Blissfest 2016.

​The Impact the Contributions Will Have...

  • contributing would help us insanely to complete and deliver an epic tuned, emotional and action packed Fan Fiction Film! By Supporting us you help this project come to life!

What Will it Look Like? (Quality of the Fan Film!)

Here is some concept stills from The Justice League: Dawn of Apokolips.

We have done THREE other Justice League Fan Films in the past, This one will have a lot more sets and locations with the mix of green screen worlds! Check out these few stills of previous film stills.

What We Need To Make the Film & What You Get Out of it!!

This is a estimation breakdown of what we need!:

  • We are aiming for 5,000$ and this is where it all is going.
  1. Actors & Crew                                2,000$~(Most important)
  2. Costumes                                        1,500$~
  3. Production & Post Production  1,000$~

SHIELDS Productions has created THREE Justice League Fan Fiction Films with little to no Budget and released the films some going on to win Awards all over the United States, every contribution will go in to making a superior and more intense Fan Fiction Film!

My name is Nathaniel Shields, I am a national award winning writer/director/VFX artist and cinematographer, I created SHIELDS Productions that went on to release 16 Original Short Films and Fan Fiction Films, which are all very heavy with green screen and CGI elements.


SHIELDS Productions has created 7 Fan Fiction Films all with little to no budget, This time around we are asking for help! We can't make the film without your Support!

The Awards that SHIELDS PRODUCTIONS have won in the past are as followed.

story:
I want to tell the truth about what goes on in Car Yards!

  • Every character is based on a real person.
  • Every story in the script actually happened.
  • Every single line of dialogue checked for authenticity. 

It's the real deal and here's the twist: BUYERS ARE LIARS!! We are shining the light on the fact that dealers are no longer the cheats that people think they are. Gone are the days of  nappies around the sump to hide an oil leak, banana peels and sawdust in the gear box. When a mechanic was caught giving two dodgy road-worthy's he got put in jail for 4 years and everyone started playing by the rules - except the customers! 

My best mate Keasty (in the video), is about as good a bloke as blokes get. I'd trust him with my life but when people hear he's a car dealer they immediately think he's dodgy!

Dazza (my other mate in the video) is one of the funniest most charismatic blokes in the industry. Always cracking a joke, always looking at the positive and always has a great story to tell.

These guys are legends and over the years have seen and experienced some truly unbelievable things! I've taken it upon myself to tell their stories. To get them up on the big screen where they belong and have their movie stand tall next to Kenny and The Castle as a great Aussie comedy!!

Here's the synopsis!

Save the car yard, your job, your fingers from being severed by bikie thugs and win the girl - just make three quarters of a million dollars in a month. The race is on!

A new record for sales, an impossible goal, is Wazza's slim chance of redemption from a dangerous debt to aggressive bikers and is his opportunity to prove his worth as a gun salesman. 

Life as a laidback car salesman was easy for Wazza, cruisy, no stress, good mates. Now he must earn the right to fill The Boss's shoes and take over the second-hand car dealership. The boss has announced his retirement and that the car yard will be sold to a developer. All the crew will be out of a job at the end of the month, unless..... Wazza can sell all the stock and save the day. Everything must go extremely well.... it doesn't.

What We Need & What You Get

We are nearly ready to shoot, but we need your help. We need CASH and EXTRAS.

Do you want to be in the movie?

Do you want to give an Aussie Filmmaker a leg up?

Support us if you want to see a truthful movie about car dealers. Pick one of the Perks and donate now!

Your donation will be wisely used by a team of experienced film makers who know how to get a movie made and in the cinemas! Check out the the Producers and Director here 

Your donation will go to paying for name actors, hiring of wicked V8's, the car chase, the fight scene, the cops uniforms, the make-up artists, and much more!

Pick one of the Perks, share and get involved!! Thanks :)

story:
It started with an idea...

It started with Shane Hartline (actor/writer/producer), Ben Kaplan (actor/writer/producer), Malia Miglino (actor/writer/producer), and Jeremiah Burton (actor/writer/producer). We set out to make a horror feature centered around a creature from Celtic folklore not yet seen in film.

Our team quickly grew to add Christopher Carey (director/writer/producer) and Matt Dickstein (director/cinematographer) as well as many other talented members of our cast and crew who shared our vision in creating a fresh take on found footage horror.

With the help of our supporters in our first campaign we we're able to move into production this past January and film our movie! 

We didn't get our full budget though so now we need your help to get our film through post production.

How you can help with Post-Production

Post-production is all the steps in filmmaking after finishing principle photography. Like all films, we need things like editors, sound design and mixing, and CGI. All of these can be very costly. In fact, what we're asking for is just to get us moving on the editorial stage of post. Our wish list includes:


Our dream would be to raise everything we need here but we'd be happy to raise enough to move on to the next phase of post-production without having to seek out financiers and outside investors.

What makes us different

If you look around Indiegogo, you'll find there are plenty of campaigns for people looking to make their film. What makes us different than most is we're past the idea stage. We've already filmed it, exhausting our entire budget to make sure the production value of THE SLUAGH is top notch. We even blew up a car!

As you can see in our teaser trailer, we've already made it a great distance in making this film a reality. We need your help to cross the finish line.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone has the ability to donate funds to our project. You can still help  by getting the word out about THE SLUAGH. Sharing our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and other social media platforms is a great alternative to giving funds.

story:
We are a group of individuals and organizations who support environmental and human rights, and oppose the takeover of our democracy by big business.

President-elect Donald Trump has promised sweeping changes to the United States. He has said that he will ban all Muslims entering the country, build a wall along the border with Mexico (and make Mexico pay), get rid of Obamacare, deport all undocumented immigrants, tear up the Paris agreement on climate change, approve waterboarding immediately and repeal same-sex marriage legislation.

Civil society needs to get organized to fight back over the next four years. The TrumpWatch deck of cards provides 52 simple things that you can do to fight back. Pick a card to get action ideas each of the 52 weeks of the year; use them to organize a discussion over coffee and drinks; or give them away as gifts to others to do the same.

This project is being coordinated by CorpWatch. Each of the 52 cards in the TrumpWatch deck is being hand designed by our cartoonist, Khalil Bendib. Your contribution will be used to support the TrumpWatch website and to pay for design, printing by Community Printers in Santa Cruz, CA, and mailing.

story:
Watch the trailer below.

 

About the Director

I started this film as my thesis film at Tisch School of the Arts NYU, where I earned a BFA in Documentary Film Production. I have always had a passion for the arts from painting to film-making. This passion overlaps with my love of nature and my amazement towards humanity.

 

The Reason

Climate change, environmental destruction, pollution, inequality, cultural diversity, overpopulation, and the human strife. 

This is more than just a film about New York, it is a story of the journey of humanity; out of the forest and into the city.

This film will lay out this journey and pose the viewer with the question “well, where do we go next?”

 

What We Need to Finish Successfully

To finish this film, and present it as beautifully and professionally as possible we need to raise

 $10,000.

 

Budget Breakdown

30% Equipment

20% Festivals and Promotions

20% Post Production

15% Stock Footage and Aerial Shots

10% Travel

5% Contingency

 

PERKS

Your contributions are appreciated deeply and I want to do all I can to show my gratitude.

Some of the perks will include handmade art (paintings, collages, and more), prints of photos from the film, dvd copies of the film, screening tickets, and other heartfelt giveaways.

For more generous contributions I will be offering personalized video productions, professional quality commercial video production, stock footage packages, and more!

I am always open to suggestions, if you want something in return for your help and it is not offered, please feel free to make a request!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that in this tough financial times not everyone can contribute monetarily.

I myself have student loans to pay and can no longer fund this project out of pocket or with the generous contributions of friends and family.

I gratefully welcome help in any shape or form. Below is a list of ways in which you can help.

If you feel like you can help in a way not listed below, I welcome your suggestions and participation.

 

  • Help me spread the word! Share this campaign and promote this film on Social Media as well as other online and printed outlets (Check out Indiegogo's share options!)
  • Locations, Locations, Locations (I always need help finding new locations, accessing these locations for filming and getting connected with people in local   communities)
  • Help secure access to equipment rentals in return for brand promotion
  • I am currently looking for colorists and sound mixers
  • Feel free to help me make connections to other people who can help.

 

From the bottom of my heart,

Thank you.

story: My name is Clint Narramore.  I am a radio DJ and upcoming independent filmmaker.  This project came to me because a lot of us horror fans also love a good paranormal thriller too.  Having gone through several haunted places, I know how hard it is to get credible evidence, like the team in the movie does.  I also wanted to put a really weird twist to this story.  It is a project I have been working on for well over a year and now is the time to assemble all of my horror friends and extended family to help create an amazing film!   The first name I want to reveal for this cast is Sarah French, who will be playing Sarah Myers.  Sarah is a very talented, young actress from MN, living in California now and she has starred in several horror films over the last few years.  There are more cast announcements coming soon!

story:
GREAT SCRIPT + GREAT PRODUCTION + GREAT ACTING = GREAT FILM.

Our film is The Exorcist meets Goodfellas.

By combining the two most successful genres of low budget feature films, Polterheist is an unashamedly commercial project.

We want to make a film that captures the imaginations of adults who like horror and gangster films.

In 2016 we produced a short film called Polterheist that's won awards at film festivals all over the world. Its won accolades for the brilliant central performances by the cast, a brilliant screenplay and superb production values.

These are the very same qualities we'll be bringing to the feature length version.

(SEE THE SHORT FILM HERE  - : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VEx63plHYtk)

We want to show audiences a film unlike any they've seen before: a gripping, heart-pounding ghost story set in the criminal underworld of Bradford, featuring a cast of Asian gangsters, bent cops, twisted psychics and vengeful ghosts.

It'll be dark, twisted, funny, thrilling and hugely entertaining.

Written by award-winning screenwriters, the Polterheist feature screenplay has a knife-edge, non-stop narrative which takes the viewer on an unswerving journey into the realms of horror and underworld crime. 

We have a great cast, with the same talented actors who burned up the screen in the short film onboard, but this time with even more great new characters.

Director David Gilbank has won 12 international awards for film-making, including Best Director and Best Film in the USA, South Africa, and the UK.

The cast includes Kathryn Hanke, who beat off many big names (including John Hurt) to win Best Actor at the prestigious Discover Film London Awards in 2016; Jamie Smelt an experienced Shakespearean leading actor; and Sid Akbar Ali who has appeared in many BBC productions and the BIFA award winning feature film Strings.

Paul Renhard and Dave Gilbank have won many international awards for their writing and the screenplay they've put together for the Polterheist feature film is co-written with the highly acclaimed UK playwright Gemma Head.

It is a gasp-out-loud, full throttle punch in the guts.

And its bloody funny.

The crew are a seasoned group of professionals who are highly regarded within the film industry in the north of England. Our team includes award-winning cinematographer Charles Leek, who has worked on many UK film productions (and recently won a major award at the Sydney Film Festival 2016); Jackie Griffin who has worked in Hollywood on multi-million dollar Blockbusters starring Sylvester Stallone and Will Smith.

Once the production is finished we have a distribution deal ready to get onto screens throughout the world, via DVD and VOD.

And Bradford? With its decaying Victorian splendour – neglected cemeteries, derelict cotton mills and grey stone back to back terraces - Bradford is one of the stars of Polterheist and gives it a completely unique and fascinating character.    

We have a great story, a great screenplay by award-winning writers, a professional talented cast, an award-winning crew and the UK's greatest gothic setting.

C'mon, join the team. We're going to make a classic.

story:
This right here is the beginnings of a web series that goes beyond genre. Among a heavy dose of dark comedy and zombie gore, you’ll see a story of poor choices, love, and maybe a smattering of redemption.

In the backdrop of Missoula, Montana, follow a zombie cleanup crew as they take out the undead and try not to kill each other. 

The series centers on Quinn Wilder, a low-level criminal, in her adventures as the squad’s begrudging leader.

Hey! I’m Cassidy. I’m the writer/director and creator of The Last OK Place. Graduating from UM with my BFA in Filmmaking, I’ve worked on a plethora of short films, the indie feature Subterranea and a handful of sizzlers. 

As a gay lady myself, I want to tell a story with a strong-ass gay girl who beats the crap out of the undead and is completely nonplussed when some cute girl flirts with her. 

If you want to see that — and if Tumblr is any indication a lot of you do — then join TLOP on the adventure. 

Everyone who contributes gets to own this series. YOU helped make. YOU let your voice be heard because when you contribute you’re saying, “This story is worth being told; these are the characters I want to see on TV.” 

Every dollar you donate will go to making sure this production is all that it can be and we've put in the work to figure out the dollar amount to make it so. But web series aren't cheap. I'm not gonna be cute here. Let’s break down our costs:

The producers have spent hours cutting out extras and paring down to necessities. While this may look like a lot of money, for a production of this caliber it's a tight budget. 

Our cast and crew require a large portion of the budget because we need them to block out a month of their schedule to shoot 10-15 hours a day, 6 days a week. We can't not pay them for this time. 

The next largest portion is gear. We've gone as minimal as we can, but quality is important. Think of your favorite movie or TV scene. Now imagine it was fuzzy or the sound was garbage. We want to be efficient, as cost effective as possible, but also have a high quality show for you to enjoy. 

Now for the fun part...

Your support and generosity doesn't go without a little payback. We want to hook you up with some incredible gear. 

Our director did a lot of brainstorming to come up with perks that she'd actually want herself. Some of our favorites are: custom t-shirts, music downloads and a personalized obituary of how you died in the apocalypse.

Important Note: If you contribute more than $5 to our campaign, let us know on which site and to which tag we should give you a shout-out by! Please limit to one social site and one profile tag.

Horror and sci-fi have a rep for killing off people of color. As for LGBT characters: they’re rarely even represented.

We want to change that.  

If you’ve been on Twitter lately, you may have seen the hashtag “LGBT fans deserve better". We’re big proponents of that. When main stream television says LGBT characters or people of color are disposable, it makes an impact; it tells those groups of people that they (and I) am less than. 

This project features an androgynous lesbian, a femme gay lady and two people of color because to us, their stories matter. Our series doesn’t deny who they are, but instead tells the adventures of five very different people, some of who happen to be Native American or gay. 

Right now, you have a choice in what type of media is made.

Telling stories through the lens of a camera is never an easy task. Many of our cast and crew are working full time outside the production of this series, so scheduling shoots is going to be tricky. Challenges are going to take place on all sides of the set, gear is going to malfunction, and illness may spread beyond its place in the script (Montana weather brings Montana colds).

Fortunately for us, most of the crew has been working together for years. We know how to address many of these challenges because we've dealt with them before. We're also all local Missoulians, so there's no travel logistics to plan!

Our biggest risk right now is getting the financial backing to make this project happen and to reward our cast and crew's dedication. That's where you come in. Join our #ApocTeam and help make this series a reality.

Remember, for as little as $1 -- the price of a crappy candy bar -- you can join our team!

Maybe the apocalypse is affecting your wallet and you can't contribute. We get it. Don't worry! There are plenty of ways you can help:

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools (top-right of this page) to let friends and family know how excited you are about this web series
  • Send us some fan art! We LOVE sharing your artistic interpretations of our show and characters
  • Give us a shout out on Facebook, Twitter (@thelastokplace), Tumblr and Instagram!

THANK YOU FROM OUR CAST AND CREW!
story_txt:
This right here is the beginnings of a web series that goes beyond genre. Among a heavy dose of dark comedy and zombie gore, you’ll see a story of poor choices, love, and maybe a smattering of redemption.In the backdrop of Missoula, Montana, follow a zombie cleanup crew as they take out the undead and try not to kill each other. The series centers on Quinn Wilder, a low-level criminal, in her adventures as the squad’s begrudging leader.Hey! I’m Cassidy. I’m the writer/director and creator of The Last OK Place. Graduating from UM with my BFA in Filmmaking, I’ve worked on a plethora of short films, the indie feature Subterranea and a handful of sizzlers. As a gay lady myself, I want to tell a story with a strong-ass gay girl who beats the crap out of the undead and is completely nonplussed when some cute girl flirts with her. If you want to see that — and if Tumblr is any indication a lot of you do — then join TLOP on the adventure. Everyone who contributes gets to own this series. YOU helped make. YOU let your voice be heard because when you contribute you’re saying, “This story is worth being told; these are the characters I want to see on TV.” Every dollar you donate will go to making sure this production is all that it can be and we've put in the work to figure out the dollar amount to make it so. But web series aren't cheap. I'm not gonna be cute here. Let’s break down our costs:The producers have spent hours cutting out extras and paring down to necessities. While this may look like a lot of money, for a production of this caliber it's a tight budget. Our cast and crew require a large portion of the budget because we need them to block out a month of their schedule to shoot 10-15 hours a day, 6 days a week. We can't not pay them for this time. The next largest portion is gear. We've gone as minimal as we can, but quality is important. Think of your favorite movie or TV scene. Now imagine it was fuzzy or the sound was garbage. We want to be efficient, as cost effective as possible, but also have a high quality show for you to enjoy. Now for the fun part...Your support and generosity doesn't go without a little payback. We want to hook you up with some incredible gear. Our director did a lot of brainstorming to come up with perks that she'd actually want herself. Some of our favorites are: custom t-shirts, music downloads and a personalized obituary of how you died in the apocalypse.Important Note: If you contribute more than $5 to our campaign, let us know on which site and to which tag we should give you a shout-out by! Please limit to one social site and one profile tag.Horror and sci-fi have a rep for killing off people of color. As for LGBT characters: they’re rarely even represented.We want to change that.  If you’ve been on Twitter lately, you may have seen the hashtag “LGBT fans deserve better". We’re big proponents of that. When main stream television says LGBT characters or people of color are disposable, it makes an impact; it tells those groups of people that they (and I) am less than. This project features an androgynous lesbian, a femme gay lady and two people of color because to us, their stories matter. Many of our cast and crew are working full time outside the production of this series, so scheduling shoots is going to be tricky. Challenges are going to take place on all sides of the set, gear is going to malfunction, and illness may spread beyond its place in the script (Montana weather brings Montana colds).Fortunately for us, most of the crew has been working together for years. We know how to address many of these challenges because we've dealt with them before. We're also all local Missoulians, so there's no travel logistics to plan!Our biggest risk right now is getting the financial backing to make this project happen and to reward our cast and crew's dedication. That's where you come in. Join our #ApocTeam and help make this series a reality.Remember, for as little as $1 -- the price of a crappy candy bar -- you can join our team!Maybe the apocalypse is affecting your wallet and you can't contribute. We get it. Don't worry! There are plenty of ways you can help:
Use the Indiegogo share tools (top-right of this page) to let friends and family know how excited you are about this web series
Send us some fan art! We LOVE sharing your artistic interpretations of our show and characters
Give us a shout out on Facebook, Twitter (@thelastokplace), Tumblr and Instagram!
THANK YOU FROM OUR CAST AND CREW!

story:
WHAT IS DRAGULA?

“The Boulet Brothers DRAGULA: Search for the World’s First Drag Supermonster” is a new competition based reality show starring alternative, horror, punk and misfit themed drag queens. The queens are competing in challenges over a series of six episodes to slay the competition, snatch the crown of DRAGULA or die trying.
 


The show is created and hosted by the iconic Boulet Brothers, a drag duo infamous for creating and developing some of the world’s most infamous alternative queer nightlife, stage performers and events.

The Boulet Brothers’ have created the DRAGULA competition in order to discover and create their next monster: a new drag queen who will rise above the others and become the World’s First Drag Supermonster.

The show is produced by Ash & Bone Cinema and will be airing online on the Hey Qween network (Heyqween.tv) beginning Monday October 31, Halloween night. New episodes will come out every two weeks on Monday mornings following the Halloween launch.
 
(Meet the contestants of DRAGUA in the clip above)
 

Where will the money raised here go?

Every dollar raised will be gifted to the winner of the show as a grand prize. The prize package is designed to supply the winner with the tools she will need to expand her new career as the World’s First Drag Supermonster. Expenses include:

• Gown and costume design and construction
•  Live show and music production
•  Professional photo shoot
•  Website and social media development
•  Custom wigs, hair and headpieces
•  Makeup brushes and tools
•  Tour and publicity costs

What if we raise more than $10,000.00?

Should the amount raised exceed $10,000.00 the remainder of the funds will go towards a cash prize to the “fan favorite” from the cast, which will be determined by way of an online poll at the close of the series not to exceed $3000.00. Should the grand total raised exceed $13,000.00 the remainer the of the amount after both prizes are paid will go towards reimbursing the production cost of the show.

Are there Other Ways you can help?

Sharing the fundraiser on social media, getting the word out, and encouraging people wo are enjoying the show to contribute to the prize package is a big help!

story:
An insurance agent's fate takes an unexpected turn when she encounters an emotionally unstable client. What will she do to escape? What happens to her and the man? Help us contribute and you'll soon find out! 

- Still from Tecate Domestic Violence

This film is more than just about making our dream a reality and entertaining the viewers. What we are trying to achieve is to raise awareness on the issues of mental illness in Singapore, so that people may be less denying or ostracising towards the affected and instead, take actions to help those in need. The film also comments on lesser discussed social issues of loneliness, work pressure, family, typecast, and spousal abuse. We hope to present to the viewers the meanings behind the film through subtleties within the film. 

- Still from Let's Be Civil, Kenneth!

 

Neil Lim (Neil)

Director

NEIL LIM started out as a rock star hopeful in his teenage years, playing in bands and writing originals that saw 8 band albums, radio airplay and exclusives, in addition to several performances at the Arts House and Esplanade. His passion in music and audio extends to the audio post production field, working with major advertising agencies and production houses such as BBDO, DDB, Reservoir Productions and Wawa Pictures on TVCs such as the Singapore Youth Olympics, Nokia and other major brands; broadcast programs "Secrets for Sale" (Wawa Pictures), "Homeward Journey I & II" (Filmat36); feature films "When Hainan Meets Teochew" directed by Han Yew Kwang, "Greedy Ghosts" directed by Boris Boo; as well as independent short films "Three Days Grace" directed by Kenny Tan (Official Selection 33rd Clermont-Ferrand), "Outing" directed by Jow Zhi Wei (58th San Sebastian International Film Festival), and more than 50 other short/independent films which he has designed or scored for. His other works include writing themes songs for the sitcom "Old Folks Jump Over The Wall" (Boku Films), and drama series "Served Hot" (Wawa Pictures). He has also acted, given talks, and collaborated with individuals on various subject matters and interests.

In more than a decade of his career, Neil has worked and learned from many talented individuals, and is currently enrolled in the Puttnam School of Film & Animation to further his knowledge and skill-sets within the media and film industry, for currency in the technicalities and trends.

For the upcoming short film titled 'Takdir', Neil wears the director's hat as a new director, to visualise the dramatics and actions of the film that he hopes to connect the broader audience with the social issues addressed within the story. He hopes to tap on his experiences in both his career and life to enrich the production with his influences and personal touches.

 

Luqman Nurhakim (Hakim)

Producer, Writer

Coming from ITE in Digital Audio Video Production to Diploma in Broadcast Media, Hakim is currently taking up his BA (Hons) in Film at the Puttnam School of Film and Animation. Taking the long route in education has never stopped him to pursue his passion for the arts particularly in the media sector. Content creation has been one of his interest but video editing is what he loves most. Hakim has participated in various Film Projects and Competition involving in many roles such as being a videographer for The People’s Association Passion Arts program to representing Singapore and LASALLE College of the Arts at The Amazing Thailand Film Challenge 2015 as a Director and more recently, participated in the Temasek 20/20 Short Film called ‘Helai Demi Helai’ as an Assistant Director. Hakim is open to challenges and is open to new possibilities. Being a Producer for the film ‘Takdir’, he hopes to gain as much experience from this project working alongside talented individuals to tell stories that not only entertains but possibly resonate with people. 

 

Alicia Chong (Alicia)

Assistant Director

Born in a Singapore-Chinese household, Alicia has been raised to follow her dreams and strive for the best. Right until she was 18 years old, she stumbled continuously in search for that dream. The realm of storytelling enveloped her full attention when her boredom drove her to binge on the various cinematic classics in the world. The fascination spurred a flame within her to pursue film in Puttnam School of Film and Animation with a shabby portfolio and minimal work experience. Her passion and discipline helped her accomplish most of the tasks she manages, along with a tinge of luck. Taking on the role of the Assistant Director in ‘Takdir’ is one of those opportunities in which she strives to prove her ability with her meticulousness and sharpness, but would rely on a little grace to complete the final product. 

 

Jin Hang

Production Designer

Coming from Hangzhou, China to Singapore in 2009, Jin Hang has find it challenging to adapt to the country until she found the love for the arts. Being in screen media in NAFA for 3 years, has allowed her to explore and experience more about the world of media.

Jin Hang has worked on several projects with the theatre students from NAFA along with collaborations with SCAPE K-Pop dancers and Creme Simon cosmetics commercial. In Puttnam School of Film and Animation, Jin Hang has extensively assumed several roles such as Director, Director of Photography and even Editor. Of course, her love for set design intrigues her the most, and as the Production Designer of 'Takdir' she hopes to bring life to the film through her artistic vision. 

 

Divya Sekar (Divya)

Art Director

After graduating from Broadcast Media and currently pursuing a degree in BA (Hons) Film, Divya has been involved in several projects ranging from school Short Films, Baybeats Esplanade 2016 and many more. She has also played roles such as Producer, Editor, and Assistant Director in most of her projects. In ‘Takdir', Divya is the Art Director which she looks forward to giving herself another opportunity to showcase her artistic skills in other forms. Divya hopes that this opportunity can be an advantage in building her knowledge, skill-sets and be better in the field. 

 

Jeremy Jahaziel  (Jeremy)

Director of Photography

Coming from Jakarta, Indonesia and completing his studies in the science stream, Jeremy has ventured on to his other passion for visuals within the art of filmmaking and storytelling. He has been passionately studying in The Puttnam School of Film and Animation for over a year, working in various fields of the filmmaking process. However, that does not stop him from his area of interest and curiosity which is Cinematography.

Jeremy has won a few Photography competitions in Jakarta, prior to coming to Singapore. He was also actively involved in many school films and outside projects for various companies within the Camera and Lighting Department. Taking on the role of Director of Photography for ‘Takdir’, he aims to ensure and meet the Director's visuals into screen at the same time giving his input to make an impactful stand to the film to watch and enjoy. 

 

Jonathan Teo (Jonny)

Gaffer

From the start, Jonny had a great interest and passion for cameras. It all started when he started selling cameras, where he developed the love for photography. This then led to his love for working with lights. With that passion and drive, he decided to pursue Film, a different, yet similar field and medium. Venturing into the motion pictures, learning many various ways of lighting, Jonny is taking on the role of the Gaffer, the DP's right hand man in the design of the lighting presentation of the scene, according to the visions of the director and DP, so as to enhance the visual composition and emotion and ensuring that everything is done professionally and meticulously. 

 

Chok Shu Ying

Sound Recordist

During her first internship in a film company, Shu Ying was especially intrigued by the microphone attached to a long boom pole and the ability of the soundman to listen to things that one normally wouldn't be able to. Her curiosity and interest piqued, Shu Ying has since then paid more attention during sound classes in film school as she plans to major in Sound. Not only that, Shu Ying loves music - especially the guitar and piano. She hopes to be able to compose a good piece of music for a film in the future. She has basic knowledge of the guitar and is currently learning the piano.

Shu Ying is not only passionate about sound, she has a deep interest in storytelling too. 'Takdir' highlights certain societal aspect of depression and mental illness where she believes they can be presented to Singaporeans for awareness and discussion. 

 

Amrita

Editor, Art Assistant

Amrita is a motivated person - she is familiar with working on independent films, in studio films and have helped on one mini feature length film. Amrita has gained much experience in her work, and has played roles that include Actor, Screenwriter, Director, Producer, Casting Assistant, Art Director and Sound Editor for short films. Some of her work history consists of 48 Hour Film Project 2016 as a Screenwriter and Director, freelance transcriber under Indo Productions and even calefares in various local programs under Mediacorp Pte Ltd.

Amrita is also knowledgeable about the different aspects of cinematic procedures. She is constantly updating herself on news about the latest technologies, post production software and cameras while frequently attending filmmaking seminars and attractive film festivals. 

 

Yvonne 

Colourist, Casting Director

Since young, Yvonne had always wanted to create stories that inspires others, and had started writing novels and taking photos even before pursuing an education in film school. Through the course of her studies, her love for the challenges and thrills of being in a production grew, where her involvements include both major and minor roles. Being a Colourist and Casting Director for 'Takdir', Yvonne is amped to bring colours to the story through a truthful and emotional approach.

 

Marion Frayna (Marion)

Sound Designer, 2nd Assistant Director, Photographer (BTS)

Despite having limited exposure and experience in the film industry prior to film school, Marion is inspired to craft and tell his own stories through collaboration with his course mates and future colleagues. For the past year, Marion has been involved in numerous student projects, including some of his own. He has undertaken a variety of roles in these shoots, such as Director, Director of Photography, Sound, and many others, in an attempt to learn and understand more about the different aspects of filmmaking. Thus far, it has been an enriching, fun and rewarding experience for him, as he aims to learn more about filmmaking by being more open-minded and through his peers and contemporaries. 

 

Filmmaking is tough when resources (financial and otherwise) are limited, but as filmmakers we have to stay determined. With the help of LASALLE College of the Arts, Puttnam School of Film and Animation, the camera and lighting equipment have been pledged generously for our work. What we still fall short on is the budget for props, special effects gear and tools, transportation, cast, food and water, and many other expenses that will incur throughout the making of the film, that will affect its quality, process, and finish. We seek your immense support to bring our ideas to the big screen.

  • 29% of donations will go to casting of the film
  • 36% will go towards production design and wardrobe
  • 12% will go towards locations
  • 11% will go towards providing food on set
  • 7% will go towards transport
  • 4% will go towards Film Festivals entry fee if we are sending it in

If you're not in a position to contribute monetarily, that's totally fine! We only ask, then, if you could do us the favour of sharing this link. (:

Project Timeline 

Pre-production, Casting: Currently On-Going 
Production: 22-Feb-17 to 27-Feb-17 
Post-Production, Sound and Color Correction: Feb to Apr 2017 

Feel free to drop us an email for any inquiries at takdir2017@gmail.com

Updated 7-Jan-2017 5:55PM

Casting updates coming soon..
