4% will go towards Film Festivals entry fee if we are sending it in
If you're not in a position to contribute monetarily, that's totally fine! We only ask, then, if you could do us the favour of sharing this link. (:Project Timeline Pre-production, Casting: Currently On-Going Production: 22-Feb-17 to 27-Feb-17 Post-Production, Sound and Color Correction: Feb to Apr 2017 Feel free to drop us an email for any inquiries at takdir2017@gmail.comUpdated 7-Jan-2017 5:55PMCasting updates coming soon..

story:
“If you wish to understand the Universe, think of energy, frequency and vibration.”

Tesla.

Tibetan Sound Revelations is a documentary travel film about Tibetan Singing Bowls (TSB), their history and origin, their present use in healing therapies, their influence on human body (physical and emotional), their ability to heal or mitigate serious physical conditions and disorders, and their future use.

We want to share with you the sacred knowledge of ancient sound healing method that tunes human body to harmony and health frequencies. In this film, we want to broadcast exclusive footage from Nepal for you and conduct scientific research on TSB’s and make more people experience this beautiful and powerful transformation journey.

Due to everyday stress our bodies often fall out of vibrational harmony and potentially develop illness. Stress and negativity create blockages of healthy flow of energy. In our film, we want to explore how human well-being can be improved with the use of Tibetan Singing Bowls.

 

Exclusive footage and interviews from Nepal

Our documentary film consists of two parts. First part is travelling and documenting live workshops and getting exclusive footage from Nepal and Nepalese teachers, keepers of the ancient tradition, covering: history and ancient techniques of playing singing bowls; revealing secrets and legends, temples and methods of bowls casting.

 

Research & Meditation

Second part is the research where we interview Sound Masters, therapies recipients and scientists from Oxford and around the world, and specialists from other fields. We look deeply into TSB's effect on human body and mind. We also wish to conduct a series of musical concerts for children and adults with certain conditions (TBC) and track the changes in their physical well-being and emotional state. Singing Bowls’ sound puts you in a deep meditative state, allowing you to travel deep inside yourself.

 

A word from Niina, Film Producer:

I became very passionate about Tibetan Singing Bowls after I experienced this beautiful and deep relaxing feeling, which activated something else within me. I decided to know more about it, I learnt Contact Method technique, and I’ve performed over 40 sessions to various people. All my patients wake up after the session and tell me that they went through a very unusual transformation in them, and they feel so beautifully tranquil, and that they were on a very intimate emotional journey.

I believe that Sound Medicine is one of the most powerful natural tool for physical and emotional well-being. Since I’ve got into it, my stomach pain has gone, and every time I play TSB, it gives me so much energy! I’m sure that pretty soon sound healing will be officially used in hospitals and schools, and that is just a start. I would like people to experience it themselves, it’s much stronger than any words. I hope this film will open for you a new useful knowledge and give a good objective overview of the impact TSB sound can have on us.

 

What We Need

So far it’s been all self- funded and is being made on the enthusiasm, so we need your support!

The contributions gained through Indiegogo will allow us to fly and cover costs of filming in Nepal, to continue what we have already started in London. YOU will enable us to continue production process. We’re in touch with many more people and organisations to be part of the film, we continue our research, we have more subjects lined up, and have partner organisations - at this point, we just need to physically be in Nepal to progress further. £12,000 is just the minimum amount and it will go towards equipment rental, flights, transportation within the country, cost of living, and hiring a translator and crew. This money will not cover our post-production costs, but will allow us to get footage that will in turn make us stronger candidates for film grants down the line. We are also already in communication with a number of foundations who are interested in supporting the film, but would like to see some footage. This first £12,000 will get us there. 

About the Filmmakers (Niina & Nata)

We met in June 2016, felt immediate connection, and decided to make the film about this very special and under-researched topic. Niina works in the city of London in FinTech sector, but her passion is in filmmaking. Niina uses her exceptional organising skills and contacts to make this film a unique and beautiful story. Natalia Lavrova is a professional film director, who holds Master's degree in Digital Communication fromSaint-Petersburg University of Humanities and Social Sciences, and she is an experienced in animation and 3D projects / commercials / corporate films. She is also CG Director, VFX Supervisor, and she received Cannes Corporate Media & TV Awards in 2012 for Best Animation, Graphics and Special Effects.

  

What’s in for you

We want to make this film for people who are passionate about well-being and self-development, like ourselves. This is an exciting opportunity for YOU to be part of film-making process and to discover a new powerful way of deep relaxation. By helping us to raise necessary funds you can experience miraculous healing power of Sound and gain an intimate glimpse into the film-making process itself, through screenings, access to footage, etc. Our goal is to reveal healing properties of TSB and conduct an investigative objective research on them. This will be an important film, but also a beautifully crafted film, pushing the boundaries of today’s documentary film-making practices. You can help us to make this wonderful film happen! And your kindness will be rewarded!

 

Amazing Perks!

To thank you for your generous contributions we have amazing perks for you!

They are really exceptional! So if the project resonates with you please buy our perks! They will bring you lots of joy! Check them out!

If you don’t feel that you can donate, we encourage you to share this campaign through social media and join our FB Group, Tweet, Instagram -- just spreading the word can make a huge difference! You can also help research this topic: send us your ideas, suggestions and valuable information you think we should include.

Big big thank you from our hearts to your hearts! <3 <3 <3

Thank you!

Niina & Nata

 

P.S. We want to say special thanks for their great support and participation to: PrimeCut, Anne Malone (Oasis of Sound), Andrea Moretti (Ancient Sound Healing),Viktor Ogui (Daodar), Himalayan Singing Bowl Center, Ashera Hart, David Gilbert (Sound Healing Center, San Fransicso), Jane Tepley (Modern Warrior Mind), Maria Zhuravleva (Maria’s Universe), Arko Ltd, Mila Nesterova, YogaBook and others.

 

Contacts us on:

Email: tsb@primecut.pro

Facebook group: Tibetan Singing Bowls Film

Website: tsbfilm.com

Instagram: NiinaGo

Twitter: Tibetan Singing Bowls Film

story:
Have you also met people worrying about their body shape because a certain website suggested to reduce on calorie intake? Or people looking up different diets online to control their weight even if there is no need to do so? Not to mention children reading online magazines about the ideal body and ideal personality. If you are also concerned about these issues, then this is the moment when you can act.

 

Mental health and wellbeing is a key factor for social cohesion, cultural and economical progress. Being a young psychologist student and researcher my golden principle is to help our society growing by fighting for mental health.

This is the reason why I have started to investigate eating disorders. Specifically, I have  examined online pro-anorexic communities: forums where people come together to support each other to be eating disordered and maintain anorexic lifestyle. These forums impede the psychological treatment of eating disorders and impose important danger for children and youngsters reading them.

When the University of Cambridge offered me a place in the MPhil program of Social and Developmental Psychology, I got my once-in-a-lifetime possibility to continue my research on such forums in the best institution a researcher could have ever dreamed about. This environment enables me to give my best, put all the knowledge and all the methodologies together with the help of the internationally well-known professionals to contribute to our scientific knowledge.

In Cambridge I will look in depth at what needs and motivations lead a person to join a pro-anorexic community. I expect my research to help us understand how these online communities supporting psychological problems work. This will help to offer applied solutions to develop psychological care ready to react to patients taking part in such communities.

To reach these goals, I have only one thing I need: your help and support. Coming from Central-Europe, Hungary, I am unable on my own to finance the tuition fees and maintenance in Cambridge. I have managed to fund my studies partly, and now I need your generous contribution to cover the rest of it. Each and every contribution counts, each and every support means that we can join our forces to go for a better world!

story:
Why "Touch & Go?"

Touch & Go is about an aspiring teenage aviator who survives the flight of her life in the presence of clear danger when her flight instructor takes advantage of her on a night flight.

Pictured above: Heather Hutton, Director. In the cockpit of an aircraft during flight training early in her career.

  • "My name is Heather Hutton and I learned to fly at the young age of 14."
  • Raising funds for this film is critical to ensure the safety of all crew and talent on board. There are underwater stunts that require Safety Coordinators, Underwater Camera Operators, Medics and supplies. We also need production insurance to clear this project as a SAG-AFTRA production.
  • By Contributing to this campaign you will give a woman a voice to speak about the injustice of child molestation. More importantly you will help empower other victims of abuse to overcome the shame and fear that holds them back from becoming the person they desire to be.

Above: Covington Airport, home of Heather's first solo flight at age 16.

Let's Talk Numbers

TOTAL BUDGET: $10,000.00

  • Production Insurance = approximately $3,000.
  • Stunt Coordination, Underwater Cam Op, Stunt Actress, Medic = approximately $5,000
  • Aircraft fuel for B-roll = approximately $500.00
  • Food for Talent & Crew = approximately $500.00
  • Equipment Rental = approximately $1,000.00

Above: Our team of filmmakers building the crowdfunding video for Touch & Go.

  • If we do not secure the full cash amount of the goal, all funds raised will be used for safety coordination. Our primary production concerns are that the safety needs of our talent and crew are met.

Why Is T&G Important?

This is an opportunity to teach children about the inappropriateness of touching, child molestation, and sexual abuse. This film will be shot and edited in such a way to imply content without showing it. It will be appropriate for ages 13 and older. By watching this film with loved ones you can begin the conversation about how to prevent sexual abuse. It all starts with teaching children how to question authority.

Above: Heather Hutton directs an intense fight scene during a music video shoot.

  • This project is valuable to contributors around the world because sexual abuse is a CRIME and it is the most ignored issue in ALL countries affecting ALL races, sexes, and age groups.
  • "As a Director, I'm building a track record to create a safe environment for talent and crew.  All people have physical boundaries and psychological boundaries. My pursuit aims to protect all parties involved and never place anyone in a situation where their human rights are violated."
  • Touch & Go is written as fiction, and based on true events.

Where Is The Project Going?

  • We are thrilled to build this project with the help of our cast, crew and backers. The plan is to build the short version of this script with a bigger picture in mind: we plan to build a feature film based on this same narrative. We always have a larger scale plan for taking our productions to the next level, and we can't wait to take these steps into the future to make this film a reality.

(L-R): Alex Preston, Editor, and Heather Hutton, Director, accepting the Jury Award for a film they collaborated on at the 2017 Atlanta Film Festival!

  • In the immediate future, we will select festivals at regional, national and international levels to screen Touch & Go. This process is intended to shop our idea to potential investors in these markets to prepare the film for its next phase of production.

Risks & Challenges

Above: Director Heather Hutton discusses blocking and safety logistics before shooting a fight scene.

  • "The greatest risk I see in directing a film involving child molestation is making sure my talent and crew are up to the task psychologically.  We will have many safety meetings to discuss blocking and resolve any fears of inappropriate touching. If I fail at this as a Director, then I fail as a human being. This is a serious concern and we are treating the content as such."
  • Ways we are overcoming risks and challenges:
    • Casting a lead actress over 18 to look younger.
    • Taking every precaution necessary during sexual abuse scenes using strategic blocking.
    • Having one-on-one conversations with talent to learn more about what they are or are NOT comfortable doing on set.

Above: Projection design elements designed and executed by Director Heather Hutton on the shoot of a music video in an industrial workspace.

  • We are confident that our team is comprised of professionals who will treat this subject matter with the respect and maturity that the narrative requires.
  • "What qualifies me to overcome these hurdles, is I just directed my first sexual abuse where there was no physical touching and my Director of Photography shot it in one take. No one left my set feeling damaged or physically hurt. I was very proud of the level of professionalism my actors brought to set as well as my crew, and I feel confident that this knowledge will translate onto the set of Touch & Go."
  • If any logistical or performance-related problems occur on set that causes actors or crew to feel unsafe, the shoot will be tabled for further evaluation and discussion.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We are so excited to have you on our team of supporters.
  • We love donations! If financial support isn't your thing, send prayers and good vibes sent our way. Every little bit of positive energy helps!
  • You can also help by sharing this CAMPAIGN. Indiegogo has a SHARE OPTION, so we invite you to blast us out on social media. We can't wait to engage the world with this story, and we need your help to make it happen! Check out our Facebook and Instagram:
    • www.facebook.com/touch.and.go.pro
    • Instagram: touchandgofilm

story:
THE PERFECT HOST: A SOUTHERN GOTHIC TALE

In October 2016, the director's cut of TPH test-screened in New Zealand & received a wonderful response. I took that response, along with solid feedback from Kiwi filmmakers & cut a version of the film I am ready to give to the world.

In the upcoming month, I begin submitting to top-tier film festivals, but before we screen, TPH needs the final score, colour, & sound design completed. Typically, I'm a one-man-post-production-band, but I feel this project is worthy of so much more than what I can do alone. I need to bring in other talented people to make this film better than I could have imagined.

Who would have thought a little film from South Arkansas would have the chance to work with Park Road Post (The Lord of the Rings, King Kong, District 9)? Not me for sure. But after renown Kiwi filmmaker Julian Arahanga (Once Were Warriors, The Matrix) met with me & said Park Road worked with tiny films all the time, and he was sure they'd be keen, I knew a final colour & sound mix from them would take my film so much further than I ever could.

We've recently added the talented, LA-based composer Cameron Chambers to the team, and he's begun scoring the film. Cameron has scored multiple trailers including: Bates Motel, The Hunger Games: Mockingjay, The X-Files & more. A large portion of this funding will go to composition fees, renting recording space, & hiring a choir & small orchestra to complete his score.

 

BREAKDOWN OF FUNDS EARNED FROM FROM THIS CAMPAIGN

   $8,600 - Music composition, Travel, Studio Rental, Orchestration, & Recording

   $7,400 - Sound Mix, Colour, & Digital Cinema Print

   $2,000 - Promotional Printing, Festival Fees, & Media Placement

 

SOCIAL MEDIA

We are releasing stills from The Perfect Host often, so be sure to follow us on social media:

Facebook: /PerfectHostFilm

Instagram: @PerfectHostFilm

Twitter: @PerfectHostFilm

 

Any donations will earn you a spot in the film credits under our special thanks section. For larger donations, please contact us directly.

Thanks a lot, and I can't wait for you to see the film.

- Derrick

story:
Born and raised in Denver, Colorado, Brad has always had an affinity for the great outdoors. While working on a national hunting show at the age of 17, he discovered his passion for film production and moved to NY to pursue his dream.  He worked his way up through multiple film crew departments before becoming a commercial producer; eventually creating content for well known commercial brands.  

While this brought him happiness, Brad felt there was something missing in his life. He missed Colorado and found himself increasingly relishing the short periods of time he was able to spend away from the city.

After much thought, Brad decided early this year to combine both loves and make a major change in his life.  He decided to walk the length of The American Discovery Trail.

The goal of our campaign is create media that promotes a national interest, awareness, support and participation of the trail.  The American Discovery Trail, founded in 2000, is an underutilized national resource.  Nearly 60 million people live within an hour the trail.  It is a system of recreational trails and roads which collectively form a coast-to-coast hiking and biking trail across the mid-tier of the United States.  It starts in Delaware on the Atlantic Ocean and ends on the northern California coast on the Pacific Ocean.  The northern route covers 4,834 miles.  It is the only non-motorized coast-to-coast trail.

To promote The American Discovery Trail we will create engaging media which in turn will be distributed on multiple social media platforms in an effort to garner national interest and participation.  Utilizing social media Brad will be seeking out communities, people, places and stories that make up the heart of America.  Your participation in this campaign will enable us to help The American Discovery Trail become a household name; one more exciting and well known than even the Adirondack or pacific coast trail.  We wish to further the initiative for federal legislation to protect this little known treasure for generations to come.

Our Indiegogo fundraising goal represents 20% of our overall budget.  Your donation will go specifically towards enhancing the production quality of this media by providing equipment, crew and advertising support.  The other portion of our budget will be derived from sponsorship opportunities based on the engagement of the media.  

There are multiple ways to contribute to our project.  

1)  Monetary donations

2)  Suggest people, places, or points of interest Brad needs to see

3)  Support, share, like and interact with us on social media

4)  Join Brad on the trail for an hour or for a week

5)  Lodging along the trail

6)  Care packages, camping and hiking gear.

story:
"Animals: A Parallel History" is the first feature documentary movie about participation of animals in the human history. Let me show you how can save ALL animals on Earth in the next generation with one doc movie and one book.

"Animals: A Parallel History" Trailer with Factory farming segment

"Animals: A Parallel History" Trailer with War segment

The revolutionary idea behind entire project is to introduce Animals in Modern History education into the school curriculum worldwide. Remember the moment when you find out about the things we do to the animals. I’m sure this isn’t taught in schools. Project is partly supported by Tom Regan's Culture & Animals Foundation.

Pavel Trofimovich Morozov, better known by the diminutive Pavlik, was a Soviet youth praised by the Soviet press as a martyr. His story, dated to 1932, is that of a 13-year-old boy who denounced his father to the authorities and was in turn killed by his family. His story was a subject of reading, songs, plays, a symphonic poem, a full-length opera and six biographies. The cult propaganda had a huge impact on the moral norms of generations of school children, who were encouraged to inform on their parents. Also, in Nazi Germany 97% of all public school teachers, some 300,000 persons, had joined the National Socialist Teachers League by 1936. In fact, teachers joined the Nazi Party in greater numbers than any other profession.

In “The Case for Animal Rights” book in the 1985 Regan writes: 'What's wrong - fundamentally wrong - with the way animals are treated isn't the details that vary from case to case. It's the whole system.' What was Stalin and Hitler knew almost a century ago, most of the people from animal rights movement do not understand: we can beat entire system only if we start from his womb: school education. The history of what we've done to the Animals should be taught along with our other crimes. Teaching of world history without animals is the false principle of our education which is dramatically reflects on our environment.

I'm sure that the introduction of animal education in schools is necessary to win a battle for animals and humans on Earth on the long term. With this powerful educational tool we can save ALL animals in the next generation!

Watch videos, contribute and get rewarded!

This is the world's greatest animal movie/education project ever. This is literally true.

As animals do not have the power of speech and their fate is not taught in schools, this movie is a modest attempt to show people the shared history. Movie shows how animals decreased in importance over the last 200 years and became ordinary machines for food and experiments.

This condition is still getting worse every day and a majority of the human population is not familiar with the horrific facts: -Meat production is a major contributor to climate change.Currently, agriculture, “particularly meat and dairy products,” account for 70% of the world’s freshwater consumption. -Over 150 billion farmed animals are killed every year by humans. More than 3,000 animals die every second in slaughterhouses around the world by the meat, egg, and dairy industries. -More than 100 million animals are reported killed by hunters each year for sport or fashion. -Humans are killing all the Gorillas. Only 700 Gorillas left on earth, but 7 billion humans

These facts are just the tip of the iceberg.

The invention of film marked the beginning of the modern age. The story of the first film is simple; it shows a horse rider galloping. Like many times before, man and animal were participants in the history of mankind, history, which has forgotten about animals. Animals are brutally exploited, hunted and eaten. But how did we get into this situation, our generally accepted reality? How we built this brutal and selfish world that has become hell for animals.This is our movie story.

Albert, a rhesus monkey, the first ever primate astronaut.

Between black and white segments we set comments of animal rights activists. We had established cooperation with many animal rights activist productions from around the world who participate with interview in the movie, like Robbyne Kaamill (Free Lolita), Halevy Jane (International Anti-Fur), Sasha Bojoor (269), Anita Krajnc (Toronto Pig Save), Gary Yourofsky, Tom Regan, and many more.

Very rare archival video material that we have collected is so suggestive and breathtaking and with editing we will reinforce this impression. As can be seen from the movie opening credit, we decided to use graphic and animation inspired by the style of the Progressive era, also turn-of-the-century circus style.

We’d like to make much more fantastic animations between all black & white segments and we want stylistic perfection pleasant to the eye, also with animated graphs/statistics. Since 50% of the film is made, now our main goal is to raise the funds that we can make this spectacular animation, to complete the film to enter the race for the Academy Award! We also want to colorize old black & white segments with animals for the first time and make animated statistics and charts and new narration/ sound editing. Also we need a  footage with the school children and teachers interview about the animal history education idea.

We also have entire doc movie in the beautiful picture book version "Animals in Modern History", almost ready for publishing. The book is very important part of our project, it is not the ordinary non-fiction picture book, but essential tool for schools and teachers!

Mademoiselle Fifi, December 30, 1910.

Producer/Director

story:
Short Summary

We are three final year television production students studying at Bournemouth University in Bournemouth, England. We are all incredibly passionate, devoted students from diverse backgrounds, and are interested in the chance to tell a story as unique and controversial as this. This project has the potential to shed light on the life of the Royal Kumari, not only as a religious and cultural icon but as a young child and girl living in Nepal. 

As women in the film industry, we are all incredibly passionate about the importance of diverse, female-driven storytelling both on and off-screen. With the help of contributors, this documentary could highlights a unique and controversial part of Nepal's culture and the world surrounding this child goddess and what the Kumari means to this country, culture, and its people.

What We Need

Funds that are contributed to this project will be going directly to the production of the short film, and are divided below:

35% - Transportation

25% - Accommodation

20% - Craft

20% - Contributor costs

This project has also received a grant from Global Horizons at Bournemouth University, and the funds from this will be added to the money raised here to contribute to our travel expenses and other production costs

The Impact

This project in incredibly valuable not only to you as a contributor, but to the rest of the world who may have never heard of the Kumari before. 

As a part of our course at Bournemouth University, we have successfully produced several documentaries and short films such as this, and are excited about the unique challenge that this project presents. 

According to a record, Kumari started in the 5th century to protect the country and to maintain a balance between religion and culture. It is part of the unique characteristic culture of Nepal that you won’t be able to see from other countries. Every single move that she makes as the living Kumari is sacred. Nepalese Kumaris are worshipped for about 10 years starting when the girl is between two and five years old. You will gain an unparalleled insight into the Nepalese sacred culture in a visual way whilst watching this documentary. We have unique access with the Nepalese fixer, who has a good relationship with the Kumari care taker in Kathmandu. It will give the audiences an amazing opportunity to meet the actual living goddess, who is difficult and rare for even a Nepalese to see, all from the comfort of their living room.

Risks & Challenges

There are obviously many challenges involved with this project, and obstacles that we may face on our way to achieving this goal.

We will be working in close connection with our tutors at Bournemouth University to ensure that all risks have been assessed and the project is as safe and secure as possible for everyone involved. Your contributions for helping in production costs will assist in ensuring that a project like this is feasible considering these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are fluent in Nepalese or can assist in translating Nepalese to English, this would be extremely beneficial and appreciated!

Please share this indiegogo campaign to spread the word about this documentary project and the fascinating world of the Kumari.

Thank you!

Solip, Serafina, and Abigail

story:
Tim's (Norman Dillon) life is in pieces after he narrowly escapes a deadly car crash. He and his wife Maggie (Carolyn Bracken) begin to rebuild their lives together but as their relationship begins to grow and blossom a malevolent presence threatens to drive a wedge between them.

 

 

We know that €20,000 is a huge amount. Here's where your contribution will go:

  • Actor/Crew payment 18% - Working on a film is hard work (as well as being fun) and we think that the cast and crew deserve to be compensated for their efforts.
  • Travel/Location 8% - Getting where you need to go in Ireland is not always as straightforward as it should be, especially in small towns and rural areas.
  • Food 12% - We need to eat, so do the crew and cast.
  • Equipment 44% - Sound Equipment, Lights, Lenses and Camera all of these items will contribute to making the finished film better quality.
  • Insurance 10% - The not so fun expense.
  • Indiegogo fees 8%

 

We plan to make "Shatter" no matter what. This is a project we are excited about and and we have put so much work in already we will not be turning back. The funds that we raise from this campaign will go to improve the plans we already have in place. Better equipment means a better finished product, better pay for the actors and crew, better everything. You can help make this project fulfill it's true potential. We have already added everything we can to the funds, any money raised here will be added to the overall budget.

 

  • Byron West: Writer/ Director / Producer


 

  • Byron has a vast knowledge of Being on film sets both being behind the camera and being in front of it. He first became interested in post production when he was 21; he decided to pick up a camera and make a short film in a day. Although it was an amateur attempt it lit a spark. From there he went on to study film and television production for 2 years in Cork, Ireland. Since then Byron's passion has switched from post production to directing.  He has already made several successful short films which have been screened in various film festivals."Shatter" is Byron's first feature film.

 

  • Joseph Norton: Co-Producer/ Composer

 

  • Joseph Norton is a classically trained musician and composer. He studied in the CIT - Cork School of Music and received a First Class Honours. He began learning music at the age of 13 with the guitar and then went on to learn piano and cello. He started composing at the age of 15 and has studied harmony, counterpoint and orchestration. He teaches music privately and also accompanies musicians on the piano. He has also played in various orchestras and is currently a part of the Cork School of Music Symphony Orchestra. This is Joseph's first film.

Cast:

  • Norman Dillon: Lead Actor (Tim)


Norman Dillon was born and raised in Houston, TX. He didn't start acting until his senior year at the University of Houston when he got a part at a small theater in southwest Houston. After appearing in several plays in his hometown, Norman moved to New York City in 2013 where he studied at the Barrow Group School of Acting and worked steadily on stage and screen. Apart from acting, Norman is marginally obsessed with food, especially all things meat and charcuterie related. There is little he wouldn’t grind, stuff, smoke, cure, ferment, or even pickle. He also can’t seem to quit playing rugby, no matter how many torn rotator cuffs, bruised ribs, or broken fingers he’s picked up over the years. In 2016, he and his wife moved to Dublin for an exciting opportunity in his wife’s career. 

 

  • Carolyn Bracken: Lead Actress (Maggie)

    Carolyn Bracken began acting at the age of 6 with local drama group. She continued in to the festival circuit in my teens, and was awarded several acting awards including All Ireland Best Supporting Actress for the role of 'April' in April Bright by Dermot Bolger. She returned to acting full time for the past three years. Her credits include various appearances in The Savage Eye, The Fall, A Date for Mad Mary, SPAR Christmas Advert, Game of Thrones, Ripper Street. She has recently completed filming 'Bare', a short by Fight Back Films where she play the lead, Veronica. She is currently in rehearsals for 'Don't Dress for Dinner' by Marc Camoletti, and 'Eden' by Eugene O'Brien. She graduated the Gaiety School of Acting. She also completed a screen acting course with Louise Kiely Casting, and is certified in Speech and Drama with The Leinster School of Music.
     
    • Emma Cansdale

    She is an actor and psychology student from Cork. She is enthusiastic, spontaneous, easy-going human with a deep love and appreciation for acting and art. She studied Theatre and Drama Studies in C.I.T. where she received valuable training and went on to gain experience in a variety of roles in short and feature length films and theatre. Lover of creativity and expressionism and passionate about any role she plays!
     
    • Emilie Kate O Driscoll

    Emilie Kate has been acting for two years now in predominantly student and short films. In January 2016 she studied film acting at Bowstreet. She met actors, directors and coaches there who not only invested time in her but ultimately inspired her to pursue acting full time, which is what she is doing now.

    • Kevin O'Leary

    Kevin Patrick O’ Leary is a young Irish actor who started his journey in his home city of Cork. Curiosity led him to actorsvision acting school and from his very first class he was hooked. From there he took his training to the next level and over the next two years had the privilege of being trained by Belinda and Ian wild in the Kinsale college of further education. As a person tree things make me happy: Acting, time with my loved ones and friends, and getting out and doing a bit whether boxing gymming or adventuring being active is always good.

     

     

    • We may not be able to complete the film on time -  This could be because of weather setting back production (Ireland - need we say more), illness of cast or crew or something that we can't even imagine at this point. We have budgeted for extra days for this very reason, however no amount of forward planning can cover every single eventuality.

     

    • Ask family, friends, co-workers (anyone!) to get the word out and make some noise about Shatter!
    • Share us on twitter, facebook, instagram, every little helps!

As a person tree things make me happy: Acting, time with my loved ones and friends, and getting out and doing a bit whether boxing gymming or adventuring being active is always good.  

We may not be able to complete the film on time -  This could be because of weather setting back production (Ireland - need we say more), illness of cast or crew or something that we can't even imagine at this point. We have budgeted for extra days for this very reason, however no amount of forward planning can cover every single eventuality.
 



Ask family, friends, co-workers (anyone!) to get the word out and make some noise about Shatter!
Share us on twitter, facebook, instagram, every little helps!

story:
Hi, I'm Chris!

Playing the Wing Commander games as a teenager inspired me to become an Aerospace Engineer. Now, as an adult, I am paying back that inspiration.

I am a Star Citizen!

Since the early days of the Star Citizen campaign there has been a significant UK fan base and there have been discussions, since those early days, about a large annual meetup in the UK. CitizenCon 2015, in Manchester, proved that there was an appetite for this annual UK meetup but there is no official CIG event in the UK every year because CitizenCon rotates between locations, so we decided to run our own event. Thus, BritizenCon was born!

BritizenCon, in July 2016, was a spectacular success. But, we want next year's to be bigger and better! This is where you come in:

What Do We Need To Raise?

To cover the cost of the event, we are looking to raise £6,000. This will be used to cover:

  • The hire of the venue
  • AV and PA system
  • Equipment and transport costs
  • Backer rewards
  • Crowdfunding fees

 

What Will We Have At BritizenCon 2017?

The schedule will be finalised nearer the event, but there will be:

  • Community panel
  • Dev panel*
  • Raffle
  • UK Dogfight Championship
  • Exhibitors
  • Cosplay
  • Short film showcase

(*Maybe two dev panels depending on dev availability)

If we raise a total of £7,000 or more we will also be able to cover the cost of a good quality livestream and videos of the event will be edited and posted to our YouTube channel afterwards.

If we raise beyond £7,000, that extra money will go towards securing a larger venue for the 2018 event.

 

Tiers and Perks

We appreciate that not everyone can attend the event. For those people, we have created the Donation and T-Shirt tiers.

The ticket tiers will be sold in batches. Each tier has a small number of Early Bird tickets at a discounted rate for those of you who are quick off the mark. When they're gone, they're gone!

Donation: Donate £1 or much as you like and know you have our heartfelt thanks for your support for the event and for the growing UK community. (This tier does NOT include a reward)

 

T-Shirt Tier: Want something in return for your support but can't make the event then why not our T-shirt?! T-Shirts are shipped worldwide, shipping cost is additional and is shown after tier selection. (This tier does NOT include a ticket)

 

Ticket Tier: Keeping it simple, want to just come to the event? Grab this tier to get yourself an entry ticket and we will see you in Manchester!

 

Fan Tier: Want some swag with that? This tier gets you entry for 1 to BritizenCon, the T-Shirt, and a swag bag! (The swag bag and T-Shirt will be picked up on entry to BritizenCon)

 

Super Fan Tier: This has everything in the Fan tier plus a hoodie to keep you warm in the cold depths of space* (*will not keep you warm in space)

 

All tiers let you go above and beyond if you are feeling extra generous and supportive, and we are grateful to every supporter, big or small, we can't do it without your help!

 

The Impact

BritizenCon is the only big annual UK Star Citizen event in the years when the official CIG CitizenCon event is in a different country. It is the best opportunity for the UK fans to interact with the devs and with each other.

With the UK Dogfight Championship, we are starting to explore the viability of Star Citizen related e-sports. We plan to develop this aspect of the event from year to year. There are excited times ahead in this area!

 

Risks & Challenges

All risks are currently shouldered by the organisers in terms of costs for securing everything needed for the event.

If we don't reach the goal, all funds raised will go towards covering the cost of the event and fees.

2017's event is currently held under deposit funded personally by us, the organisers.

If we don't cover the costs for the event there will be no future BritizenCons. 

 

Event Terms and Conditions

  • You agree that you are pledging to help fund the event and that your donation is non-refundable.
  • During this campaign, tickets to BritizenCon are only available in the reward tiers. Any remaining tickets will be put on sale, without the other rewards, after the campaign closes.
  • Each attendee must have their own ticket.
  • Attendees must be over-18 and bring ID to the event.
  • Full name and email address are required. These will be collected through the survey at the end of the campaign.
  • Tickets will be emailed to the email address provided.
  • The organisers reserve the right to remove anyone not displaying acceptable standards of behaviour from the venue.
  • Fan and Super Fan rewards are to be collected at the event.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to contribute there are other ways you can help:

  • Share this campaign with other Star Citizens
  • Share on Social Media with the hashtags #BritizenCon and #StarCitizen
  • Share with your Org members and local meetups / BarCitizens
  • Share your videos and photos of BritizenCon 2016

 

Exhibitors

We have a small number of exhibitors tables available. If you wish to exhibit at the event, please contact us: enquiries2017@britizencon.uk

story:
What is it about?

Imagine a modern version of "Garden State" mix it with "Eternal Sunshine Of The Spotless Mind" and a touch of "Happiness" and "Welcome to the Dollhouse"- and you have an idea of where I'm headed. 

Here's the one liner: "The last thing Eddie Mills wants to do is go home and deal with his dying Dad. But guilt and a strange sense of destiny forces him to get on a plane.  Once he lands---he has to face his family, his past ---basically everything he's been running away from for the last 20 years. "

My film is structured like a Charlie Kaufman movie in that there are time jumps and flashbacks. The tone is very similar toTodd Solondz. I'm a big fan. I borrow from the greats. ; ) So, lot's of dark laughs, forced perspective, and  rich character archetypes that ring true...(More about the story...later in my campaign)

WHY YOU BUGGING US FOR  MONEY, CLARKE?

Fair question. Earlier this year, we shopped this script to production houses and studios. Money people. I called all my celebrity kick ass actor friends and asked if they would do the film. They agreed. So with an impressive cast attached, we had some bites and nibbles. We were hoping to get at the very least $600,000 to make our little independent movie... but finding funding proved daunting and more than time consuming. I decided to take matters into my own hands. I could produce it myself if I tried a crowdfunding campaign.  

THE SUBJECT MATTER: DEATH AND RELATIONSHIPS

Hollywood isn't so quick to embrace a film about death. Challenging subject? Oh yes...but one that we all deal with eventually. Right? Why not a story about it? When I went through the experience of losing my dad, I couldn't believe how unprepared I was. Those last two weeks of his life. Nobody wants to talk about that time in the process of losing a loved one. The hard times....

Well, I saw a story there. And it all came together in my head. Then on the page.

THE BIZ

The business likes it when a film falls conveniently into ONE category. They don't like hyphenates like Dark-Comedy . The rule is: make a horror movie or make a comedy. Anything "in between" confuses them. And when they are confused, raising money is slow to impossible.

Yes, I wrote something that is hard to categorize.  My film is moving, sad and honest then again it's absurd, angry and at times VERY funny. I thought that in independent cinema we can experiment with genre. Create our own.  Can't we? Why not?
  
"WHY DO YOU NEED $200,000 DOLLARS?"

Making a movie ain't cheap. 

You have to hire an army of people. I'm shooting this in LA. I promised my cast they could drive home every night and sleep in their own beds. Ironically, LA is a very expensive place to shoot. 
We have to rent studio space, moving trucks, storage, office space and lots of transportation. I have to get insurance and create an LLC.  I have to fly in some actors and put them up. We have to feed everybody, every day on set (20 days of food) . I have 51 speaking parts that need to be paid. I have pre-production costs. Locations? I have to rent a hospital as a set. Not cheap.  Hiring a crew? Not to mention 1/3 of the budget goes into post production. Editing, Sound mixing, color etc. etc. etc.

GET THE PICTURE? LOTTA WORK....MOMENTUM

To sum it up, movie making is incredibly hard, awesomely time consuming and extremely expensive. Can I shoot this picture for $200, 000 in 20 days? Yes and no.

I'm hoping to raise more capital with the money we generate here. This is an important first step but at the very least I need $600,000 to make the picture. This capital campaign will give me the momentum I need to reach my fundraising goals. I'm sure of it. 

WILL THINGS GO WRONG?

Will I lose some actors because of scheduling and other work? Maybe. I hope not. I'm going to fight like hell to make this go as smooth as possible. Plus my friends are cool. They are doing this movie because we love to work together and we want to make a film that matters to us.

WHY GIVE?

This is a really cool project. I want to include you. I have a great script and an exceptional cast. I have a production team waiting for financing so they can do their jobs and start putting this movie together. 

By the fall of 2017 we will have made a film that everyone can be proud of.

I will work to make that happen with all of my heart and soul.  

Without independent money, this kind of movie cannot be made. Without you, my script will just stay sitting in my hard drive...waiting....;

IF you jump on board and join us...

I will keep you up to date on my production website where I will be posting a video diary as we progress to production. Once we start shooting I will continue posting and include photos and video from the set.

 I'm very excited about taking this next step in my career...Please join me.

Thank you for helping to make this project come to life.

Thank you. Thank you. Thank you.

; )))) Larry

PS. I've inserted my Director's Concept Reel here to give you a sense of tone. It is not the movie... ; ) 

Have a look: Also included full Original 6 minute pitch reel for campaign as well.

story:
The road so far... (for you Winchester fans out there)

Back in December 2015, a group of Phoenix filmmakers embarked on the development of "Dark Dignity," a character-driven, sci-fi drama with a dystopian flavor.

The project stars female leads, and went on to include a great mix of local talent in front of and behind the camera. We were fortunate enough to rally the troops for principal photography in late February.

Our first Indiegogo in early 2016 raised a little more than $5,000 and helped fund our entire three-day production.

With our final $5,000 campaign this month, we now hope to polish the final cut, as was initially budgeted, and also spread the indie film love among other Arizonans.

Our final goals include color grading, visual effects, sound mixing, score and the final edit. We'll also host an official red carpet premiere event featuring other Arizona indie films. Proceeds from the premiere will benefit local nonprofit Phoenix Screenwriters Association.

(Plus, we have swag!)

Donors who contribute $10 or $25 will receive a standard or premium "Dark Dignity" T-shirt at the January 2017 premiere in Arizona (or delivered in-person thereafter), along with a discount code for two tickets to the event.

First things first...

We're so grateful for the 100+ friends and family members who contributed to our campaign earlier this year and helped us shoot "Dark Dignity." We're also thankful for the additional 100+ kind folks who made the long trek to set during those three days. 

As a token of our appreciation, if we reach our goal in the next month, we'll order premium T-shirts for those who donate $25 during this final campaign, and also for every single cast and crew member, plus everyone who contributed $25 or more during our first campaign. (For those math whizzes at home, that's approximately 200 T-shirts.)

It's a win-win, really. For #DDNation. And humanity. But mostly for #DDNation.

Sharing the love

The "Dark Dignity" team is excited to showcase our film in January, but we also want to give our friends and family a broader taste of the creative work being done by other talented people throughout Arizona.

Our film will run approximately 20 minutes. That leaves plenty of time to invite other indie filmmakers to participate in the program. We'll include some of the most interesting short projects produced within the last year, and we'll invite those filmmakers to offer insight about their artistic journey.

The Impact: Supporting Phoenix Screenwriters Association

We look forward to donating proceeds of the January premiere event to Phoenix Screenwriters Association, a local nonprofit which has supported Arizona screenwriters and filmmakers for several years as an independent organization.

Now, as an official 501(c)(3), Phoenix Screenwriters Association is extending its reach with programs and training for those who endeavor to work in the film industry.

Not only have many of the "Dark Dignity" team members and supporters benefited from PSA's long-term efforts, but the concept for the film was hatched at a free PSA event series called "In the Works." We can't wait to see what PSA accomplishes in 2017.

Standard vs. Premium #DDNation Tees

We have two #DDNation T-shirt options for Indiegogo donors thanks to Trayart Media:

  • Standard "Dark Dignity" shirt with the logo on front
  • Premium "Dark Dignity" shirt with the logo on front and the #DDNation roster on the back

Just a reminder: If you donated $25 or more in our first Indiegogo campaign, or if you were a "Dark Dignity" cast or crew member, you will receive information about your preferred shirt type and size.

If we reach our goal by early January, we'll order a shirt for you!

Thanks again for your support!

If you donated at all to our first Indiegogo campaign in early 2016, thanks so much. We don't expect you to donate again. However, if you wouldn't mind sharing this final campaign with a couple friends who like indie films and cool T-shirts, that would be swell.

Follow us on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter @DarkDignityFilm. We can't wait to show you "Dark Dignity" in 2017.

story:
Short Summary

For those of you who don't know me very well, my name is Jon Anderson, and I'm a third year directing student at Columbia College Chicago. Brain Teaser--though through the lens of a much different character than myself--is a deeply personal film, as it tackles a lot of the struggles I dealt with in my last two years here at film school. I've always been extremely hard on myself, which has made the prospect of failure much more difficult to accept than it should be. I would find myself despairing because I wasn't good enough, and getting angry at myself for not being better. But we all know what it's like to fail, and we all know what it's like to fail a lot, over and over again. My hope with this film is to reach those who have either struggled or are struggling now to find genuine purpose from within, and to expose the ridiculous things we sometimes tell ourselves to prevent us from being satisfied with who we are. In order to make this a reality though, we need your help! Any amount you donate will help bring us one step closer to achieving the professional look and feel necessary for this film to be seen by the masses. So not only will you be supporting the aspirations of a gifted crew of hardworking film students, but because of you, something beautiful and transformative will come into existence. Beautiful! Transformative! Because of you!

What We Need & What You Get

Our total budget for this film is right around the $4000 mark, which is actually quite modest for a production of this scale. Your contribution will go primarily toward feeding our dedicated cast and crew, providing transportation of equipment and personnel to and from set, creating an expressive yet believable environment through costuming and production design, as well as a variety of smaller logistical costs like securing locations and backing up footage once everything is shot.

In exchange for your generosity and support, I have a few perks to offer--many of which are unique keepsakes from set--which I hope will serve as a heartfelt reminder of the very special artistic achievement you were able to make possible.

Risks & Challenges

As with any production, professional or otherwise, there are always risks, and things are guaranteed to go awry in some way or another. The beauty of this medium though is that with careful preparation and a team of sharp, talented individuals, we can overcome any obstacle that is thrown our way.

With this being said, the biggest challenge we face with this production in particular is going to be with time. There is a good amount of story to cover and only four days to do it, so between selecting the best shots and staging the more difficult ones, the clock will be constantly ringing in my ear like a glockenspiel.

Nevertheless though, this will be the fourth film I've directed at Columbia on a larger scale, and my entire crew has spent immeasurable hours practicing their craft and mastering their abilities on set, so I have the upmost confidence in our adaptive abilities.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to support us financially but would still like to help make this project a reality, do us a huge favor and share our Indiegogo page with the world on social media! It never hurts to get people excited about an interesting upcoming film, and you never know who's got a rich uncle in Luxembourg out there somewhere.
story_txt:
Short Summary
For those of you who don't know me very well, my name is Jon Anderson, and I'm a third year directing student at Columbia College Chicago. Brain Teaser--though through the lens of a much different character than myself--is a deeply personal film, as it tackles a lot of the struggles I dealt with in my last two years here at film school. I've always been extremely hard on myself, which has made the prospect of failure much more difficult to accept than it should be. I would find myself despairing because I wasn't good enough, and getting angry at myself for not being better. But we all know what it's like to fail, and we all know what it's like to fail a lot, over and over again. My hope with this film is to reach those who have either struggled or are struggling now to find genuine purpose from within, and to expose the ridiculous things we sometimes tell ourselves to prevent us from being satisfied with who we are. In order to make this a reality though, we need your help! Any amount you donate will help bring us one step closer to achieving the professional look and feel necessary for this film to be seen by the masses. So not only will you be supporting the aspirations of a gifted crew of hardworking film students, but because of you, something beautiful and transformative will come into existence. Beautiful! Transformative! Because of you!

What We Need & What You Get
Our total budget for this film is right around the $4000 mark, which is actually quite modest for a production of this scale. Your contribution will go primarily toward feeding our dedicated cast and crew, providing transportation of equipment and personnel to and from set, creating an expressive yet believable environment through costuming and production design, as well as a variety of smaller logistical costs like securing locations and backing up footage once everything is shot.
In exchange for your generosity and support, I have a few perks to offer--many of which are unique keepsakes from set--which I hope will serve as a heartfelt reminder of the very special artistic achievement you were able to make possible.

Risks & Challenges
As with any production, professional or otherwise, there are always risks, and things are guaranteed to go awry in some way or another. The beauty of this medium though is that with careful preparation and a team of sharp, talented individuals, we can overcome any obstacle that is thrown our way.
With this being said, the biggest challenge we face with this production in particular is going to be with time. There is a good amount of story to cover and only four days to do it, so between selecting the best shots and staging the more difficult ones, the clock will be constantly ringing in my ear like a glockenspiel.
Nevertheless though, this will be the fourth film I've directed at Columbia on a larger scale, and my entire crew has spent immeasurable hours practicing their craft and mastering their abilities on set, so I have the upmost confidence in our adaptive abilities.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you're not able to support us financially but would still like to help make this project a reality, do us a huge favor and share our Indiegogo page with the world on social media! It never hurts to get people excited about an interesting upcoming film, and you never know who's got a rich uncle in Luxembourg out there somewhere.

story:
My name is Elese Moran, I am a graduate student at the Academy of Arts and was raped over a year ago. Instead of suffering in silence, I decided to open up the conversation to my community and gather information that not only will help me, but help over 63 million survivors in the US.  The story will end with imagining reparation for survivors in the future. Conversations will even include men who are exploring new ways to think about consent. I am looking to complete a first round documentary that will be submitted for UCLA’s gender studies conference in January and will be continuing research and interviews for the next 5 years. The goal is to record and document as many stories as a I can statistically and map the issues scientifically. This will be an initial step to a much larger project. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

Outlined Budget

Contracting and Consulting Services:

  • Illustrations and production: $1,000

Travel:

  • Interview 1 - $50
  • Interview 2 - $25
  • Interview 3 - $25
  • Interview 4 - $25
  • Interview 5 - $25
  • Interview 6 - $800 (Oregon) 

Equipment:

  • Second camera: $3,000 
  • Three lights: $700
  • Lavalier:  $150 
  • Recorder: $179

Salaries and Wages: 

  • Project Director:  $3,000 per month for two months 

Total budget needed at this time is $11,979. All supporters will have free entry into the premier showing of the documentary. This documentary is also being supported by moviesmakingadifference.org and will qualify as a 503c non-profit donation and a great end of year tax right off, please ask me about specifics.
